1) Star Lanes - a strategy/resource management game set in space. You are auditioning to be the new Imperial Advisor on Economic Affairs for the Galactic Empire.

2) Romulan - A cross between a space shooter and Battleship, you're trying to find and shoot down a cloaked Romulan ship (from Star Trek)

3) Star Wars - This seems to be the "classic" Star Wars game created just after the original movie's release. You move your gun sights until you line up with the TIE Fighters, and then blow them away. Probably inspired by the scene in the movie where Luke and Han man the gunner turrets in the Millennium Falcon.

4) Ultra Trek - Yet another variety of the classic Star Trek mainframe game, where you need to defeat a certain number of Klingon ships in a certain number of turns using your phasers and photon torpedoes.
title: Space Games-3

description:
Timequest is a pure text adventure for the TRS-80 in the spirit of the Scott Adams' classic text adventures. The author William Demas was a co-author of Scott Adams' Adventure #12: Golden Voyage.

As the title implies, this is an adventure through time, starting in present-day England, going back into the pre-historic era, and then going forward into the future. Collect treasures and solve puzzles to win.
title: Timequest

description: Airmail Pilot is an arcade game for the TRS-80. The player takes control of a Curtis JN4-D (Jenny) tasked with delivering mail from Columbus, Ohio to Chicago, Illinois. Played from a behind perspective, the player can control their aircraft in the 4 cardinal directions. As the player flies, intermittent poor weather will drive their plane vertically and horizontally, and the player must correct for these aberrations. The player must evade freak thunderstorms. The player also has a fuel gauge, and must make stops at airports along their route to Chicago to refuel, to avoid crashing. The player must carefully land on a runway as it appears on the bottom of the screen, and if they miss, they must fly on. The goal is to complete the mail run safely in as little time as possible.
title: Airmail Pilot

description:
Ting-Tong! is a 1 - 2 player Pong clone for the TRS-80.

Players move a paddle vertically on the side of the screen, attempting to deflect a bouncing ball. In a single player game, the player competes against a backstop, while in the two player game, a player controls the paddle on each side. Speed levels from 1 - 7 are available. The game keeps track of the current score.
title: Ting-Tong!

description:
Tenpin is a 1 - 4 player bowling game for the TRS-80.

Player from a bowler's perspective, 1 - 4 players can play a game of ten pin bowling. Each game is 10 frames. The player bowls by lining up the bowling ball and releasing the ball. The player receives points based upon the number of pins knocked down.
title: Tenpin

description:
Demise is a side-scrolling science-fiction themed shooter for the TRS-80.

The player controls a spaceship which can move in all directions, and fire horizontally to the right. The player must destroy all enemy hostiles with their laser cannon, and are also equipped with a limited supply of smart bombs which destroy all enemies on the screen. The player can also enter hyperspace to randomly move about the screen if in danger.

After defeating all enemies, the player enters a meteor phase, where they must avoid all encroaching space debris. In the third stage, the player must navigate a twisty tunnel, before restarting on a more challenging alien combat phase.

The player starts with 5 ships, and is rewarded an additional ship and smart bomb every 10,000 points.
title: Demise

alternate_titles.title: Space War: Real Time Space Battle in Machine Language

description:
Space War is a 2-player space fighter for the TRS-80.

Two players each control a spaceship orbiting a large heavenly body. The gravitational pull of this sun causes the players to orbit about the center of the screen. Players can rotate clockwise or counterclockwise, accelerate, fire, and enter hyperspace. Hyperspace teleports the player randomly about the screen. The goal is to shoot down the enemy vessel without crashing into the sun, and the program keeps track of score. Players can choose from 5 types of gameplay, as well as 3 speeds of ship movement and missile movement.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Player Crashes into the Sun

title: Space War

description:
Pinball is a basic pinball simulation for the TRS-80.

The player controls the left and right paddle individually, and attempts to keep the pinball in play for as long as possible with the goal to maximize score. There is only a single board, and the player gets a total of 3 balls.
title: Pinball

description:
Basketball is a 1 - 2 player basketball game for the TRS-80.

A 1 on 1 basketball game, where each basket is worth 2 points. Each game is 5 minutes in length, and there are 5 levels of computer difficulty. Two players can also compete for basketball dominance. Players can take the ball from their opponent, and can take a shot on the basket when close.
title: Basketball

description:
Astroball is space-themed pinball game for the TRS-80.

The player competes with a pinball machine containing an alien spaceship and numerous rocket-ships. The player controls the left and right paddle individually, and attempts to keep the pinball in play for as long as possible with the goal to maximize score. There is only a single board, and the player gets a total of 5 balls.
title: Astroball

description:
Alien Invasion is a 1-player Space Invaders clone for the TRS-80.

At the outer ranges of the known universe, far beyond what we can see with out earth based telescopes lies a galaxy 100 times our own. From their, the warlike Archons using their tachyon based telescopes have detected Earth. A lottery was held, and 24 lucky Archons have been chosen to spearhead the invasion of Earth.

The player controls a spaceship which can move left and right, and fire vertically. The player confronts 24 alien vessels aligned in 4 rows of 6 vessels. The alien vessels fire upon the player, moving horizontally, while slowly approaching the bottom of the screen. Barriers at the bottom of the screen help block enemy fire. The player must shoot down all 24 vessels before they reach their location. The player has a total of 5 ships, and when all are lost it's game over.
title: Alien Invasion

description:
Space-Rock! is an Asteroids clone for the TRS-80 for 1 - 2 players.

The player controls a small spaceship at the center of the screen, which can rotate 360 degrees, fire, and thrust. The spaceship can also jump to hyperspace, randomly teleporting to a new location. The player is harassed by a number of asteroids which break into additional progressively smaller pieces as they are shot, until the smallest pieces are destroyed. Space bombs, which must be shot before their counter reaches 0 and alien space vessels also harass the player. The player has a total of 3 lives, and when all are lost, it's game over. The player chooses from 10 levels of difficulty.
title: Space-Rock!

description:
Duel-N-Droids is a 1-player fencing game for the TRS-80.

Two androids face off in a sword battle, and only one can emerge victorious. Players control their droid by stepping to or from their opponent, and have the option to parry or thrust. There are a total of 7 progressively more difficult levels of opponents. The player can practice against a specific opponent, or can enter tournament mode where they must fight all 7 levels in succession at a more difficult level. The robot who is hit first loses.
title: Duel-N-Droids

description:
Pigskin is a 1 - 2 player American football simulation for the TRS-80.

The field is seen from a top-down perspective, and players take turns choosing from 11 offensive plays and 7 defensive formations. A player can compete against a computer or a human opponent, or compete against themselves. There are 5 difficulty levels to choose from against the computer. The ball's movement is graphically displayed on the screen, but field players do not appear. The game follows basic American football rules, and there is a save/restore feature for games in progress.
title: Pigskin

description:
Bandito is a 1-player slot machine game for the TRS-80.

A slot machine is graphically displayed on the screen, and the player can decide how much money they start with. Each pull of the handle costs the player one dollar. Slot machine symbols including heart, acorn, Liberty Bell, club, and bandit hat appear. The player receives a payout if the right symbols appear. Gameplay continues until the player runs out of money.
title: Bandito

description:
Swamp War is 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character who can move in the 4 cardinal directions and shoot. The player moves about a swamp avoiding slizards, whom appear and shoot at the player. There are 9 separate screens attached to form a square, and the player can move about these screens collecting triangle-shaped teleporters, which allow the player to warp to another screen if they are in danger. If the player destroys all slizards on a level, they move on to a more difficult swamp. There are 4 difficulty levels, and the player starts with 3 lives.
title: Swamp War

description:
Space Shuttle is a simulation of landing the Columbia space shuttle for the TRS-80.

The player is situated in the cockpit of the Columbia space shuttle. The player has 3 landing options; starting from orbit, entering the atmosphere, or a short distance from the runway. Players can control the shuttle's thrusters in space, and as they go below 58 miles altitude can control the pitch, roll, yaw, speedbrakes, and landing gear of their vessel. Time progresses in 10 second intervals as the player manually enters corrections for their craft. The player must be careful controlling their descent through the atmosphere to avoid burning up or deflecting off into space. The player must line up the runway and ensure they land safely. The current altitude, speed, heading, position, and temperature of their aircraft is displayed on the screen.
title: Space Shuttle

description:
This is a compilation of three games:

  • Knight's Quest is a role-playing game in which the player plays a young knight of the Kingdom of Norsax. The knight has just come of age to partake in their first quest. The king will ask to either retrieve the Gold Chalice from the Mountain Demon or the Gold Anchor from the Sea Demon. The player must move to different locations in the kingdom by following roads, and it takes them 1 day to travel to a new location on the map. As the player moves, they can encounter foes, who can be challenged to combat, or may challenge to player to battle. If the player is successful they receive silver coins, but also take damage dependent on their own reputation and the monster's strength. These silver coins can be used to restore the player's strength, as they heal if they spend more than one day in a location. The player can encounter healing springs which increase the rate of healing. The player can also encounter monasteries, which may grant a silver dagger that can automatically win a combat. As the player explores, they will learn the location of their true foe, and if victorious in combat, can return their treasure to the castle in the center of the map. The quest is over when the player returns to the castle or is killed.

  • Robot Chase is a version of Chase. The player is inside a large arena surrounded by enemy robots. Many high voltage tiles are present and the player must try to lure the robots into those tiles to take them out.

  • Horse Race is a horse betting game in which the player can bet on five horses.
title: Knight's Quest / Robot Chase / Horse Race

description:
Chessmate-80 is a 1-player versus computer chess game for the TRS-80.

An early computerized chess opponent, the player competes against an opponent with several levels of difficulty. Moves are placed via keyboard commands, and all moves are graphically displayed. Follows international chess rules.
title: Chessmate-80

description:
Vegas is a 1 - 2 player competitive slots game.

Two competitors are at Mac's Bar for a game of luck. Each player takes a turn inserting one dollar into a slot machine. The two players and the bartender are graphically displayed on the screen. Two of a kind pays $2, 3 of a kind pays $5, and three "*" or "$" pays $10. Each play costs $1. Gameplay ends when one player runs out of money.
title: Vegas

description:
Trap is a 2-player arcade strategy game for the TRS-80.

Two players control moving characters that leave a progressively longer tail behind them. If the player runs into an object, they are automatically deflected at 90 degrees, presuming there is still space for them to move. The goal is to trap the opponent so that they can not move, causing them to lose the game. The players can optionally have barriers on the map, and can choose to start with 5 shots to free themselves when stuck. There are 3 different speeds available. The game keeps track of each player's wins and losses, and both players use the same keyboard.
title: Trap

description:
Ski Racer is a 1 - 10 player text-based arcade skiing game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a skier who rapidly moves down a hill, and must slalom between flags on the left and right. There are several levels of difficulty that determine the distance between flags, allowing the player to simulate slalom, giant slalom, straight gates, or randomly placed gates. In multiplayer games, each player runs 3 races, with the winner being the best total time of all 3 races. Every missed flag costs the player 5 seconds, and a perfect race is always 21.6 seconds.
title: Ski Racer

description:
Shootout is a 2-player game that challenges reaction time for the TRS-80.

Two cowboys walk towards each other, and when they reach a random point, both will stop. The first player to hit the fire button at this point will shoot the head off their opponent. The game tracks who wins and loses through the session.
title: Shootout

description:
Othello is an implementation of the board game for the TRS-80.

The player and a computer opponent by the name of Aldaron compete on an 8 x 8 board in a game of Othello. Playing pieces are graphically displayed on the screen, and the player and computer take turns playing square or X playing pieces. 10 levels of computer difficulty are available. The computer keeps track of the score over multiple games.
title: Othello

description:
Oil Tycoon is a text-based 2-player competitive simulation of the oil industry for the TRS-80.

Each player takes control of an oil company, and must compete to maximize profits. Each turn, a player can choose to explore for oil, and if successful can set up drilling operations. There are options to spend money on research and development, which can optimize future drilling by reducing costs and increasing probability of finding oil. Players can set the price which they try to sell their oil, and can see their current oil flow and oil reserves. Players can suffer random setbacks including a well blowout or a tanker spill.
title: Oil Tycoon

description:
Haunted House is a speed typing and guessing game for the TRS-80.

You have been magically transported to a room somewhere within the gloomy interior of a haunted mansion.

At the beginning of the game, the player can choose either a cross to ward off vampires, a cane to defend from werewolves, or a candle to defeat ghosts. The player must escape through a predetermined number of rooms, and each room has three exits. One exit is safe, while the other two contain either a ghost, a vampire, or a werewolf. If the player encounters an enemy they do not have the correct warding device for, they must quickly type the appropriate defensive spell: "stake" for vampires, "light" for ghosts, or "fleas" for werewolves. If the player misspells the word, or does not type fast enough, they are defeated and it's game over. The player must try to escape through all rooms to freedom.
title: Haunted House

description:
Bridge is the card games of the same name published for the TRS-80.

A 1-player text-based bridge game written in BASIC, in which the player is joined by a computer partner against two computer opponents in the game of contract bridge. Only no-trump contracts are played, and bidding is handled internally with unsuitable deals automatically thrown out. The declarer and the computer play defense.
title: Bridge

description: TRS-80 Checkers is a single-player versus computer board game for the TRS-80. It has graphical representations of checkers, which allows the player to set the board as a new game or whatever configuration they wish. The human player is always white, while the computer is black. All moves are via text commands. The game follows international rules, where if an option to take a player's piece is available, the player must move.
title: TRS-80 Checkers

description:
Cross-Out is a 1-player peg solitaire game for the TRS-80.

In peg solitaire, players move pieces on a board filled with pegs. There is one space missing at the beginning of each game, and the player eliminates pegs by jumping a piece with another peg and placing it in an empty spot. The goal is to eliminate all pieces but one. Game contains a single 7 x 7 cross, and all moves are placed via text-commands. Only legal moves are permitted, and the game is over if the player tries to type three illegal moves in a row.
title: Cross-Out

description:
Draw Poker is a 1-player versus computer card game for the TRS-80.

The player and computer each start with $1000, with the maximum ante per round being $10. The player starts with 5 cards, and is given a single opportunity to ante prior to discarding 1 - 5 cards. After this, the player and computer have one opportunity to raise, before showing cards. Gameplay continues until one player is broke. All commands are via text entry.
title: Draw Poker

description:
3-D Tic-Tac-Toe is a 1-player versus computer 3-D tic-tac-toe game for the TRS-80.

The player challenges the computer, which has 4 different difficulty levels, to a game of 3-D tic-tac-toe. Players take turns playing Xs and Os, and the first person to score 3 (or 4) in a row wins the game. Points can be scored in the x, y, and z axis. All commands are via text input, and graphically displayed on the screen.
title: 3-D Tic-Tac-Toe

description: Death Dreadnaught is a science fiction themed text adventure game for the TRS-80. The player has found themselves stranded on a spaceship filled with the gory remains of their former comrades. The player must explore the ship, avoiding the dangerous aliens that lurk about, and escape to safety. To accomplish this, the player must locate batteries, fresh food, oxygen, and fuel for the escape pod, as well as open the doors to the escape hatch. All commands are via VERB NOUN text entry, and there is no save or restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Crewman Hangs from the Rafters

title: Death Dreadnaught

description:
The Domes of Kilgari is a science fiction themed text adventure for the TRS-80.

The player has run out of fuel and crash landed on the surface of the desert planet Kilgari. The player must explore the nearby ion generating power planet, and outsmart the security measures and alien creatures that infest the plant. Finally, at the heart of the installation, they come across the fuel rods for their vessel, but also trip the plant's self-destruct mechanism. As the player escapes from the factory, they must return to their vessel and quickly blast to safety as the planet below bursts into flames.

All commands are via VERB NOUN text entry, and there is no save or restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Find a Miniature Rubber monster in the Rectangle

title: The Domes of Kilgari

description:
Temple of the Sun is a text-based adventure game for the TRS-80.

As a student of ancient magical orders, you have accidentally discovered clues leading you to the long buried Cult of the Shaman, an extremely powerful order of wizards whose influence shaped Indian culture in the Western Hemisphere for countless centuries.

Now, standing before the Shamans' most sacred shrine, you have a burning desire to fit together the remaining parts of the puzzle. The only way to do that is to become as the ancients, to become, in a trial of courage, a Shaman.

All commands are via VERB NOUN text entry, and there is no save or restore feature. The player must explore the halls of the Temple of the Sun, and carefully examine all rooms to gather items for the ritual. The location of many items is randomized. The player also risks encountering deadly snakes and jaguars, which can prematurely end the adventure. After gathering the required items to complete the ritual, the player can become a Shaman, and then must escape to freedom.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Have Become a Shaman.  Congradulations!
I Find a Knapsack to Carry my Goods
Outside the Temple, I Need a Flashlight

title: Temple of the Sun

description:
Spider Mountain Adventure is an early text adventure for the TRS-80.

You are a knight stationed at the base of Spider Mountain, and your goal is gather the four treasures hidden beneath the tavern of an abandoned village. As the player explores the surface, they can encounter orcs, but they leave the player alone if unprovoked. The player must discover how to explore beneath the tavern, and there must locate a gold ring, mithril arming doublets, a sack of gold ducats, and a jewel. Upon locating these four items, the player must return them to the tavern, receiving their final score if all items are dropped.

All commands are via VERB NOUN text entry, and there is a save and restore feature.
title: Spider Mountain Adventure

description:
Sword of Roshon is an interactive fiction story for the TRS-80.

The player takes the role of Josh, who is transported to another land with his dog Grover to help the Lizardman Oracan defeat the evil rulers of the land Dalmark and Marelda. The player is presented with a number of multiple choice situations to advance the story, and must choose the correct directions to survive their adventure.
title: Sword of Roshon

description:
Magic Carpet is an interactive fiction story for the TRS-80.

The player takes the role of David, who is transported to another land with the help of a magical carpet. The player is presented with a number of multiple choice situations to advance the story, and must choose the correct directions to survive their adventure.
title: Magic Carpet

description:
Devil's Palace is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

The player has arrived just outside of the Devil's palace, surrounded by a moat of red hot lava. The player must infiltrate the palace and recover a number of treasures including the Devil's crown, wand, and scepter. The player will face numerous dangers, including the dog Cerebrus, unstable bridges, and crystal guardians. Ultimately, the player must defeat the evil within the palace and escape to safety.

All commands are via VERB NOUN text entry. Most puzzles are inventory based, and there is a a save and restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Removed Evil from the Palace

title: Devil's Palace

description:
Curse of the Sasquatch is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

The player has been carried to a small shack somewhere in Alaska, the reason and means for this unclear. The player must survive the freezing cold of the Alaskan winter, and explore the nearby mountains and caverns beneath the shack they start in. Ultimately, the player must discover the true nature of the Sasquatch which has been haunting this part of the north.

All commands are via VERB NOUN text entry. Most puzzles are inventory based, and there is no save and restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: Heading to the Caverns Beneath the Shack

title: Curse of the Sasquatch

description:
World's Edge is a text adventure game for the TRS-80.

Smog problems have reached critical proportions. The people of Earth desperately need 2.2 kg of APC-80 to absorb all of this air pollution. Spectrographic analysis indicates that this mineral is only available on Planet AW-8, orbiting Alpha Centauri. Inhabitants of AW-8 will try to prevent you from succeeding, for the mineral is central to their religious beliefs.

The player starts on their Earth farm, using their rocket ship disguised as a silo to land on the alien planet. There, they must explore the swamps and caves of wilderness on the surface of the planet to find their way into the city of Polarizon. Upon entering the city, the player must outsmart the local guards, steal the required crystals, and escape back to Earth.

All commands are via VERB NOUN commands, and there is a save and restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: Snatching the Crystals from the Bank

title: World's Edge

description:
Sewers of Moscow is the third in a series of adult-themed text-based "Misadventures".

The player is a secret agent representing the U.N., who has parachuted to the outskirts of Moscow in an attempt to stop World War III. The Soviets have created a dangerous new weapon, which the player must destroy. During their adventure, the player must explore the sewers and subway system of Moscow, navigating a number of seemingly identical passageways. Eventually, the player infiltrates the secret Soviet base, where they must attempt to deactivate the weapons system.

All commands are vie VERB NOUN entry. There is no save or restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: Falling Again.  You Probably get Knocked Unconscious like 5 Times in this Adventure

title: Sewers of Moscow

description:
Bomber is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a bomber, that takes turns flying from the right or the left of the screen at different altitudes. The player can drop 1 bomb per pass, with the goal of clearing out a canyon full of rubble below. If the player misses rubble, or fails to drop a bomb, it is considered a miss. Victory is clearing the entire chasm, but if the player receives 3 misses, then it's game over. There are 4 different canyons to choose from.
title: Bomber

description:
Duck Hunter is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player is hiding in their duck blind with their gun at the ready as ducks flutter by. The gun will be directed vertically or at a 45 degree angle to the left or right. The player must carefully time their shots to hit the ducks as they fly past, and if hit, the duck spirals to the ground. Each player gets 25 shots per game, and the winner is the player who shoots the most ducks.
title: Duck Hunter

description:
Grand Prix is a top-down 1-player arcade racing game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a racecar, which must complete a 2 mile circuit on a long winding track. The player must try to make as few moves as possible as the track scrolls by, as 0.2 seconds are lost every time the player moves. The player loses 2 seconds if they go off the track, and 1 second if they skid out by turning too fast. The goal is to minimize time, and the player competes against previous race times.
title: Grand Prix

description:
Pyramids is a 1-player peg solitaire game for the TRS-80.

In peg solitaire, players move pieces on a board filled with pegs. There is one space missing at the beginning of each game, and the player eliminates pegs by jumping a piece with another peg and placing it in an empty spot. The goal is to eliminate all pieces but one. This game is played on a 15 piece pyramid-shaped board, where the player can choose which piece is first removed. Only legal moves are permitted, but there is no detection when the game is complete.
title: Pyramids

description:
Ten Pin Bowling is a 1 - 2 player bowling game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a bowling ball on the left side of the screen that moves up and down. When the ball is in the desired position, the player can release the ball. The ball can travel straight, or can receive spin to the left or the right. Each game has 10 frames, with 2 balls per frame. Score is calculated at the top of the screen.
title: Ten Pin Bowling

description:
Germany 1942 is a text-based adventure game for the TRS-80.

The year is 1942. It was your 26th mission as an RAF gunner, when your bomber was shot down over Germany. You alone managed to parachute to safety as your plane went down. Your mission is to escape safely to England.

The player starts alone in a German forest, hiding from enemy forces. The player must hide their identity, and discover the means to escape back home. All commands are via VERN NOUN entry, and there are several inventory-based puzzles. There is a save and restore feature available.
title: Germany 1942

description:
Ruins at Time's Edge is a text adventure game for the TRS-80.

You are Jagar - barbarian, thief, mercenary, and treasure seeker. You have arrived at the Ruins at Time's edge, where you have heard rumors that the world's largest diamond lies hidden within. You must infiltrate the ruins, and evade the horrors within. You must explore lands outside of time, and locate the lost diamond. This must then be returned to the player's starting area. All commands are via VERN NOUN entry, and there are several inventory-based puzzles. There is a save and restore feature available.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Grotesque Statue Offers a Clue

title: Ruins at Time's Edge

description:
Space Hunt is a short text adventure for the TRS-80.

The player controls an astronaut stationed on a lunar colony. He must travel vie his spaceship to an asteroid to find a treasure. All commands are via VERN NOUN entry, and there are a few inventory-based puzzles. There is a save and restore feature available.
title: Space Hunt

description:
Quest for Fire is a text adventure game for the TRS-80.

You have tracked the elusive Emerald of Fire to a long forgotten pyramid deep within the jungle. As an experienced treasure hunter, you must find a way to infiltrate the pyramid, avoid the traps that have been set for would be thieves, and return the emerald to the starting point outside the pyramid. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there are several inventory-based puzzles. There is a save and restore feature available.

sample_screenshots.caption: Tossing my Coconut off a Cliff
I Enter the Pyramid and Encounter a Safe
I Found the Emerald of Fire

title: Quest for Fire

description:
End Zone is a 2-player text-based American football simulation for the TRS-80.

Gameplay closely follows American football rules and plays in four 15 minute quarters, coin toss, and kickoff. . For each play, the offensive and defensive play choose from a list of plays, and the computer then automatically displays the results of plays on the screen, including successful passes and yards gained or lost. All current ball and player movements are displayed on the screen.
title: End Zone

description:
Pillbox is a 1 - 2 player side-view artillery game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a randomly placed pillbox, which are separated by a large mountain. Each player tries to shoot the opposing pillbox by typing in the angle and velocity of their shot. The player can compete against another human opponent or the computer. After a pillbox is hit, the location is again randomized. The first player to hit their opponent 5 times is the winner.
title: Pillbox

description: Tank is a two-player game where two tanks try to race around a playing field running over numbers that randomly appear. Each number adds points to your score, and the highest score wins when the time runs out.
title: Tank

description:
Clash is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a knight with lance atop a large dragon. Gameplay allows for 1-player or 2-player cooperative. The player can move rapidly left and right, but can also flap their dragon's wings to raise up in the air. Numerous enemies appear, and the player must destroy them by jumping on top. If they run into an enemy from the side, they are thrown from their mount. If thrown from their mount, the player must quickly attempt to recapture their dragon before hitting another enemy and perishing. There are a variety of enemies, including: vultures, cave spiders, and dark bats. The player must avoid landing on spikes, and can pick up gems for bonus points. The player gains an extra mount at 5000 and multiples of 10,000 points. There are 4 levels of difficulty.
title: Clash

description:
Jovian is a top down scrolling space-themed arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a spaceship which can travel in the four cardinal directions, and fire directly forwards. The player starts in a small spaceport, and their goal is to destroy all of the pods on the alien space station to advance to the next level. The station can be located by using a scanner, and the player must avoid dangers including fast aliens, slow aliens, mines, and asteroids. The ship has four different speeds, and there are 3 sectors of increasing difficulty.

The player starts with five spaceships, and gains an additional ship every 20,000 points. The game is over when all ships are lost.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Fly Past the Enemy Station-

title: Jovian

description:
Baja Race is an arcade racing game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small Baja buggy from a top-down perspective, which can move left and right, as well as accelerate and decelerate. The player races continually forwards, and must avoid obstacles, and safely navigate the twists and turns in the track. The player's goal is to reach the finish line in the minimum amount of time with as few crashes as possible. There are ten levels of difficulty, and the player receives a final score based upon their driving performance.
title: Baja Race

description:
Cyborg is a scrolling science-fiction themed arcade game for the TRS-80.

You control a cyborg aboard an alien spaceship. Each level is a large scrolling maze that extends in all directions, and the player can move in the cardinal directions. The player's cyborg has four speeds, and is armed with a high energy shield which can be temporarily activated to destroy enemy robots and mines if the player comes in contact. The goal on each level is to collect all the signal modules within a limited time frame to proceed to the next complex. To aid this, the cyborg is armed with a sensor to help locate these modules.

There are 4 difficulty levels available, and the player has a total of 5 vehicles.

sample_screenshots.caption: An Enemy Robot is Present to the Left
Starting the Maze.  Signal Modules and Mines can be Seen.
I Have Lost all Five Lives

title: Cyborg

description:
Digout is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Plays similar to the arcade game Dig Dug. The player controls a small character in the center of the screen, while enemy creatures move about in available spaces. The player can move through solid ground leaving tunnels behind, and the enemies can intermittently dig through the dirt as well. Each enemy takes five hits to destroy, but becomes stunned while the player shoots at them. The goal for each level is to destroy all present enemies to move to a more difficult challenge. The player has a total of three lives, and loses one if struck by an enemy.
title: Digout

description:
Fury is a 1 or 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small spaceship which can rotate 360 degrees, and fire in the direction it is facing. The player is able to apply thrust to propel their craft forwards, and can also warp about the screen to a random location. The player and enemies can also loop off one side of the screen and appear on the opposite. On each level, the player's goal is to destroy all enemy vessels with increasingly difficult alien waves. Levels occur in a pattern, where the first level consists of a number of fast moving vessels that flit randomly about the screen. The second level consists of vessels that home in on the player, initially in 4 parts, they combine at a center area, and then move about randomly. The third wave consists of an alien base, whose shield must be shot out and destroyed. These three level types then repeat at progressively higher difficulty. The player gains a bonus score for finishing a level quickly, and has a total of three spaceships.

sample_screenshots.caption: Enemy Vessels Home on my Location

title: Fury

description:
Gauntlet is an science-fiction themed arcade game for the TRS-80.

An alien spacecraft has landed in San Francisco, and the aliens within have started an assault on the city. The player must move through the gauntlet, and shoot all of the alien menaces. Progressively more difficult aliens continue to spew from the sides of the maze, and occasionally fire back at the player. The player has a total of 3 lives, and loses one if they come in contact with an alien.
title: Gauntlet

description:
The Liberator is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player must rescue humans from the alien menace by navigating a number of difficult platforms. Plays similar to the arcade game Donkey Kong, where on many levels the player must jump over barrels thrown from the alien atop the screen to reach the human stranded nearby. Other levels require the player to stand on a number of platforms while avoiding alien slimes. The player starts with 5 lives, and loses these from touching alien creatures, barrels, or falling from great height.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 2 - I Have to Collect all 8 Squares While Avoiding Alien Slimes
Level 1 - The Alien Thows Barrels At Me

title: The Liberator

description:
Moon Rover is a 1 - 4 player science-fiction themed side-scroller for the TRS-80.

The player controls a moon rover, which rapidly speeds to the right. It has the ability to move horizontally, fire vertically, and has the ability to jump. The player must carefully jump pits, as well as avoid fire from alien vessels above and the mines they drop. The player moves to progressively more difficult sectors, and if they are destroyed, they restart in that sector. The player starts with 5 cars, and if all are lost, it's game over.
title: Moon Rover

description:
Leaper is Frogger clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a frog, who must cross a busy highway while avoiding cars and trucks. They must then cross a raging river by jumping across logs and lilypads. The goal is to place all frogs within their home at the top of the screen, at which point the player progresses to a more difficult challenge. The player starts with three frogs, and if all are lost, it's game over.
title: Leaper

description:
Chicken is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a chicken whom can move left and right, who tries to cross a busy 10-lane highway. The player must navigate between spaces in traffic to try to cross to the other side unharmed. The player starts with 3 chickens, and gains an additional chicken every 2500 points. There are 999 time units to cross the highway, and the score for each crossing is based upon remaining time. If the player spends too much time between highways, an ambulance will cross and strike the chicken. When all chickens are lost, it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Struck by an Ambulance in the Median

title: Chicken

description:
Panik is a side-scrolling science fiction-themed arcade game for the TRS-80

Trapped in an enemy building site, and out of ammo, the evil Mzors rapidly close in. The player controls a small character who can move horizontally on a series of platforms that scroll horizontally. The player is armed with a small laser gun, but initially has no ammo and must pick up ammo packs as he explores the level. Ladders allow the player to move up and down. The goal is to destroy as many varied aliens as possible, but if the enemy touches the player they lose a life. The player starts with 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Panik

description:
Talking Adventure 1: Forbidden Planet Part 1 is a text-based adventure game for the TRS-80, but uses the TRS-80's voice synthesizer to play audio for several sections.

A blaring klaxon awakens the player from slumber within their survival pod. Their ship is on a collision course with an oncoming planetoid, and the autopilot is non-functional. The player must repair their ship's autopilot to survive the oncoming landing. The player lands in what appears to be a medieval fantasy land, but across a great lake they see an ultramodern city. After contending with centaurs, ogres, and other dangerous creatures, the player must summon a ferryman to take them to the modern city.

All commands are via VERB NOUN text entry. The player must gather items to solve inventory-based puzzles, and there is a save/restore feature available.

sample_screenshots.caption: I See a City in the Distance

title: Talking Adventure 1: Forbidden Planet Part 1

description:
Dungeon Escape is a 1-player role playing game for the TRS-80.

The player's goal is to escape from a series of dungeons by navigating progressively more difficult levels. The goal on each level is to collect the required number of stones, and return to the starting point of the level, allowing access to the next challenge.

The player can choose from 3 different classes: fighter, thief, or mage. The fighter has unparalleled combat strength, but cannot cast spells. The mage starts with a number of spells, but is weak. The thief can cast spells, but starts with none, and has moderate combat strength. The player can set the game speed, and can also choose to have ghosts, which will chase the player through the dungeon and end their lives instantly if they come in contact with the player.

Each level consists of a series of rooms connected by corridors. Within each room, the player may find a trap, a combat encounter, or a stone. The player may also find items in each room, including gold, magic spells, improved armor and weapons, healing elixirs, or magic maps. The player may also encounter leprechauns, which can steal the player's map, making them move blind until they discover a new map. Gold serves to increase the player's score. Magic spells consist of teleport, which moves the player randomly about the map, fireball, which causes massive damage to an enemy, and locate stone, which shows the location of all stones on the level. The player also has the ability to save their game for a later outing, and to commit harakiri if they are unhappy with their game.

During combat, the player can encounter 1 to several enemies, all of whom attack the player one at a time. One enemy and the player take turns swinging at each other. The player can attack, parry, or thrust each round, and can also utilize magic spells and heal. Combat is timed, and if the player attempts a command during the enemy's turn, they will lose the proceeding turn allowing the monster an additional strike.
title: Dungeon Escape

description:
Assault! is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small ATV in the center of the screen which can fire forwards and backwards. The vessel has 4 speeds, and can move in the four cardinal directions, while the screen can scroll vertically and horizontally. The player must explore the maze and destroy all mushrooms present within. The player is hunted by a giant spider, which lays baby spiders, and continuously moves towards the player. The giant spider cannot be destroyed, but it will be stunned if shot. The spider progressively speeds up as its babies are destroyed. Players can destroy walls and mountains to create new paths to travel. Bags of gold are dispersed throughout the maze, and destroying these causes the player to lose points. The player can set the difficulty level from A - Z which controls enemy speed, but also the terrain they play on. The player starts with 5 ATVs, and it's game over if all are lost.
title: Assault!

description:
Talking Adventure 2: Forbidden Planet Part II - Forbidden City is a text-based adventure game for the TRS-80, but uses the TRS-80's voice synthesizer to play audio for several sections.

In the previous adventure, the player had just gained access to an ultramodern city, and has just prepared to learn the secrets within. The player finds themselves within a large city populated by homicidal robots. The player must explore the city to gather weapons to battle the robots, and learn how to navigate the city via monorail. The player must ultimately gain access to a spaceship hidden within the city, power it with nuclear material, and blast off to safety.

All commands are via VERB NOUN text entry. The player must gather items to solve inventory-based puzzles, and there is a save/restore feature available.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Gain Access to the Monorail
Encountering the First of MANY Robots

title: Talking Adventure #2: Forbidden Planet Part II - Forbidden City

description:
Bounceoids is a science-fiction themed arcade game for the TRS-80.

Gameplay is similar to the more famous Asteroids, where the player controls a small ship which can rotate 360 degrees and fire forwards. The ship can accelerate to move, and also has a shield which can offer temporary invincibility. The player must shoot a variety of asteroids and alien menaces. There are a total of 10 difficulty levels which control the size, shape, and speed of asteroids. The player starts with 3 ships, and the skill level increases and a new ship is awarded every 10,000 points. Every 20,000 points brings on a bonus stage.
title: Bounceoids

description:
Tunnelman is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Plays similar to the arcade game Dig Dug. The player controls a small character in the center of the screen, while enemy creatures move about in available spaces. The player can move through solid ground leaving tunnels behind, and the enemies can intermittently become ghosts and move through the ground to attack the player. Each enemy takes five hits to destroy, but becomes stunned while the player shoots at them. The goal for each level is to destroy all present enemies to move to a more difficult challenge. Rocks can be used to crush enemies, and gold can be picked up for bonus points. The player has a total of three lives, and loses one if struck by an enemy.
title: Tunnelman

description:
Alien Defense is a 1 - 2 player side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a spacecraft which can move in all directions, but can only fire horizontally left and right. The ship is armed with a warp drive that will move it randomly about the screen, and smart bombs which will destroy all enemies on the screen. The player confronts 6 types of enemies who move rapidly about the screen and fire upon the player. There are 15 men represented by the letter I along the bottom of the screen, which must be protected from the aliens, who will try to abduct them. After destroying 25 enemies, the terrain will disappear and the player will be attacked by a swarm of enemies. The player starts with three lives and three smart bombs, and gains 1 of each every 10,000 points. When all lives are lost, it's game over.
title: Alien Defense

description:
Venture is an unofficial adaption of Exidy's arcade game Venture.

The player controls a small character who must navigate a series of passageways to reach the chambers within. Large spiders patrol the hallways, and the player loses a life if they touch one. The player has no ability to shoot in the passageways, and must avoid the spiders. After entering a room, the player moves to a separate screen containing smaller enemies and treasure. Here, the player must fire upon all the enemies, collect the treasure, and then exit out of the room. Back in the passageways, the player must try to navigate to the next chamber.
title: Venture

description:
Fortress is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a large immobile fortress in the center of the screen which can fire in the four cardinal directions. Alien vessels appear at the 4 sides of the fortress, and rapidly fire at the player. The player must quickly position their single large cannon and fire towards the enemy before their fortress is destroyed. The player loses a life with each hit, and with 3 lives lost, it's game over.
title: Fortress

description:
Sky Sweep is a side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a spaceship capable of moving forwards, backwards, up, and down. The ship is armed with missiles that fly forwards, and bombs which arc towards the ground. Alien terrain and weapons scroll from the right of the screen, and the player must carefully dodge alien missile launches, meteors, and other enemies. Each game is divided into 5 stages of different terrain and challenges, and at the end of this lies the enemy base which must be destroyed. After destroying the enemy base, the player restarts the game on a higher difficulty level. The player can set game speed, missile intelligence, and number of lives from 1-5.

sample_screenshots.caption: Stage 2 Takes you Through a Cavern

title: Sky Sweep

description:
Arachnid is a 1 -2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a large immobile ship in the center of the screen which can fire in the 4 cardinal directions. Large spiders march on the four sides of the screen, and intermittently fire towards the player. The player must shoot and destroy the spiders before their ship is hit repeatedly and destroyed. The player has an energy bar on the bottom of the screen that is drained by spider-fire, and the ship is destroyed when this reaches 0.
title: Arachnid

description:
Sneak Thief is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a guard armed with a gun patrolling a large stash of money in the center of the screen. From the 3 exits of the screen come thieves, who attempt to sneak to the money and run off with it to the room exits. The player must try to capture the thieves before they reach the money by running into them without shooting them, thus sending the thief to the brig. After stealing money, the thief becomes a fugitive, and becomes dangerous if touched. The player receives points for shooting a thief or fugitive, and if a fugitive is shot the money returns to the center. Protectors also appear, which move towards the player, and will take a life if touched. Each level, the player must capture a certain number of thieves to advance to the next challenge. The player has 3 lives, and if all are lost or if all 18 pieces of gold are stolen, it's game over.
title: Sneak Thief

description:
Super Hero Misadventure is a sixth in a series of adult-oriented text-adventures for the TRS-80.

You are a superhero working for the Daily Galaxy. Lois Laid has gone missing, and it is up to you to help save her. The player has 10 possible superpowers, including: super bad breath, super sex appeal, martial arts expert, or x-ray vision, and more. They are allowed to use each skill once per area at a time. The player must defeat a number of dangers that stalk the city, including Dr. Octopussy, Oriental Fighters, the Crimson Skull, and a Giant Sewer Worm. The player gains one point per foe defeated, and they can save Lois Laid after accumulating 15 bonus points.

sample_screenshots.caption: That Fire Hydrant is in Danger!

title: Super Hero Misadventure

description:
Super Invaders is a Space Invaders clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small ship which can move horizontally and fire vertically towards the top of the screen. Rows of alien vessels scroll horizontally, and slowly move towards the player on the bottom of the screen, while five barriers offer the player protection. The player must shoot down the vessels while avoiding enemy fire before any of the alien ships reach the bottom of the screen. There are 10 difficulty levels. The player starts with 3 ships, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Super Invaders

description:
Vexus is a 1 - 2 player arcade shooting game for the TRS-80.

Played from a first-person perspective, a number of alien creatures and spaceships move towards the player. The player must either fire upon and destroy the incoming threats or dodge them by moving to the side. The player has 3 ships, and it's game over when all are lost. A new ship is earned ever 10,000 points.
title: Vexus

description:
Naked Nightmare is the fifth in a series of adult-oriented text adventures for the TRS-80.

The player wakes up naked and alone in a building of twisting passageways. They must escape the building before time runs out and the building explodes. The player must explore the twisting halls to find a series of buttons to deactivate a laser defense system. They can then flag down a helicopter and escape to safety. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore option.
title: Naked Nightmare

description: Casino of Pleasure is the fourth in a series of adult-themed text adventures for the TRS-80.
title: Casino of Pleasure

description:
The Farvar Legacy is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

As the last surviving Farvar, you have inherited a castle just outside the ancient village of Estalz. Upon entering your new home, you become cursed by the former inhabitant Hugo Farvar, to become a vampire, becoming destined to murder one of the townspeople nightly. Hunted by the angry townspeople, the player finds they have become immortal, even when killed they are destined to wake up every morning in the master bedroom. The player must find a mystical amulet to help protect them from this curse at night, so that they might keep their senses. A day/night cycle is implemented, where different events happen during the day and night. The player must explore the local town and the extensive grounds of their castle to try to find the cure to their curse. A save/restore option is available.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Townspeople are Unhappy with my Nightly Escapades

title: The Farvar Legacy

description:
Ghost's Gallery is a 1 - 2 player strategy game for the TRS-80.

Designed for 2-player or 1-player versus computer opponent. The player is within a haunted mansion with numerous rooms and doors. The goal is to take the key from the second player or ghost, and then move to the exit doors before the computer opponent makes it to the exit with the key. Each turn numerous doors randomly open and close, and the player also has to ability to search for secret passages to aid their movement. Each turn the player and computer have a total of 6 move or search options. A player can take the key by occupying their opponent's space, thus moving them back to their starting point and obtaining the key.
title: Ghost's Gallery

description:
Laser Defense is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a series of satellite-based laser defense platforms, and must stop an incursion of Eastern European nuclear weapons. Played on two maps, the player freely switches between an American and European map. On the map of America, the player must move a cross-hair to target incoming intercontinental ballistic missiles to blow them up before they reach and destroy American cities. If all American cities are lost, it's game over. On the European map, the player must target enemy missile sites and other offensive weapons. If the player destroys all enemy missile sites, they advance to the next level. The enemy nation will also create an Eradicator, which can shoot down the laser defense system. If this is allowed to power up, it's game over. Current Eradicator power and remaining laser defense power are displayed on the bottom of the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Destroying Enemy Missile Sites and an Eradicator

title: Laser Defense

description:
Rat's Revenge is a 1st person maze game for the TRS-80.

The player has been transported into a 1st person rat maze, and must try to find the cheese at the end. The player must navigate the maze to find the cheese hidden somewhere within. If the player takes too long, they will begin to hallucinate cheese, and can starve to death. The player can receive hints including an overhead view of the map, but this will reduce their score. On lower difficulty, the player is shown how far they are from the cheese. The player can opt for a small or large maze, and on harder levels there are invisible barriers and passageways that stretch to infinity.
title: Rat's Revenge

description:
Star Trap is a 1 -2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

A series of stars bounce between a 3x3 grid on the top and bottom of the screen. The player must attempt to trap these stars by opening a door in the appropriate space on the bottom grid, and only one door can be opened at a time to catch the falling star. The player has 999 time units to catch as many stars as possible, and if all stars on the screen are captured, a new set of stars appears. The player can shoot a rotating nova from an open space, which will bounce and destroy all stars in that spot, but cannot be fired again until it is recaptured. The goal is to maximize score.
title: Star Trap

description:
Defend is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a spaceship which can move in all directions, and is able to fire forwards. The ship is further armed with a limited supply of smart bombs, which can be used to destroy a large field of enemy vessels. There are 3 levels of difficulty, and each is divided into 3 stages. During the first stage, the player must fight alien creatures while avoiding their return fire. A radar screen shows the location of incoming aliens. In the second and third stage, the ship's weapons are disabled. In the second stage, the player must dodge incoming meteorites, and in the final stage the player must navigate a series of tight tunnels. The player starts with 5 ships, and it's game over if all are lost. A new ship and smart bomb is awarded every 10,000 points.
title: Defend

description:
Frenzy is a 1 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Played on a series of platforms with interconnecting ladders, the player must avoid rapidly moving monsters while trying to collect all the bricks placed about the level. To help avoid monsters, the player can dig pits, which temporarily trap monsters, and allows the player to safely walk across the space. When all bricks are collected, the player advances to a more difficult level with more monsters. If the player is touched by a monster, they lose a life. A new life is awarded every 10,000 points. There are three levels of difficulty, and the player has a total of 5 lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Trapped a Monster in a Pit

title: Frenzy

description:
Space-Vaders is a 1-player Space Invaders clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small vessel which can move horizontally left and right, and fire vertically towards the top of the screen. Streams of alien spaceships move towards the player, and the player must shoot them down before they reach the bottom of the screen. Several barricades offer protection for the player. The player gets 3 spaceships before suffering a game over. The player receives a new ship every 2500 points.
title: Space-Vaders

description:
Star-Fire is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Two spaceships face off in a galactic battle. Each player is relegated to their half of the screen with a dotted line separating their zones, and they can fire towards their opponent. Large rocks in space provide protection from enemy fire, and the players can move in all directions. Each player gains 100 points when they shoot their opponent, and the player who has the most points after 99 time units is the victor.
title: Star-Fire

description:
The Temple of Bast is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

The player starts stuck in their home, as the hired goon for a local loan shark has taken up residence outside your door. The player must search their home to find the key for a hidden safe. Within lies a magic lamp, the home of an irate genie. After dealing with the genie's curses, the player finds themselves transported to the deserts of Egypt. Here, the player must overcome the dangers of the Temple of Bast, and locate the treasure within.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save and restore feature is available.
title: The Temple of Bast

description:
Wizard at War is a 1–2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Players control a wizard who can fire and move in the four cardinal directions. The player must navigate a maze shooting and destroying rapidly moving enemies, and all enemies must be destroyed to clear a stage. A scanner is provided to locate invisible enemies. Enemies including slow moving Barwars, invisible Garwars and Tharwars, Warlucks, and deadly Wizards.

The player starts with five lives, and gains a new life every fifth level completed.
title: Wizard at War

description:
Air Command is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small airplane that can move vertically up and down, while enemy aircraft approach from the right. The player tries to shoot as all enemy aircraft during a limited time period. There are three levels of difficulty, and gameplay continues until the player strikes an enemy aircraft or time expires.
title: Air Command

description:
Backgammon 5.5 is an early black and white game translation of the board game for the TRS-80.

Written in BASIC, it allows for only 1-player versus computer game play. The board is graphically displayed, and the player uses text input to place moves. The players are represented by solid and dotted shaped. Only legal moves are allowed, and players have the option to set their own dice roll.
title: Backgammon 5.5

description:
Galactic Battle is a 1-player space themed arcade game for the TRS-80.

You are being pursued by the starship Swineus. Although small, the Swineus are powerful, and are also equipped with long range lasers.

The player controls a small vessel which can move in the 4 cardinal directions, and always fires towards their opponent. The player must hit the enemy vessel 25 times before being hit 10 times to achieve victory. The player also loses if they come in direct contact with the enemy ship. The goal is to quickly move in and out of range of the enemy arsenal to maximize attacks. There are 4 levels of difficulty.
title: Galactic Battle

description:
Lander is a strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a lander with a limited amount of fuel. The player must carefully monitor their speed of descent, providing thrust to try to land on the surface at less than 20 km/hr. If the player strikes too hard, their lander will smash to pieces. If the player runs out of fuel, they will accelerate to the surface out of control. There are 4 landing options: The Earth, the Moon, Mars, and Asteroid Alpha.
title: Lander

description:
Monster Invasion is a 1-player Space Invaders clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a spaceship, which moves horizontally along the bottom of the screen and fires vertically forwards. Streams of alien vessels move horizontally on the screen, and fire towards the player. A number of barricades offers protection from alien fire. When a column of enemies is destroyed, an alien mothership appears to distribute more aliens. The player has 5 ships, and when all are destroyed its game over.
title: Monster Invasion

description:
Pharoah is a text-based strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player has been put in charge of the grain and gold supplies of an Egyptian nation, and has been tasked with increasing the acres of land per citizen from 5 to 10 within a twelve month period. Each turn, the player is tasked with selling bushels of wheat in exchange for gold, and then uses this gold to purchase land. Players can also sell land when costs are high. These costs fluctuate each turn. The player must ensure they leave enough grain to feed their people at the end of each turn, or the population will plummet. Otherwise, each turn there are births, deaths, and immigration to the country. Random events, such as theft of the royal coffers can occur. If the player does not success in their expansion

sample_screenshots.caption: That Seem s a Bit Drastic

title: Pharaoh

description:
5 Card Draw Poker is a 1-player versus computer poker game for the TRS-80.

Follows typical 5 card draw poker rules, with two rounds of betting, and a single opportunity to draw new cards. All commands are via text input. Maximum bidding each round is $25. Cards are graphically displayed on the screen.
title: 5 Card Draw Poker

description:
PT 109 is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a battleship which can move horizontally on the screen, and drops depth charges at 3 rows of submarines that scroll from either side of the screen. The player gets points for each submarine destroyed, with those on the lowest row being worth considerably more. A final score is awarded after 999 time units have passed.
title: PT 109

description:
TRS-80 4k Level I Games-1 is a compilation of five games:

  • Checkers
  • Deathstars: a sci-fi action game for two players.
  • Hangman
  • Lunar Lander
  • Math Race: an educational arithmetic game.
title: TRS-80 4k Level I Games-1

description: In Ants you can become an ant and join the ranks to fight in battle between two warring ant colonies. Queens, workers, soldiers, guards, and drones all take to their roles when hundreds of ants clash together in battle. There are three game variations: Digging Ants, Nest Barrier, and Open Field. Time the production of ants so that they are sequenced strategically to sting the enemy queen, while defending your own. To win, be the first player to fatally wound your opponent’s queen or to overrun their nest. The game has four separate, varying difficulties to choose from. The game can be played against a computer AI opponent or another local player.
title: Ants

description: The New Starship Voyages is a space war game heavily inspired by the arcade and microcomputer hit of the same genre, Star Trek. You play as the starship commander and your mission is to fight and destroy the other spacecraft which have plagued the galaxy. This game features three different weapons to dispose of your enemies with, photon torpedoes, phasers, and the ultimate weapon - Corbomite devices which can destroy all enemy ships in the quadrant. The galaxy in which you play within comes in a variety of sizes. Size is measured by the number of levels in the galaxy. This can range from 2, 3, 4, or 5 levels, each of which is divided into 9 quadrants with each quadrant being divided into 81 sectors. Each sector is an X/Y coordinance in which your starship or an enemy could be residing, much like the classic board game, Battleship. The game can be played in one of six different difficulty modes available.
title: The New Starship Voyages

description:
Parsector V/Parsector 8 offers two space battlefield wargames packaged together.

In Parsector V, the player fights against a computer opponent while Parsector 8 expands the play field to 64 parsectors and allows combat against 2 human opponents. The game is fought between two powerful motherships which must be strategically moved and navigated around the galaxy. Launch fleets of space and battleships to battle and defeat your opponents in this fast-paced, turn-based strategy game. You can move, shoot, and launch in any direction. A full 360 degrees are available for maneuvering and combat. Destroy your opponent's mothership or gain control of the majority of the parsectors (68%+) to win the game. Uniquely offers a private display for each player to use, splitting the screen in half to accomplish this.
title: Parsector V / Parsector 8

description: Space Ace 21 is about building and battling spaceships against either another human player, or the computer AI. Build your spaceship from 21 different available modules to see what strategies work best against your opponents. After designing your craft, the game will run a test and check your ship before shooting you off into space. Once finished, you're up against an opponent in one of three different game modes in either a two or three dimensional galaxy. Game modes consist of: Smuggler, try to get from one side of the screen, around your opponent, and to your base with as much cargo or passengers as you can. Refuel, a one-on-one shoot-out between you and an opponent; game mode allows you to go back to base to refuel with the goal of destroying the enemy. Phoenix Decathlon, a tournament where you face-off against each of the ten computer AI's pre-designed spaceships with the goal of beating them all and being championed as a "Space Ace".

sample_screenshots.caption: I Create a Better Ship - Engaging the Enemy

title: Space Ace 21

description:
Arcade 80 is a collection of three different games: Astro Mines, Falling Bricks, and Star Run.

  • Astro Mines is a challenge to see how many mines you can blow up within a fixed amount of time and a limited supply of fuel. Fast action requires quick reflexes yet the challenge also requires a fair amount of forethought and strategy to pull of a win.

  • Falling Bricks is a Space Invaders-style fixed shooter. Launch missiles at the invading enemy while panning left and right to dodge enemy attacks. The goal is to score as many points as possible by destroying enemies as they advance.

  • Star Run is a space combat simulator in which you've just escaped from the Dark Star and are trying to outrun an enemy fighter-spaceship. Use your targeting system and lasers to destroy enemy spacecraft. Like many space combat simulator, the player is provided with a multiple-window overlay to display various gauges and monitors. Flight maneuvering is done on a two-dimensional grid in which you navigate and engage in combat within.
title: Arcade 80

description:
Gobbler is a 1 -2 player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80.

The player must try to eat all the dots in a large maze while avoiding ghosts. A power-up is present in each corner, which temporarily makes the ghosts susceptible to the player's attack. There are 4 levels of difficulty.
title: Gobbler

description:
Skyscraper is a 1 - 2 player arcade platformer for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character who can move left and right, jump over obstacles, and also climb up and down ladders. There are 4 levels of difficulty, and the player's goal is to climb as high up a skyscraper as possible. Each level of the skyscraper has 3 stages, the first involves climbing ladders and jumping over moving barrels. The second stage requires the player to walk over 8 platforms that disappear as the player walks over them. The player must avoid falling in holes or being electrocuted by moving lightning. The third stage involves jumping across moving platforms.

The player starts with 3 characters, and gains a new life every 10,000 points. The game tracks high scores.
title: Skyscraper

description:
Racer is an auto-racing game for the TRS-80

The player controls a small vehicle represented by a square, which must be navigated around a track as quickly as possible. The vehicle can accelerate, decelerate, turn left, and right. There are bonus items to pick up on the track, and a timer tracks the racer's performance. There are a total of 3 tracks, and if the player hits a wall, they are destroyed and must restart the race.
title: Racer

description:
Revenge of Rivet Race is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character who can move horizontally, jump, and climb up and down ladders. He must navigate three levels, trying to rescue Papa Ape at the top of the screen while avoiding dangers including snappers, flying bats, and falls from height. On the first screen, the player must reach the key at the top of the screen while avoiding snappers. On the second screen, they must push 8 keys to the top of the screen while avoiding snappers and bats. On the third screen, they must navigate moving platforms to reach Papa Ape's cage. The player can modify the speed of enemies and the number of men they start with.

sample_screenshots.caption: Pushing Keys to the Top of the Screen

title: Revenge of Rivet Race

description:
Poker Pete is a 1-player card game versus the computer for the TRS-80.

The player competes against Pete in a game of 5-draw poker. There is a round of betting before and after each chance to discard cards. Pete has 3 levels of difficulty, and each player starts with $250. The game is over when a player runs out of cash.
title: Poker Pete

description:
Lowball Poker is a 1-player poker game for the TRS-80.

The player competes against a single computer opponent in a game of 5-draw poker. The computer opponent repeatedly insults the player during game play. Players take turns betting, and can draw cards once during each hand. Each player starts with $1000.
title: Lowball Poker

description:
Rummy Master is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80.

The player competes against a single animated computer opponent in a game of gin rummy. Games can be player to 100, 200, or 300.
title: Rummy Master

description:
This compilation contains two games:

  • Bankshot is a 1 - 2 player strategy game for the TRS-80. A ball is placed on a field with a barrier around all sides except for two small exits. The player's goal is to bounce the ball off of the walls into the exit. The player gets 1 point per bounce up to 4 bounces. The direction of the ball can be set by using a cursor or numerically typing the angle. Each player gets 15 balls for a maximum score of 60.
  • Match Cards is a card Concentration game. The player has to match cards with numbers, letters and shapes on them.
title: Match Cards / Bankshot

description: Basic and Intermediate Lunar Lander is a compilation of two different Lunar Lander games. In both the player is tasked to manually land a lunar module on the surface of the moon by applying thrust. The player must prevent the module from crashing into the surface with too much speed. Which is more likely to happen if the module runs out of fuel. The difficulty increases in the Intermediate program compared to the Basic program.
title: Basic and Intermediate Lunar Lander

description:
Beginner's Backgammon and Keno is a compilation of two games:

  • Beginner's Backgammon is a adaptation of the classic board game, featuring an AI opponent designed to challenge beginning players.
  • Keno is a computer version of the casino gambling game the odds are against the player in this game of pure chance, but when the player wins the payouts are big.
title: Beginner's Backgammon and Keno

alternate_titles.title: Invaders from Space: Machine Language Game

description:
Invaders from Space is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small spaceship which can move horizontally, and fires directly upwards. The player must destroy approaching enemy vessels, while avoiding attacking vessels. The player can set the frequency of bombs, bomber accuracy, game speed, the number of shots on screen, and number of bases.
title: Invaders from Space

description:
Gin Rummy 2.0 is a text-based 1-player card game for the TRS-80.

Follows typical gin rummy rules, and all commands are via menus. The player and the computer take turns drawing and discarding cards from either the deck or the up card. Players try to play 3 in a row or 3 of a kind for points. The first player to use all 10 cards is the winner.
title: Gin Rummy 2.0

description:
Yahtzee is a 1 - 5 player text-based implementation of the popular dice game for the TRS-80.

Players take turns rolling five dice, and each turn can choose which dice to keep. The player can reroll the remaining dice for 2 more rounds, keeping the five dice they prefer before choosing their scoring category. Scoring categories include 6 categories within the Upper Section, which include the sum of all ones to sixes. In the Lower Section, the categories include 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, full house, a 4 dice straight, a 5 dice straight, yahtzee (5 of a kind) and chance (which is the sum of all dice). A game is finished when all 11 scoring categories have been used. A computer opponent is available for competition.
title: Yahtzee

description:
Checkers 2.1 is a 1-player versus the computer checkers game for the TRS-80.

Challenge the computer to a game of checkers, while it insults you throughout the game. All commands are via text input, and there is only one difficulty level.
title: Checkers 2.1

description:
Robot Hunter is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player's goal is to destroy as many defective run away robots as possible within 60 seconds. The player controls a saucer which can move up and down, but only fires diagonally down and to the right. The player must time their shot, and then also time the explosion to try to destroy the robot running across the screen. The player receives a final score based upon the number of robots destroyed.
title: Robot Hunter

description:
Saucers is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

You are the pilot of a TRS-80B space fighter simulator. The object is to destroy as many saucers as possible within the allotted time. The player moves a crosshair, and attempts to move their ship over the moving alien vessel. The player gains one point for each vessel destroyed.
title: Saucers

description:
Space Target is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

Alien vessels move across the screen from left to right. The player fires a missile from the bottom center of the screen, and must direct it into the alien vessel. After an alien vessel is hit, the pilot parachutes to safety, and the player can shoot the escaping pilot for bonus points. There are 3 levels of difficulty, and the player has a total of 30 shots to maximize score.
title: Space Target

description:
Star Wars is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

Based on the Death Star trench run from the movie Star Wars: A New Hope, the player must maneuver a crosshair, and attempt to shoot 15 tie fighters. These appear on the screen, and steadily get larger, and the player must shoot them before they reach the player. The player gets increased points for shooting an enemy further away, but if they fail to shoot them in time, it's game over. After this, they must shoot the rapidly moving Darth Vader. Finally, the player must line up and shoot a torpedo down the Death Star's plasma exhaust to achieve victory.
title: Star Wars

description:
Tangle Mania!!! is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a rapidly moving block that leaves a continuously elongating tail behind it. Players can move in the 4 cardinal directions. The goal is to try to encircle the opposing player, so that they have nowhere left to move. The first person to run out of room loses.
title: Tangle Mania

description:
Wall Street is a stock trading game for the TRS-80.

Players take turns buying and selling shares, with the goal to buy low and sell high. Each player starts with $50,000, and the goal is to make one million in total. There are 20 stocks in total, and even numbers stocks are more volatile.
title: Wall Street

description:
Word Scramble is a 2-player word guessing game for the TRS-80.

The first player types in a word, and the letters are then displayed on the screen in a scrambled fashion for the second player. The second player must try to type in the new word a single letter at a time, trying to make as few mistakes as possible. The player with the fewest mistakes wins.
title: Word Scramble
