description: Space Trek II is a Star Trek variant. The player commands the starship Enterprise and must defend the galaxy against Klingon warships using phasers and photon torpedoes. The player can use the impulse drive to move around quadrants and the warp drive to jump between quadrants in search of the enemy vessels.
title: Space Trek II

description: Cribbage is a computer implementation of the classic card/board game. The game is played with a deck of cards and a board with 120 holes for pegs. Players can jump pegs to advance on the board. Players play cards in turn until no more cards can be played without exceeding a cumulative value of 31. There are multiple ways to score points including various card combinations or forcing the other player into a position where it cannot play a card.
title: Cribbage

description: Gridiron Offense/Defense is an American football simulation game where you get to be the coach. As coach, you decide all the plays but do not actually run them. Outcomes are based on actual team/player statistics and the computer's simulation model. You can play against the computer or another player, or you can allow the computer to play itself. Graphics are simple and text-based.
title: Gridiron Offense/Defense

description: Project Death Star places the player in command of the Death Star space station. The Rebellion is attacking the Death Star and the player must try to destroy all incoming fighters when their body lines up with your aim. When all shots are fired the player is graded on their performance.
title: Project Death Star

description:
Amoeba Attack Wars is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character that can move and fire in the four cardinal directions. The player must destroy an unending series of monsters that appear in order to score points. The player has 5 lives, and can take a total of 5 hits per life. The goal is to maximize score.
title: Amoeba Attack Wars

description:
Rockin' Robber is 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a vessel which can move in all directions, but fires vertically towards the top of the screen. The player is surrounded on 3 sites by moving platforms that help protect their enemy in the top center of the screen. The player tries to shoot around these moving platforms while avoiding enemy fire to take apart the rapidly regenerating alien vessel. The player starts with 20 men.
title: Rockin' Robber

description:
Arcade Alien Attack is a single-player action game.

The player must move a crosshair to destroy incoming enemy planes, missiles, rockets, and other dangers. There are five cities at the bottom of the screen which must be protected, and if all are lost it is game over. Every 5,000 points, the player receives a bonus city.
title: Arcade Alien Attack

description:
Arcade Invaders is a single-player Space Invaders clone.

The player controls a space base which moves laterally, and can fire forwards. The player must defeat a field of alien vessels that progress steadily towards the player. The player can take three hits before it is game over. If the alien vessels reach the bottom of the screen, it's game over. There are three levels of difficulty.
title: Arcade Invaders

description:
Arcade U-Boat Strike is a single-player arcade game.

The player controls a U-boat, whose goal is to destroy as many ships as possible in a limited time period. The U-boat moves horizontally, and fires vertically, while an unending number of ships of various speed, size, and distance stream across the screen. Faster, further, and smaller ships are worth more points. Enemy ships fire at the player, and if they are hit, they lose time and 50 points. The player starts with 150 seconds, and gains an additional 50 second bonus if they reach 1,000 points. Each additional 500 points is worth a further time bonus.
title: Arcade U-Boat Strike

description:
Apple Panic is an action game for one or two players.

A peaceful space farmer, your life is simple and serene. Suddenly, all this has changed. Your crop of apples has become crazed, and has turned on you.

Played on a number of platforms with ladders connecting them, the player can dig holes in the ground to trap the crazed apples. The goal is to lure apples into the holes, and then stomp on them before they can escape, thus squishing the apples on the level below. After destroying all apples on a level, the player moves to a more difficult challenge. The player starts with 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Apple Panic

description: Hangman (Level I) is a word guessing game written in Level I BASIC. The game can be played both solitary and with two players. The goal is to guess a word in limited turns by guessing individual letters. The game uses numbers, but includes a chart for deciphering them into words.
title: Hangman (Level I)

description:
Alien's Eggs is an arcade action game for one or two players.

The player controls a spaceship divided into three parts, that can move horizontally on the bottom of the screen and fire vertically upwards. The player encounters alien eggs, that hatch when shot into a variety of creatures that descend and fire upon the player. The player's shop has three parts, and a new part is used when the previous is destroyed. The player starts with a single cannon, progresses to two cannons close together, and then finally two cannons further apart. The game ends when all stages of the ship are destroyed.
title: Alien's Eggs

description:
Bable Terror is an arcade game for one or two players.

The player controls a ship that moves through a large randomized maze, and tries to eat bables and stars while avoiding dangers. The player has three lives, and gains a new life every 1,000 points. If the player collects all stars, they move on to the next level. The player has a limited number of options to turn invisible to avoid enemies.
title: Bable Terror

description:
Space Invaders is a single-player Space Invaders clone.

The player controls a small ship which moves laterally, fires vertically, and tries to blast alien vessels before they approach the bottom of the screen. The player has three lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Space Invaders

description:
Grand Prix 80 is a single-player arcade driving game.

The player controls a race car that can move horizontally, and must try to avoid other vehicles and pedestrians while racing on a track. The player has three cars, and it's game over when all are lost. There are options for straight or windy tracks, and the player loses a car if they hit the edge. The goal is to complete five laps in the minimal time possible.
title: Grand Prix 80

description:
Martian Patrol is a single-player side-scrolling arcade game.

The player controls a small buggy on the surface of Mars, which can move left, right, jump, and briefly use a force field. The player can shoot horizontally forwards and vertically. The player must travel through a number of sectors, and has to jump over rocks and pits. The player must avoid and destroy attacking aliens.
title: Martian Patrol

description:
Turbo 2000 is a single-player auto racing game.

The player controls a small car racing along a narrow track, which must navigate sharp turns and a variety of obstacles in the track. The player can accelerate, decelerate, and shift gears. As they play the track becomes steadily more difficult, and the skill level increases.
title: Turbo 2000

description:
Helicopter is an arcade game.

The player controls a small helicopter, that earns points by bombing the trucks that move about at the bottom of the screen. The player has limited fuel, but can regain this by bombing gas trucks. The player is constantly being fired upon by rockets, as well as bullets from the trucks below. Fuel continuously ticks downwards, and the player loses more fuel when shot. The game is over when all fuel is lost.
title: Helicopter

description: Ghost Hunter is a Pac-Man clone. It uses all the elements of the original game. The character starts with three lives. Points are scored for every dot and ghost eaten.
title: Ghost Hunter

description: Donkey Kong is a Donkey Kong clone written in 1982, but never commercially published. It was eventually made available in 1995.
title: Donkey Kong

description:
Gobble Man is a 1 - 2 player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character who moves in the cardinal directions, and tries to eat all the dots in a maze to progress to the next level. Four monsters move randomly about the maze to threaten the player. If the player eats one of the power pellets in the 4 corners of the maze, the monsters are temporarily vulnerable and can be eaten and sent back to the starting home at the right of the screen for a short time before reemerging. The player starts with 3 lives, and each successful completion of the maze leads to faster moving monsters.
title: Gobble Man

description: Breakdown is inspired by the classic Breakout. The goal of the game is to score as many points as possible by breaking as many bricks as possible with a bouncing ball while trying to keep the ball in play and avoiding falling bricks.
title: Breakdown

description:
Stellar Adventure is a space exploration game.

The player controls a small armed spaceship, whose goal is to explore a number of quadrants in space, land on alien planets, and search for alien treasures. The player has a limited time period to maximize their score, and can set the density of planets and other interesting items within the quadrants of the galaxy. While in hyperspace, the player must avoid space storms, and can maneuver towards planets and starbases. The ship is armed with shields, weapons, and life support, and when these are lost the ship is destroyed.
title: Stellar Adventure

description:
Asteroid is a single-player arcade game.

The player controls a small vessel that can rotate and fire 360 degrees, and can also thrust and decelerate. The player must shoot asteroids and alien space vessels. Each asteroid breaks down into two smaller pieces, which break down again into 2 smaller pieces until ultimately destroyed. After each level is cleared, a new field of asteroids occurs. There are 2 levels of difficulty, and the player earns a new ship every 10,000 points.
title: Asteroid

description:
Barricade! is a single-player Breakout clone.

The player vertically moves a paddle, while attempting to bounce a ball to demolish the blocks on the right side of the screen. The player can modify ball speed, maximum bounce angle, paddle size, and maximum number of balls. the player receives a score based upon bricks broken and difficult level.
title: Barricade!

description:
Air Raid is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Enemy planes fly horizontally across the screen, and the player must shoot them down from their artillery cannon in the center of the screen. The cannon can be fired at 5 different angles, and when a plane is hit, it bursts into flame and falls to the ground, potentially taking out other planes in its descent. Enemy planes can collide, and fall to the ground. There are 9 levels of game speed, and the player has 99 time units to shoot as many planes as possible.

sample_screenshots.caption: Destroyed Planes Fall to the Ground

title: Air Raid

description:
Barricade is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

A 1-player versus computer game where the player controls a progressively elongating character, and attempts to cut off the opposing character, forcing them to run into a wall or a character's tail. The player competes through 20 rounds of progressively faster rounds.
title: Barricade

description:
The Dark Kingdom is an RPG adventure game for the TRS-80.

There is a rich and evil land to the east, filled with great wealth and adventure. You arrive at the border with sword, shield, horse, and a 3-day supply of resources in a quest for gold and fame.

The player can explore 4 separate maps, each labelled with a number of places that can be visited. While travelling between areas, the player can get attacked by a variety of monsters. The player and monster can move on the screen, and each takes turns attacking the other from short range. At each area, the player can explore to look for resources. They can also find people to barter with during their adventure. The player has a limited supply of food, drink, and healing supplies during their adventure which can be used to heal the player after incurring damage. As the player is victorious in combat, their fame increases. The goal is to acquire 200 fame points and defeat the dark ruler.
title: The Dark Kingdom

description:
Jedi Knight is an adventure game for the TRS-80.

The Republic is at its last days. Darth Vader is slaying all the Jedi Warriors and the end of knighthood is drawing near. It is now up to you to stop Darth Vader, and end his nasty ways.

The player can fly to a number of planets via space shuttle, but their fuel is limited and needs to be resupplied on a regular basis. On each planet, there are a number of locations to visit. At each location on a planet, the player can search for donations to the Jedi Order to increase their funds. At Rebel camps, the player can trade for healing supplies and shuttle fuel.

The player can be attacked while exploring the planet's surface. There is a brief sequence where the player approaches the enemy, and then a lightsaber combat sequence, where the player must rapidly attack the enemy. Each successful battle increases the player's fame.

After accruing sufficient fame, Darth Vader will seek out the player, which they must slay in combat to be victorious.
title: Jedi Knight

description:
D-Day: The Invasion of France is a 1-player wargame based upon the Allied invasion of France.

This historical wargame covers the first 24 days of the Amphibious invasion of France in June 1944. The player starts gameplay by setting the 5 landing points on the beaches of France prior to the invasion. The goal is to take as many of the 57 town positions on the map as possible, with each position being worth 1 point.

Each turn takes 2 days, and the player has a total of 12 turns for their mission. The player must watch the supply and combat points for each unit. If there are not enough supply units, each landed unit loses 1 - 5 combat points per turn. The player must capture Cherbourg by the end of June, or the Germans automatically win.

The player controls Allied airborne, armored cavalry, infantry, and special service units. German forces also have panzer, infantry, airborne, assault gun, and bicycle brigades.
title: D-Day: The Invasion of France

description:
Lost Ship Adventure is a text adventure game for the TRS-80.

Lazily floating in the balmy waters of the South Seas is a mystery ship. She's rigged and ready for a voyage to an unknown destination.

The player finds themselves aboard the lost pirate ship. They must learn how to navigate the ship, which takes them to a mysterious treasure island. There, they must find 4 lost treasures, and return them to the ship's hold. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore game option.
title: Lost Ship Adventure

description:
Engine Driver is a strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player controls switch points A - J on a series of interconnecting railroad tracks. Five trains run on these tracks, and there are a total of 4 stations. The player can control the speed of trains 1 - 4, but train 5 cannot be controlled. The player must modify the switch points without causing the trains to hit each other or to run off the track. The goal is to have trains 1 - 4 stop at an individual station without having any trains crash.
title: Engine Driver

description:
Burial Ground Adventure is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

The player has arrived on a deserted island which features a castle, catacombs, and several traps. The goal is to collect a cross, rubies, a drawing, and jewelry, and return it to the starting point to gather a maximum score of 100 points. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature.
title: Burial Ground Adventure

description:
Regilian Worm is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

As a mighty intergalactic regilian worm, you search out succulent zandszbards to eat. The little beggars are tasty, though a bit explosive. The more you eat, the bigger you grow.

The player controls a progressively elongating worm, that must move about and eat zandszbards. If the player strikes their tail or the edge of the screen, it's game over. There are 4 levels of difficulty with 9 speed options.
title: Regilian Worm

description:
The Atlantian Odyssey is a graphical adventure game for the TRS-80.

A black and white graphical adventure game, where the player must explore a number of island locations and underwater temples within the Pacific Ocean. The goal is to find 6 treasures and set sail to Hawaii. The player receives a score based upon the number of turns required to find all 6 treasures. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: The Atlantian Odyssey

description:
Alien Cresta is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a spaceship which moves laterally at the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically forwards. The player must fight through fields of progressively more difficult alien creatures that swoop about the screen. The player has 3 lives, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Alien Cresta

description:
Battle Station is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a space ship in the center of the screen, that can fire in 8 separate directions. Spaceships randomly pop up on the corners and sides of the screen, and fire towards the player. The player needs to shoot the attacking shots and aliens as fast as possible. The game become progressively faster and more aliens appear as the round continues. The player has 3 lives, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Battle Station

description:
Centipede Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small ship that can move laterally, and fires vertically upwards. A large centipede begins to descend the screen by travelling in rows, and the player must shoot all pieces of the centipede before it reaches the bottom of the screen. When the creature is hit, it divides into smaller pieces, and leaves blockades behind. Spiders appear on the screen to attack the player. When the player clears a level, they move to a more difficult challenge. The player has 3 lives, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Centipede Attack

description:
Hamburger Sam is a 1 - 2 player Burger Time clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a chef who must move on a series of ladders and platforms trying to knock pieces of a hamburger (patty, condiments, top and bottom bun) to the bottom of the screen. The player must avoid angry condiments which attack the player, and these can be defeated with the use of a limited number of pepper attacks. When the player creates 3 hamburgers on the bottom of the screen, they progress to a new more difficult level. The player starts with 3 lives, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Hamburger Sam

description:
Hoppy is a 1-player Frogger clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small frog, who must hop through 2 screens of dangers to reach his resting spot. On the first screen, the player must hop between cars to safely cross the road. On the second screen, the player must hop from logs and turtles to cross the screen and reach 1 of 5 resting spots at the top of the screen. If the player fills all 5 resting spots, they progress to a new challenge. The player has 3 frogs, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Hoppy

description:
Insect Frenzy is a 1 - 2 player Centipede clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small ship that can move laterally, and fires vertically upwards. A large centipede begins to descend the screen by travelling in rows, and the player must shoot all pieces of the centipede before it reaches the bottom of the screen. When the creature is hit, it divides into smaller pieces, and leaves blockades behind. Spiders appear on the screen to attack the player. Fleas drop from above and scorpions travel horizontally across the screen. When the player clears a level, they move to a more difficult challenge. The player has 3 lives, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Insect Frenzy

description:
Jungle Boy is a 1 - 2 player Jungle Hunt clone for the TRS-80.

The player's goal is to rescue their girlfriend from numerous dangers within the jungle. The game is divided into 4 timed stages. In the first stage, the player must carefully time jumps between swinging vines in order to reach the end of the level. In the second stage, the player must swim underwater, slash alligators with a short machete, and regularly come to the surface to breath oxygen. In the third stage, the player must run up a hill, jumping over bouncing boulders. In the final stage, the player must jump over people holding spears, trying to rescue their girlfriend before she is dumping in a boiling pot.
title: Jungle Boy

description:
Jungle Raiders is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character at the bottom of the screen who moves horizontally, and fires vertically upwards. There are 4 tents in the center of the screen guarded by 4 rows of barricades on each side. Enemies approach from each side, and intermittently fire at the player. The enemies attempt to grab and haul away barricades to the side of the screen, after which they go for more barricades. The enemies will eventually try to haul away the tents. If the enemy hauling a barricade or tent is shot, the item will stay where it was dropped. If the player is hit by enemy fire, they lose a tent, and if a tent is hauled off the screen, the tent is lost. The game is over when all tents are lost.
title: Jungle Raiders

description:
Killer Beetles is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player moves about a maze filled with killer beetles. The player can deploy a net at a short distance, which can temporarily trap the beetles. The player must then close the net before the beetle can escape. The player loses a life if they contact a beetle, and have 4 lives in total. Points are earned for every beetle destroyed.
title: Killer Beetles

description:
Killer Gorilla is a 1 - 2 player Donkey Kong clone for the TRS-80.

The killer gorilla has captured the player's girlfriend, and is holding her hostage atop a structure consisting of platforms, conveyor belts, and ladders. The player must move through 4 separate stages, trying to reach the top of each. On the first stage, the player must avoid thrown barrels, while on the second the player must avoid moving flames and conveyor belts. Stage 3 adds moving platforms and springs, while on stage 4 the player must walk over all switches to drop the gorilla to its doom. The player has 5 lives, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Killer Gorilla

description:
Penguin is a 1 - 2 player Pengo clone for the TRS-80.

The player moves a penguin about a maze made of ice blocks, and tries to destroy enemies by kicking ice blocks into them. The enemies destroy ice blocks, and the player can destroy an ice block if it's kicked into another. If the player destroys all enemies, they move to a more difficult challenge. The player starts with 5 lives, and if all are lost, it's game over.
title: Penguin

description:
Space Shootout is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a spaceship on the top or bottom of the screen, which can move horizontally and fire towards their opponent. A field of space rocks, which continuously scroll horizontally, separate the two combatants. The players have limited energy which rapidly recharges, and longer shots require more energy. The players gain points for each rock destroyed, but even more points if they shoot their opponent.
title: Space Shootout

description:
Final Approach is an airplane landing simulator for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to land a big multi-engine airplane along the glidepath starting about 6 miles out at 1500 feet altitude. The player controls the airspeed and rate of descent via text entry. The player decided when to lower the landing gear, or to go around and attempt another approach. The aircraft will stall below 110 knots.
title: Final Approach

description:
Invaders is a Space Invaders clone for the TRS-80.

Alien invaders from deep space are now approaching our planet in great swarms to colonize the Earth. The invaders feel they must destroy all life forms in order to guarantee their own survival. Six armored barriers still exist in your sector to shield you from above, but you know that with time, they will be destroyed leaving you helpless.

The player controls a small ship which moves horizontally on the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically upwards. Swarms of alien vessels move laterally across the screen, slowly descending towards the player. The player can take 5 hits before game over. The game tracks enemy ships and flying saucers destroyed, but also deducts points for each missed shot.
title: Invaders

description:
Micro-Opoly is a 1-player versus computer board game for the TRS-80.

The player and their computer opponent take turns moving on a computerized interpretation of the Monopoly board. Players can buy and sell property, and get charged rent when they land on properties. Closely follows the rules of the original game.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Get Charged on a Property

title: Micro-Opoly

description:
Micronopoly is a 1-player versus computer board game for the TRS-80.

The player and their computer opponent take turns moving on a computerized interpretation of the Monopoly board. Players can buy and sell property, and get charged rent when they land on properties. Closely follows the rules of the original game.
title: Micronopoly

description:
City Adventure is a text adventure game for the TRS-80.

The goal is for the player to meet up with their girlfriend Suzy in the city, and take her home with you. The player must figure out how to deactivate their security system, exit the house, and take a bus to the city. The player must explore the city, find Suzy, and magic her back to your house.

sample_screenshots.caption: My Pet Doberman Helps me in the Basement

title: City Adventure

description:
Car Racer is a single-player arcade game.

The player controls a small car which must be driven around a variety of tracks. The player can accelerate, decelerate, and rotate their car in 8 separate directions. The player receives one point for each track the player completes, and there are a total of 6 tracks. The player has 240 time units to maximize the score.
title: Car Racer

description:
Breakout is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a paddle, which moves horizontally along the bottom of the screen, and attempts to break all of the blocks present on the top by bouncing a ball. The player can choose whammies, catch, invisible walls, solid walls, and breakthrough blocks. The game speeds up as more blocks are broken.
title: Breakout

description:
Space Battle is a Star Trek variant.

The player must explore numerous space quadrants to try to destroy all alien vessels. There are 3 levels of difficulty, and the player has 10 seconds to input each maneuver. The player's ship is armed with lasers and missiles, and has a limited supply of shield energy to protect itself. Space is a 10 x 10 grid, and the player can warp between quadrants, and long range sensors tell the player if they are near an alien vessel. The player must control and repair damage, as well as watch their finances. Victory is determined by destroying all alien vessels.
title: Space Battle

description:
Batter-Up is a 2-player baseball game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls the batter, but the computer always pitches. The player must carefully time their swing to try to strike the ball as it crosses home base. The player gains a number of bases dependent upon where the ball hits. The player is out if they miss a single ball, or if they place the ball in the wrong location. There are no extra innings, and players take their bases automatically. There are 3 levels of pitching difficulty.
title: Batter Up

description:
Snake Eggs is an animated 1-player gambling game for the TRS-80.

The player and the computer take turns rolling a number from 1 to 22. The goal is to get as close to 41 without going over. At the beginning of each round, the player wagers a bet, and starts with $1000. A roll of "snake eggs" wins, and a roll of "scrambled eggs" automatically loses.
title: Snake Eggs

description:
Life Two are games based upon John Conway's Game of Life

Contains a TRS-80 implementation of the Game of Life.

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.

Also contains a competitive form called The Battle of Life, where 2 - 4 players place 1 - 5 animated characters in a 10 x 5 board. Every 5 generations, the remaining players can place two more lifeforms. Gameplay continues until there is only a single player remaining.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Battle of Life Game Setup
Setting up The Game of Life

title: Life Two

description:
Lying Chimps is a 1-player animated card game for the TRS-80.

Based upon the card game "I Doubt It", the player competes against 4 cheating animated chimps named Chump, Chomp, Chimp, and Champ. The chimps regularly banter with each other and insult the player. One at a time, a player places 1 - 4 card on the table facing down. They then must announce a series of card, such as "three aces" or "two fours". Any of the four players can then announce if they believe the series of cards matches what the player announces. If the player's cards are not questioned, they stay on the table to be picked up at a future time. When questioned, if the player is lying, they must pick up all cards on the table, otherwise the person who falsely accused the player must pick up all the cards. It's game over when one player has used all of their cards.
title: Lying Chimps

description:
Word Challenge is a 1 - 2 player word guessing game for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to solve a phrase by filling in blanks by guessing letters. The player starts with 50 points, and loses 2 points for each incorrect consonant, and 10 points for each incorrect vowel. In 2-player games, each player can provide their own phrases.

sample_screenshots.caption: Life is Just a Bowl of Cherrys (sic)

title: Word Challenge

description:
Galaxy Invasion is a space-themed 1 or 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small vessel which moves horizontally left and right on the screen. The player's ship can fire vertically forwards. The player faces waves of alien vessels which fire upon the player and swoop towards them. When an enemy ship moves beyond the bottom of the screen, it reappears in formation at the top of the screen. When the player clears the stage of all combatants, they progress to a slightly more difficult level. The player starts with 3 ships, and gains an extra ship every 10,000 points. When all ships are lost, it's game over. Goal is to maximize score.
title: Galaxy Invasion

description:
Gobbling Box is a 1 - 2 player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80.

The gobbler must eat all the dots in a maze, while avoiding the zonkers Chris and Cross. If the player eats an energizer, the zonkers can temporarily become vulnerable, and run from the player. A tame zonker, if eaten, is sent back to the starting area. When the player consumes all dots, they move to a new maze and gain a new gobbler. The player starts with 3 gobblers, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: The Gobbling Box

description:
Cavern Quest is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player must excavate the underground caverns of an alien planet. The player starts at their rocketship, and must delve deeply into the ground. The player must avoid alien creatures which will move quickly towards the player if they are excavated. Rocks will fall downwards if the ground under them is excavated, and can trap aliens or crush the player. The player can pick up pellets to resupply the number of digs available. The goal is to explore the cavern as far as possible. If the player is killed, they can restart the game.
title: Cavern Quest

description:
Morgoth is a fantasy-themed 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character which can move in all directions, and shoot an arrow in the direction they are moving. The player starts in the Caverns of Moria, and must navigate through to Smaegors Keep, and finally Dirkwood Forest. From there, the player can escape out the gate for their final score. The player picks up bonus points, and gains points for enemies slain. The player has 5 lives, and if they are hit, they must restart the dungeon.

sample_screenshots.caption: At the Exit of Dirkwood Forest

title: Morgoth

description:
Defense Penetrator is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small spaceship that can move in all directions, fire directly forwards, but also drop bombs. The player contends with a number of adversaries, including gun turrets, missiles, enemy ships, and meteors. The player must avoid striking the ground. There is a limited fuel supply, which the player can replenish by bombing fuel silos along the ground. There are 4 progressively more difficult zones. The player has 3 spaceships, and when all are lost, it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Look Out for Rockets on Level 1

title: Defense Penetrator

description:
Outland is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player must protect their city from am alien invasion. The player controls a crosshair, and must shoot at incoming alien vessels that descend and attempt to destroy the city's defenses. When the defenses are destroyed, it's game over.
title: Outland

description:
Rally Racer is a 1-player top-down arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player must navigate a rapidly moving car through a twisting maze. The player must try to gather all of the flags, and there is an overhead map to help the player locate all the randomly placed flags. The player starts with 3 vehicles, and one is lost if the player is caught by the other vehicles which hunt the player through the maze. The player has a limited fuel supply to try to catch all flags. When all cars are lost, it's game over.
title: Rally Racer

description:
Star Cresta is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small spaceship which moves horizontally and fires vertically. There are 3 different types of levels, where the player fights against a number of fast moving small spaceships, fights against a number of slower moving larger ships, or competes against a large alien mothership. The player has limited 200 points of shield which briefly makes them invulnerable. If the player is hit, they need to restart the level, and all enemies must be destroyed to proceed. The player starts with 5 ships, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Star Cresta

description:
Stellar Warp is a 1-player science fiction-themed arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small ship which moves horizontally on the bottom of the screen, and can fire vertically forwards. The player has 3 ships, each of which has limited shields. The player fights multiple incoming alien vessels of differing designs, and after surviving a period of time, they progress to a harder level. If the player's ship is destroyed, they must restart the level.
title: Stellar Warp

description:
Warpath is a 2-player strategy war game for the TRS-80.

A party of Pawnee warriors, including bowmen, horsemen, and braves armed with tomahawks are creeping up on Fort Varptr, death and destruction their sole aim. The nine troopers in the garrison are becoming edgy as they wait for General Cursor and his reinforcements to arrive. The general, along with the company flag and some 14 troopers, must pick their way through a boulder-strewn plain, dispatching Indians with reckless abandon whenever the opportunity presents itself.

One player controls a group of bowmen, tomahawk warriors, and horsemen, who attempt to storm the poorly defended base. If the native forces make it into the base and destroy all troopers, they are victorious. If the reinforcements manage to carry their company flag into the fort, they are the winners.
title: Warpath

description:
Killer Cars is a 2-player strategy came for the TRS-80.

Two players design their own vehicle, including horsepower, inches of armor, and whether it is armed with oil slicks, land mines, a battering ram, machine guns, force field, and cannons. The players' top speed is determined by engine power and weight of their vehicle.

The two players navigate a maze, and engage in turn-based combat where they move and position their vehicles within the maze.
title: Killer Cars

description:
Stake Your Claim is a 1 - 2 player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The year is 1849, and with rumors of vast amounts of gold waiting to be uncovered, many thousands of people left the relative safety of their homes for the chance of becoming rich. During this era, staking a claim on the piece of land where you intend to dig was essential. And you always had to be on the lookout for claim jumpers.

Played on a 5 x 5 board, players take turns staking a claim on the board. The goal is to collect as many squares as possible, with the rule being no player can claim a square on any of the 4 sides of their opponent's claim. The center square can never be claimed first. The game continues until no more squares can be played, and the player with the most squares gets points based upon how many more squares they have than their opponent. Allows for 2-player or 1-player versus computer gameplay. The first player to reach 7 points is the winner.
title: Stake Your Claim

description:
Micro Millionaire is a 1-player business simulation for the TRS-80.

The player takes on the role of owner of a small software publishing company. They must hire programmers and order takes, and pay their salary and provide a workspace for them. Every month, the player can spend time evaluating software, and if they feel it is a good program, can spend time and money into debugging the software before bringing it to market. The player must spend money on advertising and packaging to help drum up sales. Every January, the player must have enough cash on hand to pay their taxes, or the company will fold. The goal is to grow the company to be worth 1 million dollars.
title: Micro Millionaire

description:
Galaxy Combat II is a single-player space combat game.

You were on a routine assignment when it happened. While you were out charting asteroids, the entire defense fleet was being devastated by Zargonian Invasion. It happened so quickly that you didn't even receive any distress calls until after you returned - to find the entire fleet in ruins.

Played on a 10 x 10 grid, there are 10 space stations, 20 Zargonian battleships, and a single Zargonian planet, which serves as their resupply point. The player is armed with 5 torpedoes, and if they move to a battleship square, they must quickly blast the enemy ship before their shields are depleted. The player must visit all 10 space stations to receive a piece of the planet killer. They can also resupply at this point. Upon receiving the planet killer, they can venture to the enemy planet to destroy it, and protect the Confederation.

Difficulty levels from 1 to 20 are available.
title: Galaxy Combat II

description:
Numbagel is a single-player number logic game.

The computer randomly chooses a 5-digit string of numbers from 0 - 9. The player tries to guess the numbers and what order they occur. For each guess, the player is told how many numbers are correct, and how many are in the correct position. The player has a total of 25 guesses to solve the puzzle.
title: Numbagel

description:
Dante's Inferno is a text adventure.

In exchange for the riches of the world, you have sold your soul to the devil. Now you realize that your immortal soul is worth more than fame and gold. Your task is to enter the gates of hell, find your contract with the devil, and escape with it.

The player can travel in 6 directions, left, right, forwards, backwards, up, and down. All commands are via single letter entry, and there are no commands available other than movement. There is no way to die, and the player is rewarded at the end of their adventure with the number of turns they took to escape.
title: Dante's Inferno

description:
Desert Peril is an action arcade game for one or two players.

The player controls a small vehicle that continually drives towards the right. The player can move forwards, backwards, up, and down. The player fights against flyers, balloons, and satellites on the main screen, and must move laterally to avoid damage and shoot enemies out of the sky. At the same time, the player must watch the land-mine detector at the bottom of the screen, and must move up and down to avoid incoming land mines. The player is rewarded bonus points for each mile travelled. The player starts with three lives, and gains an extra every 10,000 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: An Incoming Mine while Dangers Lurk Above

title: Desert Peril

description:
Lone Star Corral is a single-player strategy game.

The sun is starting to set over the far ridge; the only thing keeping you from supper is one last horse to fence in for the night. But he's a fast horse; he's so fast that you know where he was just a moment ago, and not now. Played on a 10 x 10 board, the object of the game is to completely fence in the horse in as few turns as possible. Care must be taken not to hit the horse with a fence piece, thus injuring the horse and causing the player to lose.
title: Lone Star Corral

description:
Mystery Mansion is a text-based adventure game for the TRS-80.

The player must explore a large puzzle-filled mansion to recover the 3 million dollar treasure of J. B. Hoggs, the eccentric millionaire. During their adventure, the player must brave snake pits, poison rats, and overcome a number of other puzzles. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is a save and restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Am Stuck in a Hidden Room

title: Mystery Mansion

description:
The Secret of Flagstone Manor is a text-based adventure game for the TRS-80.

You must explore the mysterious Flagstone Manor in search of treasure. The goal is to find the three numbers of the combination for the Flagstone safe that are hidden throughout the home. With this, the player must acquire the Flagstone gold and escape to freedom.

There is a save and restore feature, and all commands are via VERB NOUN commands.
title: The Secret of Flagstone Manor

description:
Treasure Hunt is a randomized text-based adventure game for the TRS-80.

Explore the Lumus caves in Lumusville, Vermont in search of treasure. Played in a series of 95 numbered rooms set out in a series of interconnecting circles, the goal is to retrieve all 20 treasures randomly hidden throughout the maze and return them to the dungeon exit in room 0. Time is limited by a limited number of charges of their lamp to illuminate the mazes, but this can be increased by recovering coins and bringing them to a vending machine for lamp fuel. There are dangers through the map including a dragon, a cave-in, and a bottomless pit that will end the game if the player wanders into the incorrect room unprepared. Pirates can steal a player's treasure, and earthquakes can rearrange locations on the map. The player will be warned when they're 1 room away from the danger, but won't be told which room it is in. Some of the treasures are required to solve puzzles or defeat enemies.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Located the Battery Vending Machine

title: Treasure Hunt

description:
Break is a single-player Breakout variant.

The player controls a paddle (with the left and right arrow keys), which moves horizontally along the bottom of the screen, and attempts to break all of the blocks present on the top by bouncing a ball. The player can choose paddle size (1 - 5), the number of rows of blocks (1 - 10), and the angle the initial ball bounces at (-30 to +30). The player has 5 balls, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Break

description:
Concentration is a memory game for two players.

The players choose from 32 items arranged on a 4 x 8 grid. Each item contains a prize or a wildcard, and if the player manages to choose two matching cards or wildcard, they win that prize and its dollar value. On each match, the player tries to guess a number from 1 - 100. They are told if the real number is higher or lower than their guess. The player who guesses the secret number correctly wins all their prizes, and the player with the highest score after 3 rounds is the winner.
title: Concentration

description:
Casino Game Pack, also known as Casino Games on the cassettes and Radio Shack Casino Computer Games on the cover of the manual, is a collection of six casino-style games for the TRS-80. The package contains the following 6 games, each on one side of a cassette tape:

  • Baccarat: a recreation of the famous casino card game.
  • Craps: in this game, you aren't supposed to be the person actually shooting craps. Instead you can bet for or against the shooter.
  • Keno: this game is sort of like a lottery game where you try to match your numbers with numbers chosen by the computer.
  • Roulette: similar to a real roulette wheel, you can bet on specific numbers, colors, or other bets.
  • Slot Machine: this is a standard slot machine game where you pull a lever and hope to get lucky.
  • Wheel of Fortune: another variant of a roulette wheel.
title: Casino Game Pack

description:
Mastermind is a single-player code breaking game.

The player has 10 turns to try to solve a 4-number puzzle, with each number being a digit between 1 and 6. The computer tells the player how many digits are correct, and how many digits are correct and in the correct position. The computer tracks how many games the player has won, and how many turns it takes to win on average.

There is also the option for players to input their own code, and allow the computer to try to solve it. The player must tell the computer how many digits are correct, and are correct in the correct position. The player is not allowed to lie to the computer.
title: Mastermind

description:
Robot is a single-player action game.

The player controls an 'X' that must navigate a maze without getting attacked by any of the approaching robots represented by an 'O'. If the player touches an electric fence, which represents the borders of the map, or comes in contact with a robot, the game is lost. The player can define the number of robots and electric fences that are present in the game area.
title: Robot

description:
Remainder is a math puzzle solving game.

At the start of the game, the computer attempts to guess your age by asking for the remainder after your current age is divided by 3, 5, and 7.

The player then has 4 turns to guess the identity of a number between 1 and 100. The player selects a number, and is told the remainder after being divided by that number. If the player is not successful after 4 turns, they are given the answer.
title: Remainder

description:
Safari is a strategy and action game for one to six players.

You're in the running for a contract with a major Hollywood film studio. To win the contract, you must go on safari in Africa to photograph as many animals in their natural surrounding as possible without becoming lost or running out of supplies.

Played on a large 13 x 13 grid, the player must explore in search of animals to photograph. At the beginning of each expedition, the player must choose from a limited number of cameras, supplies, guides, and bearers to accompany them. Each move on the grid costs a number of supplies. Guides increase the odds of finding an animal. After finding an animal, the player enters an arcade section, where they must try to position a moving animal in the center of their camera frame to take a good picture. Supplies dwindle quickly while photographing. Points are awarded for the number of animal pictures successfully captured. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Safari

description:
Timebomb is a single-player maze navigation game.

The player must explore a large maze, and find and deactivate a bomb before it explodes. The player can potentially move up to 8 directions at any time. The player is given the location of the bomb and their current location, and tries to reach the bomb prior to the their turns running out.
title: Timebomb

description:
Strategy Games - 3 (also referred to as just "Strategy Games") is a collection of 5 games for the TRS-80.

  • Evasion is a variant of the classic Snake game.
  • Jigsaw simulates a jigsaw puzzle.
  • The Masters simulates a game of golf for up to 4 players.
  • Motor Racing is a top-down racing game.
  • Tunnel Vision is a 3D maze game with a first person view.
title: Strategy Games-3

description:
Amazin' Mazes is an action game for one to four players.

The player tries to navigate a small block though a maze of twisting and constantly changing passageways. Each maze is timed, and the player has a limited amount of time to escape from each maze. There are multiple exits to each maze, and each contains a specific number of points for reaching the exit depending on their distance from the start point. As the counter goes down, the points rewarded for each exit decreases. Whenever the player is not moving, the layout of the maze begins to change, with passageways opening and slamming shut. There are three levels of difficulty, and it is possible for an exit score to go negative during a maze.
title: Amazin' Mazes

description:
Atlantic Balloon Crossing is a simulation for one to three players.

This is a simulation of the flight of the Double Eagle II hot air balloon crossing from Presque Isle, Maine, USA to Paris, France, which started August 11, 1978. The player controls the ballast and gas of their hot air balloon. Wind direction varies with altitude and position, and the player controls their flight path by adjusting their altitude. The player receives points based upon how close they come to Paris, France, and the time to their landing. The higher altitudes have more northerly winds. Ambient temperatures are expressed in Kalvin, and temperature changes during the day. The game is played from the sideview, where the player influences altitude, and time passes in quick 3 minute intervals. The radio can be used to determine player location, although the player is sometime outside of radio contact. The player has a limited supply of gas and ballast, and the player may not reach their destination if these run out. At altitude over 28,000 feet, gas is lost.
title: Atlantic Balloon Crossing

description:
Jigsaw is a puzzle game.

The player has six different shaped puzzle pieces to place on a 4 x 4 grid numbered 1 - 16. Each puzzle has a random position of pieces on the grid, and pieces can be used more than once. The pieces 1 - 6 are randomly selected, and the player tries to guess the position they're placed.
title: Jigsaw

description:
Dive Bomb! is an action game for two players.

One player tries to divebomb an enemy battleship, while the opposing player tries to shoot the plane out of the sky. Player 1 controls a battleship that sails slowly from the left. It has 3 shots for every plane that approaches, and it only fires at a 45 degree angle. Player 2 controls a fast moving torpedo bomber that comes from the right. It can ascend, descend, and drop torpedoes. Each player tries to destroy the enemy vessel.
title: Dive Bomb!

description:
Letter Crunch is a strategy game for one or two players.

Players take turns firing from the left at a 9 x 10 grid of letters containing the characters A - F. The player chooses to shoot from rows 1 - 9, and depending upon the letter hit, the player gets a certain number of the surrounding letters. For instance the letter A only awards that letter, while the letter F awards points for the letter hit and the letters above and below. Each letter is worth 1 point, and there are also bonus and penalty squares worth positive or negative 5 points. The goal is to maximize score, while forcing the opponent to take low value shots. There is a computer opponent available.
title: Letter Crunch

description:
Super Sub is a single-player action game.

The player controls a small submarine which scrolls horizontally on the bottom of the screen while enemy vessels scroll horizontally from either side of the screen one at a time. The goal is to launch torpedoes one at a time to attempt to destroy enemy vessels. There are 4 levels of difficulty, and the player starts with 20 torpedoes. The game tracks how many enemy ships are destroyed. The player must avoid enemy torpedoes, and must avoid hitting enemy mines with their own torpedoes, as this will waste the shot.
title: Super Sub

description:
Nim is a strategy game for one or two players.

Players take turns removing items from three stacks, with the player who takes the last item the loser. Stacks are displayed numerically, and the player can take how many items they please on each turn. Allows for 2-player game or competition against the computer.
title: Nim

description:
Entrapment is an action game for two players.

Each player controls a small character that moves about a board, leaving a progressively growing tail in their wake. Each player can move in the four cardinal directions, and must attempt to trap the other player so that they can't move. If the player strikes another's tail or the outer walls they lose. The game tracks the number of wins for each player.
title: Entrapment

description:
Yahtzee is a dice game for one to nine players.

Players take turns rolling five dice, and the player can reroll any or all of the dice twice more before selecting their scoring category. Scoring categories include the sum of all ones to sixes, 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, full house, a 4 dice straight, a 5 dice straight, yahtzee (5 of a kind) and chance (which is the sum of all dice). A game is finished when all 11 scoring categories have been used. The game tracks top high scores, and dice are graphically displayed on the top of the screen.
title: Yahtzee

description:
Tank Search and Capture is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Two tanks drive about a contained area trying to pick up numbers randomly chosen from 1 - 9 that appear on the playfield. Tanks are controlled by turning clockwise/counterclockwise, and accelerating. As the tanks move, they leave a field of letters behind them, making it difficult to spot numbers as they appear. The player receives the number of points represented by the number they pick up. Games last for 100 seconds, and the player who has the most points at the end is the winner.
title: Tank Search and Capture

description:
Collision is a 1 - 5 player arcade driving game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small car at the top of the screen that can move horizontally left and right. The road and other cars continually scrolls towards the player, and the player earns points for avoiding vehicles and not colliding with the side of the road. The player can define the speed of their vehicle, the traffic density, and how windy the roads are. The player receives a total score over 5 races.
title: Collision!

description:
Star Fortress is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a spaceship that moves horizontally and fires vertically upwards. A large alien hides behind 4 layers of alternately scrolling shields. The player tries to shoot out the shields to destroy the alien behind. Alien defense systems continuously fire towards the player, and if the alien aligns with open shields, it will also fire through the defense system. If the lowest level of shields is overly damaged, a new level of shield forms, and the shield levels are shifted downwards. The player starts with 3 lives, and gains a life and 500 points for every alien destroyed. There are 5 levels of difficulty.
title: Star Fortress

description:
Falling Aliens is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a base which moves horizontally on the bottom of the screen, and fires rapidly upwards. Aliens attempt to land on the bottom of the screen, and if they reach the bottom, a base is destroyed. Fast moving alien bombs coming from above must also be avoided. The player gains 10 points for every destroyed alien and 20 points for every destroyed bomb. The player starts with 3 bases, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Falling Aliens

description:
Gravitron is a single-player action game.

The player controls a spaceship that can move in all directions, while the force of gravity constantly pulls the ship downwards. The ship fires vertically upwards, and at a 45 degree angle downwards to the left and right. The player must destroy enemy installations. They start with 4 sips, and if all are lost, it's game over. There are 20 levels of difficulty, and at higher levels enemy installations fire more frequently. As well, on higher levels, saucers will approach rapidly from the side of the screen after a quick warning, preventing the player from staying at the top of the screen.
title: Gravitron

description:
Reversi is an Othello game for one or two players.

Played on an 8 x 8 board, each player takes turns placing one of two colored pieces on the board. The player gains any pieces on the board their opponent has between their two pieces when played. The player with the most pieces at the end of the game is the victor. The player can compete against 6 different named computer opponents, some of whom will occasionally cheat. The computer opponents can also compete against each other.
title: Reversi

description:
Nukliex is a single-player action game.

The player controls a small spaceship that can move in all directions, but can only fire forwards. The player must travel through 4 stages of rapidly moving enemy asteroids and alien vessels, where the enemies rapidly replenish as they're destroyed. After enough are destroyed, the player warps to a new area. They then encounter the outside of the alien ship, where they must destroy enemy defenses and gun turrets. Finally, they enter into the alien vessel, where they must destroy the heart of the spaceship. There are a total of 10 levels of difficulty, and the player starts with 5 ships, but can earn more as they gather points.
title: Nukliex

description:
The Battle of Zeighty is a single-player strategy game.

Congratulations! You have just been appointed general of a small and struggling army, in a small and struggling country. You should consider this an honor, even though the army has had six generals in the last two months. Somehow, each general seemed to mysteriously disappear after a battle was lost.

To defeat the enemy nation, you must conquer The Zeighty Pass, a highly defended pass through an otherwise impassable mountain range, and the sole supply route for the enemy's advanced troops. If the pass can be conquered, the tide of war will turn in your nation's favor.

The player arranges an army of 10 units, which can be chosen from armored infantry, tanks, mine layers, and artillery. Armored infantry and tanks serve as combat troops, while artillery can bombard enemy positions from a distance. Mine layers can deploy mines to destroy enemy units. Gameplay occurs on a battlefield, where the player can move their units in 8 directions, and issue attack commands. The player controls a home base, which must be defended, and fog of war allows enemy units to hide when at a sufficient range. Each unit starts with 1000 health units, and will progressively take damage during combat until they are destroyed. Victory is achieved by destroying the enemy's base to the north.
title: The Battle of Zeighty

description:
Exterminate is an action game for one or two players.

The world is counting on you to annihilate a horde of alien bugs that are trying to escape from an underground cavern. Your only weapons are your skill, strategy, and an armed "Rover".

The player controls a small vessel which can move underground and shoot in the 4 cardinal directions. Small alien bugs come crawling across the screen from the left to right, and the player must dig their way through the rock to destroy the aliens. The player is awarded points for aliens destroyed, but loses points should aliens make it across the screen. If they are hit by alien fire, they lose a rover. Three rovers lost, and it's game over.
title: Exterminate

description:
Amazing Chase is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player must try to avoid 2 computer opponents within a randomly generated maze. The player is represented by a small square, while two computer squares continually chase the player. The computer opponents will never reverse direction, but will move in one direction and can then change by 90 degrees if needed The player competes in 5 mazes, and the goal is to reach 400 time units on a maze, at which point the player is awarded 100 bonus points, and moves on to the next maze. The player's score is the total over 5 mazes.
title: Amazing Chase

description:
Arena is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a tank that can accelerate, reverse, rotate clockwise or counterclockwise, and fire forwards. The tanks can blow away terrain that gets in their way, and the goal is to shoot the other player before getting shot.
title: Arena

description:
Bowling is a 1 - 2 player sports game for the TRS-80.

The player bowls from the right side of the screen to the left, and the ball randomly starts in a location on the lane. The player must select what position, how much hook, and what direction they wish to hook the ball. There are 4 options each for position and degree of hook. Pins are knocked down based upon how the ball hits, and scoring follows typical bowling rules. The current scores are always displayed on the bottom of the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choosing Degree and Position of Hook

title: Bowling

description:
Crusher is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small vessel that can move horizontally and fire vertically. A rotating wall slowly moves towards the player, who tries to shoot out blocks of the wall to prevent it from reaching the player and crushing them. The goal is to last as long as possible, and the player receives a final score for the number of blocks shot.
title: Crusher

description:
Crushman is a 1-player hangman game for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to guess letters to spell an unknown word. For every incorrect word, the walls surrounding a character are progressively contracted. Game progresses until the word is guessed or the player is crushed. The game tracks previously used letters and the number of words guessed successfully.
title: Crushman

description:
Defend is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The invaders have arrived. The player has 90 seconds to destroy as many space invaders as possible. They control a small spaceship which moves horizontally on the bottom of the screen, and fires forward to destroy alien vessels moving horizontally on the screen. The player must avoid fire from the invaders. The player loses 100 points if hit. They gain 25 points for hitting an invader in the 1st row, 50 points for the middle row, and 100 points for the top row. The player gains points for clearing out a row. The player changes direction when they shoot, and there can only be 2 shots in the air at one time. The player receives an extra 20 seconds if they reach a score of 600.
title: Defend

description:
31 Dice is a numerical strategy game versus the computer for the TRS-80.

The player chooses a number between 31 and 49. The player and the computer then takes turns choosing a number between 1 and 6, which are graphically displayed as a die each turn. The player who is forced to take the last roll is the loser. The computer continually makes jokes and comments on your play.
title: 31 Dice

description:
Domain is a 2-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

Players take turns placing 8 different geometric shapes onto a 9 x 9 puzzle board. Each piece can be rotated, and can only be placed in an adequate space. When a piece is placed on the board, surrounding geometric pieces are taken over by the placed piece. The goal is to have the most number of captured squares at the end of the game, when no moves are remaining. All pieces can be rotated, and are placed by inputting the coordinates of where to locate them. Gameplay options allow for a piece placed near an opponent's captures one piece, or captures all adjacent opponent's pieces.
title: Domain

description:
Beasts is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character surrounded by beasts and moveable blocks. The player can push blocks around, and the goal is to destroy the beasts by completely surrounding them with blocks. If the player is caught by a beast, it's game over. There are 2 skill levels, and the player can choose to start with 1 - 10 beasts.
title: Beasts

description:
Dr. Casey's Pocket Puzzle is a sliding block puzzle for the TRS-80.

Played on a 5 x 5 grid with 24 letters and one empty space, the player must slide letters to complete a number of words. There are 6 levels of difficulty. After completing a puzzle, the computer shows the optimal path and minimal number of turns.
title: Dr. Casey's Pocket Puzzle

description:
Space Blitz is a 1-player space-themed arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a space vessel that can move horizontally at the bottom of the screen, and can fire vertically upwards. Alien bombs are loaded into a series of 8 tubes, and begin to fall towards the player. The player tries to shoot these without getting hit. When alien bombs hit the bottom of the screen, they explode, and can destroy the player even if nearby. The player has 5 ships, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Space Blitz

description:
Bouncer is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls an 'X', which bounces about the screen, but can only safely bounce on the '='. The player can move left and right, and if they land on a '#' they lose a life. The goal is to bounce through the screen to reach the 'O', which is the exit to the next level. There are 10 levels in total, and on levels 2, 6, and 10, the player must clear all the '-" to go to the next level. Each level is timed for bonus points, and they player has 3 lives, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Bouncer

description:
Project Triad is an adventure game for the TRS-80.

Contains 3 different adventure games embedded within each other, which can be accessed by finding and using the computer found within each program. If the player dies in any of these adventure games, they will restart within the same one. In the first adventure game, the player starts alone on a spaceship, and must figure out how to diffuse the bomb hidden within a display terminal. In the second adventure game, the player must escape a warehouse by using a number of color-coded hints. In the final adventure, the player finds themselves in L'Hopital De Ath, a psychiatric hospital, where they must escape the clutches of a murderer.

sample_screenshots.caption: Now I'm in the Third Adventure Game
Ripped Off by a Vending Machine

title: Project Triad

description:
Maze Race is a first person maze navigation game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a mouse from the first person perspective, and attempts to navigate a randomized maze from the top left corner to the bottom right. Mazes vary in size from 6 x 6 to 14 x 14. The player can turn left, right, or move forwards. Each race is timed, and if the player strikes a wall they lose a life. Lose 3 lives, and the maze is lost. The player can preview the maze before starting.
title: Maze Race

description:
Springer is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls an 'X', which bounces about the screen, but can only safely bounce on the '-'. The player can move left and right, and if they land on mine '*' they lose a life. The goal is to bounce through the screen to reach the '=', which is the exit to the next level. There are 10 levels in total, and the player gains 100 points for each level completed. Each level is timed for bonus points, and they player has 5 lives, and when all are lost, it's game over. The player gets an extra life every 500 points.
title: Springer

description:
Dr. Casey's Ten Grand is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to move on a board to reach the score of 10,000. Played on a 6 x 6 board, with the numbers of 1, 50, 100, 500, and 1000 randomly placed across, the player can move up, down, left, and right to try to reach the required score. If the player goes above 10,000, they need to restart the game.
title: Dr. Casey's Ten Grand

description:
Men Away is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You are the pilot of a DC-10 flying from Cincinnati to Dallas. The flight is routine until you hit the landing gear switch. You hear a loud noise, and notice something fallen from the plane. You verify the engines are still there, but the landing gear has fallen off. Luckily, due to your excellent navigational abilities, you find yourself near the Grand Canyon. A plan is quickly made to fill the canyon with foam and have the passengers jump into it.

A large plane flies sequentially from the left and the right. The player can choose to launch a passenger forward with some or increased forward velocity. If the passenger successfully lands in foam, they are saved, reducing the available foam. There are 3 available levels: box valley, valley, and volcano. The player can also create custom levels. The player chooses how much foam is remaining before the level is reset, and can play by time or number of misses
title: Men Away!

description:
Blockout is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a character that continuously moves about a field, which leaves a progressively elongating tail behind them. The player can choose to have obstacles to dodge, or can play on an empty field. On easy mode, the player can see their tail, while in hard mode they cannot. There are 5 options for game speed. As the player moves, their score increases. At 100 points, a small ball begins to bounce on the screen. At 200 points, a bigger ball begins to bounce, that wrecks the previously laid out tail. At 300 points, another little ball appears, and at 400 points a large ball with a string attached appears, but when it hits a wall it breaks, allowing the player to travel through these breaks. For every 100 points, another small or big ball progressively appears.
title: Blockout

description:
Derision is a 1 - 2 player math game for the TRS-80.

The player or computer opponent take turns deriving a number. At the start of each round, a target number is selected. The second player must then derive another number from it by halving, doubling, squaring, or taking the square root of a number. In a two-digit number, the player can add, subtract, multiply, or divide its digits. Points are scored by using the target number as one of the digits of the number, or if the digits of the number add, subtract, multiply, or divide to total the target number. In deriving numbers, the players may not use any number twice, nor may not use the target number itself. When no number can be legally derived, the round is over and a new target number is chosen and play begins again. The first player to reach 10 points is the winner.
title: Derision

description:
Atom Smasher is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small vessel which moves horizontally on the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically forwards. A bouncing ball moves about the screen, and whenever it hits, it splits into two bouncing balls. These consistently split into more and more obstacles to be avoided and shot. The player starts with 5 ships, and loses a ship when hit. Every 50 points guarantees the player a new ship.
title: Atom Smasher

description:
Artillery 2000 is a 2-player artillery game for the TRS-80.

It is the year 2000, and the human race has taken their artillery battle to the planets. Players can compete on 10 separate battlefields from Mercury to Pluto, each with their own gravity and wind conditions. Two artillery are then placed on a hilly terrain, and they take turns inputting the muzzle velocity (1 - 20) and angle of elevation (0 - 90 degrees) of their shot. A player gets a point when they hit an enemy, and the game begins on new terrain.
title: Artillery 2000

description:
Killer Copter is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a helicopter that can move in all directions, and must protect their base from approaching enemies. Enemies travel along the ground from both sides of the screen, and fire towards the player. If they reach the player's base, it's game over. The player must shoot towards the enemies, and if the player is hit, they lose a helicopter. The player has limited fuel and ammo, and must land at their base to refuel. The player has 3 helicopters, and it's game over when all are lost. There's 4 levels of difficulty, and the player can chose 8 levels of helicopter speed.
title: Killer Copter

description:
Rescue is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You control two firefighters with a net, who must move horizontally to catch people jumping out of a burning apartment building. After catching a person, you must move them to the waiting ambulance on the right of the screen. Each person caught is worth 10 points, and carrying them to the ambulance is worth another 10. You must avoid furniture being thrown out of the building. If the player misses 3 people, it's game over.
title: Rescue

description:
Sahara Safari is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The object of Sahara Safari is to ride a camel 200 miles across the desert, while being chased by a tribe of hungry Kulanian pygmy cannibals. Each turn, the player can travel fast or slow. Travelling fast uses up more of the camel's energy, while travelling slow will allow the pygmies to catch up. The player starts with a limited supply of water, and the player must stop to drink every 6 days. They can randomly find oases as they travel. Every few days, the camel must rest, and the camel can also become injured by sandstorms. If the camel is pushed too hard, it will die, and the game is over. The player can also get captured by fierce and wild Tartarians, and the player can try to escape, or may get held for ransom.
title: Sahara Safari

description:
Bug Attack is a 1-player Centipede clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character on the bottom of the screen who can move in all directions. Centipedes stream from the top left of the screen, whom split when shot, and move downwards towards the player. A new centipede appears when all segments are destroyed. On harder difficulties, fleas stream from the top of the screen leaving new obstacles, and large spiders move about the screen to endanger the player. The player starts with 5 lives, and it's game over when all are lost. There are 9 levels of difficulty
title: Bug Attack

description:
Sunken Treasure is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

The Spanish galleon has been down there for three centuries. Only recently you discovered its exact location. Now you're standing in full dress scuba gear on the deck of the sunken galleon at a depth of 100 feet, wondering how you're going to find your way to the safe which you know contains hundreds of solid gold doubloons worth millions of dollars.

You only have a 20 minute air supply to try to find the treasure. All entries are via VERB NOUN entry. There are multiple inventory-based puzzles to solve. There is no save/restore feature.
title: Sunken Treasure

description: Blitzkrieg is a fairly simple game where you control a man who can run left and right horizontally across the bottom of the screen. He needs to avoid up to 15 bombs falling simultaneously from above. You have three lives. The bombs become faster as the game progresses.
title: Blitzkrieg

description:
Dekapede is a 1-player Centipede clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character on the bottom of the screen who can move left and right. Dekapedes stream from the top right of the screen, whom split when shot, and move downwards towards the player. A new centipede appears when all segments are destroyed. The player starts with 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Dekapede

description:
Dinosaur is a 1-player text-based strategy game for the TRS-80.

You are a tyrannosaurus rex. This means you are very strong. It also means you are very hungry, You must roam the prehistoric land looking for food. The player can search in the hills, plains, or swamps. Each search attempt increases the dinosaur's hunger, and the player can die from starvation if they do not eat. They will randomly encounter different dinosaurs, which have varying strength. The player can choose to attack or flee, and in combat they have an option to perform a defensive claw or an attacking bite. If the player wins the combat, they will eat their prey, and lose hunger, they will also become stronger and hungrier, allowing them to take on larger prey.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Eat an Iguanodon and Level Up

title: Dinosaur

description:
Otter is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to chase pesky otters away from a pond in the least amount of time. The player can move themselves vertically, and must skip stones along the water to deter the otters. Gameplay is timed, and the player receives points for each otter removed.
title: Otter

description:
Sammy Slug is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small block-like slug which can move in the cardinal directions. The goal is to crawl from the bottom to the top of the screen, while crawling through holes, and avoiding moving blocks. The player starts with 3 lives, and if they get hit, they lose a life. Each level has a bonus timer, and the player gets 100 points plus a bonus for the remaining time after completing a level. When all lives are lost, it's game over.
title: Sammy Slug

description:
Conqueror is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a spaceship that moves horizontally on the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically upwards. The player must combat waves of alien spaceships. Aliens move rapidly across the screen, with two groups moving in opposite directions. When they cross the screen, they move down a row, and reverse direction. When an alien ship is hit, it dives directly downwards towards the player. The player starts with 5 lives, and when they clear an alien field, they warp to the next encounter.
title: Conqueror

description:
Trak is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.
