You play as a small character who must follow a series of tracks places on a level, while avoiding enemies. As the player moved, he converts the '+' track to '.'. The player gains points for travelling on '+' spaces, but loses points for travelling on '.' spaces. As the enemies moves about the screen, they replenish the track, allowing the player to gain more points. If the player is caught by a pursuing enemy, it's game over.
title: Trak

description:
Laser Blitz is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small vessel that moves horizontally on the bottom of the screen, but can fire vertically upwards. Alien vessels appear spread across the top of the screen, and then falls to the bottom in columns. If the player completely clears out a column, that column will no longer replenish. If the column reaches the bottom of the screen, the player loses a life. The player has 5 bases, and if all are lost, it's game over.
title: Laser Blitz

description:
Jumper is a 1 - 2 player Frogger clone game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a frog who can move in the cardinal directions. They must move across a busy street full of pedestrians, avoid snakes, cross a river by moving across logs, and place their frog within one of the waiting awaiting spaces at the top of the screen. When all seven spaces are filled, the player moves to a new challenge with more and faster moving opponents.
title: Jumper

description:
Space Odyssey is a text adventure game for the TRS-80.

The year is 2182. The place is the nearby star system of Zeta Omicron. You have been captured by a humanoid race known as the Malokites. During the battle, your star cruiser was all but destroyed, as you were easily overcome by the Malokites technical advancements since they seceded from the Interplanetary Union. You are the only survivor, spared only to be interrogated. You awaken in a small detention cell, and must find some way to escape from the Malokite detention center with as much technology as possible, and return to Interplanetary Union space.

The player must explore the different locations within the alien base, while avoiding detection by wandering guard patrols and other dangers. All entries are via VERB NOUN entry. There are multiple inventory-based puzzles to solve. There is a save/restore feature available.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Find Something in the Space Garbage

title: Space Odyssey

description:
Robbery! is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a bank robber who must control three bank tellers while trying to steal money. The tellers continuously move towards to bank alarm, trying to warn the police of the player's presence. The player can move left or right, and when they are is positioned below a teller, they fire warning shots, making them back away from the alarm. The goal is to steal the money on the left of the screen and then escape to the getaway car on the right without allowing a teller to alert the police.
title: Robbery!

description:
Stack Four is a 1-player versus computer 3-dimensional Tic Tac Toe game.

Played on a 4 x 4 x 4 board, there are 76 possible winning combinations to score 4 in a row. There are 4 levels of computer opponent. Playing pieces are graphically displayed as sitting on pegs.
title: Stack Four

description:
Adventure Dungeon is a 1-player roleplaying game for the TRS-80.

You wish to join the wise council, but to do that you must prove your worth by passing the test of power. You must overcome 5 levels of a dangerous dungeon and retrieve treasures and defeat monsters.

Each level is arranged in a large field, where the player can only see the items directly surrounding them. The goal is to defeat every monster and retrieve all treasures. Monsters are stationary, and enter combat when approached, or the player takes a treasure adjacent to them.

The player starts with 300 hit points. In combat, each monster has a hit point value. Using the same number of hit points as the monster gives a 50% chance of winning the battle. Using 200% gives a 100% chance of winning the battle. After each combat, the player recovers hit points based upon the amount used, with a higher risk of failure leading to greater hit point recovery. The player only gains more hit points than they started with if there is a risk of losing combat. If the player uses less than 150% hit points and is defeated, they are killed, and the game is over.

Any time outside of combat, the player can convert their score to hit points. 10% of the score can be converted each time, with a conversion of 1:1 of the first conversion, 1:2 on the second, and so forth.
title: Adventure Dungeon

description:
Meteor is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You are a pilot of a space ship that can move horizontally across the top of the screen, and fires directly downwards. Each level is divided into two parts, a meteorite and an alien stage. During the meteorite stage, the player must blast their way through a meteorite field. Then, an alien comes across the screen, and the player has one chance to try to shoot it for bonus points. Each round, the meteorite field increases in size. If the player fails to clear a path through the field, it's game over.
title: Meteor

description:
Dinosaur is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You are a caveman trying to steal eggs from a dinosaur. You must throw rocks to temporarily stun them. The caveman can move left and right. When far away from the dinosaur, rocks are thrown vertically upwards to hit egg stealing birds. Closer, rocks are thrown at 45 degrees, and if they hit the dinosaur, it's temporarily stunned. The dinosaur has four phases: looking away from player, standing up, looking towards the player, and breathing fire. The dinosaur can only be hit while standing up, and can kill the player if he's standing too close while breathing fire. Every 6 eggs stolen, the player advances to a new level. The player has 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Dinosaur

description:
Fireball! is a 1-player side scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small vessel which can move in all directions, and fires horizontally to the right. Undulating fireballs come from the right, and if they hit the player, they lose a ship. The player gains 10 points for every fireball hit, and 1 point for each fireball dodged. Game speed increased with score. The player starts with 4 ships.
title: Fireball!

description:
Alexis is a text adventure game for the TRS-80.

You are Alexis, rightfully King Alexis V, and heir to the throne of the island of Xanthus in the Greek archipelago. When your father Alexis IV died, General Tarkaan took over the kingdom and put you in jail. Your goal is to recover the kingdom and wear the crown of Xanthus once more.

The player starts their adventure in General Tarkaan's jail, and must gain their freedom. The player's goal is then to raise an army to combat Tarkaan on the island of Tripolis by bringing them the Crystal Sphere from Hades. The player must explore several other Greek islands to accomplish this, and must carefully watch the weather and their direction while at sea. After bringing their army to confront General Tarkaan, the game briefly takes on a strategy component, where the player chooses military tactics from a list. At the end of the adventure, the length of the player's reign is determined by how many turns were required to complete the game.

All entries are via VERB NOUN entry. There are multiple inventory-based puzzles to solve. There is no save/restore feature available.
title: Alexis

description:
Lunar Outpost is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a stationary lunar outpost in the center of the screen that can fire in the 4 cardinal directions. Alien vessels appear in these 4 locations, and fire towards the player. The player must quickly intercept the incoming missiles, and blast the alien vessels. Gameplay becomes progressively faster, and the goal is to survive as long as possible.
title: Laser Outpost

description:
Tunnels of the Ancient is a 1-player adventure game for the TRS-80.

The player moves through a series of tunnels killing monsters to amass treasure. The player navigates tunnels by travelling north, south, east, or west. As the player moves, they are attacked by monsters, including: zombies, goblins, dragons, orcs, berserkers, dwarves, demons, and gnomes. During combat, the player can attack each round, and if their hit points fall low, they can drink a potion. The player has limited hit points, and if they run out of potions to restore them, they will die in combat leading to game over. Potions can sometimes be found after combat. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Tunnels of the Ancient

description:
Ship Adventure is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

A smuggling ring has been using a small, old tramp freighter, the M. S. adventure, to transport stolen gems from South Africa to the United States. As a U.S. Customs Agent, your task is to board the ship, search and inspect it, and if you are clever, find the seven treasures the smugglers have hidden aboard.

The player must search the abandoned ship, and bring the seven treasures to the starting point on the gangplank. All entries are via VERB NOUN entry. There are multiple inventory-based puzzles to solve. There is no save/restore feature available.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Find an Emerald in the Crow's Nest

title: Ship Adventure

description:
Mole Patrol is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Moles are trying to get to the surface, and you must drop rocks on them to kill them. There are 5 columns where moles climb to the surface. The player selects the numbers 1 - 5 to drop a rock in that column, and if it hits a mole, the player gains 10 points. If a mole reaches the surface, the player loses 10 points. Only one rock can be dropped at a time. The goal is to maximize score during a limited time frame.
title: Mole Patrol

description:
Evasion is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a steadily enlarging block that is sandwiched between two rows of scrolling turrets. The block can be moved horizontally, and the player must try to avoid cannon fire. As the block widens, the game becomes more difficult, and the goal is to survive as long as possible.
title: Evasion

description:
Cave Raider is a 1-player side-scrolling game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to navigate a small spaceship through a twisting cavern. The ship can move up and down, and if they collide with a wall, it's game over. Points are awarded for how long the ship survives.
title: Cave Raider

description:
Reactor is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You are the head janitor at a nuclear power plant, and the radiation slimes have taken over. The player must navigate a series of platforms and ladders, while trying to capture the uranium cores. Each uranium core captured kills a slime, and if the player touches a slime or steps off the reactor into the uranium storage bins below, a life is lost. The player receives 100 points for each core captured, and 1,000 points for each level cleared. Level 1 requires 1 core captured, and each proceeding level requires one additional core. The player starts with 3 janitors, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Reactor

description:
Swarm is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a large character that moves in all directions. They are constantly followed by 4 swarmers, who move inexorably towards the player. If the player strikes a wall or a swarmer, they lose a life. As the game progresses, mines appear, to make navigation more difficult. The player is rewarded a score for how long they can avoid the dangers. The player starts with 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Swarm

description:
Building of Death is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

You have become trapped in a deadly department store. The player must escape in one piece. The player starts with 40 turns with of food, and must find food at various times to survive the adventure. The player encounters a variety of dangers including lions, vicious dogs, and a wandering vampire who enters the store on turn 30. All entries are via VERB NOUN entry. There are multiple inventory-based puzzles to solve. There is no save/restore feature available.
title: Building of Death

description:
Jewels is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You are a thief, who is trying to take jewels from the right of the screen and deposit them in an empty space on the left. Every time the player moves a jewel to the left, another object appears on the screen to trip up the player. If the player runs into one of these objects, it's game over. The player gains 10 points for every jewel successfully transported. The player can move up and down, but moves at a constant rate horizontally, forcing them to quickly dodge objects.
title: Jewels

description:
Math is a 1-player math learning game with an arcade component.

The game displays a multiplication, division, subtraction, or addition question, which the player answers. If correct, the player takes on an arcade component, where they try to shoot a spaceship with a turret as it moves horizontally across the screen. The game tracks the number of correct answers and spaceships hit.
title: Math

description:
Match Six is a 1 - 6 player strategy game for the TRS-80.

Players take turns playing 1 of 6 available pieces on a 3 x 3 board. The goal is to place six pieces within a space on the board, but dots cannot overlap, and it may take multiple pieces to complete each box. Each of the 6 pieces can be rotated, placed, or changed. Every placement or changing requires a turn. Each piece played yields that number of points, and the player gains 6 points for each square filled, at which point that square is again emptied. Bonus points can be gained by reaching exactly 50 points, or completing a 6 point square is a predetermined space. The goal is to be the first player to reach 100 points.
title: Match Six

description:
Demolition Derby is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You have entered the demolition derby, and your goal is to destroy the most cars. You are driving your powerful custom-built destruction machine which includes a battering ram that you've welded to the front bumper. Players either compete alone or with another player to see how many cars they can demolish in 120 time units. Each car destroyed leaves a wreckage on the game field that players must avoid. Two cars move about the screen to destroy by running into them. The player can move in 8 directions, and can accelerate or turn left and right.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Leave a Path of Destruction

title: Demolition Derby

description:
Pac Mania is a 1-player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character who must eat the dots in a maze, while avoiding the ghosts whom continuously chase the player. Power pellets make the ghosts temporarily vulnerable. When the player eats all the dots, they move on to a new challenge. The player starts with 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Pac Mania

description:
Picaria is a 1 - 2 player board game for the TRS-80.

Players take turns placing 3 pieces on a 3 x 3 board with crosses on them. After each piece has been placed, pieces can be moved 1 piece at a time, with the gal being the first player to complete 3 in a row. There are 3 levels of computer opponent. Players take turns making the first turn.
title: Picaria

description:
Venerian Invasion is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The Venerians are invading the Earth, and it is your job to stop them. There are 4 shields around the Earth at the bottom of the screen, and a row of Venerians at the top of the screen. The creatures drop down on top of the shields, and if more than 2 aliens are present on the shields at a time, the shield fails. The player controls a small ship which moves horizontally, and can run into a fallen Venerian to remove them from the shield. If a Venerian falls on the player, it counts as an extra Venerian on the shield. After surviving a screen of Venerians, a new screen appears with faster moving aliens. Then game is over when all 4 shields are destroyed.
title: Venerian Invasion

description:
Millionaire is a 1-player investment game for the TRS-80.

You have just won $100,000 in the lottery. All your life, you'd bragged to your friends that if you just had some money, you would be a master investor. Now's your chance. The player has 10 years to invest their money, with the goal to make $1,000,000 before the game is over.

Each turn, the player can buy or sell gold or silver, buy or sell stocks and real estate, or get and pay off a loan. Money that is not invested gains bank interest.
title: Millionaire

description: Spelling Bee is an educational game in which the player is asked to spell words. Words are taken from a list which can be adjusted to the player's ability. Words will be asked randomly and are shown first, then hidden and the player must correctly type the word.
title: Spelling Bee

description:
Island Adventure is a 1-player text adventure for the TRS-80.

As the famous explorer U.R. Lostagain, you find yourself stranded on Mightystrange Island. Your task is to explore the island, find six treasures, and escape from the island. There are a total of 6 treasures to find, each word 10 points for a total score of 60.

All entries are via VERB NOUN entry. There are multiple inventory-based puzzles to solve. There is no save/restore feature available.

sample_screenshots.caption: It's Not an Adventure Game Without a Shovel

title: Island Adventure

description:
Armchair Football is a football game. The player can play short and long passes, draws, sneaks, pitches, sweeps and punts in an attempt to score touchdowns and field goals. The game features a graphic display of the football field. When on defense the player can also choose different strategies, such as rush, blitz, key man-to-man, and pass interception.

Bundled on the tape are also two other games: Golf and Tennis which are basic implementations of the respective sports.
title: Armchair Football

description: TRS-80 Slot Machine is a slot machine simulation. It features a graphical representation of a three-wheel casino slot machine. There are 10 different winning combinations with different payouts.
title: TRS-80 Slot Machine

description:
Destiny is a 1-player space combat game for the TRS-80.

All other starships have been destroyed. All but one of the Klingon invasion bases have been destroyed. The remaining base has no propulsion, however, there are a number of Klingon star fighters in the area. Your mission is to destroy the last Klingon invasion base.

Played from a 1st person perspective, the player can control their plane internal and plane external angle of direction positive and negative, and can also change their thrust to positive or negative to navigate space. The player has a limited number of photon torpedoes which take a period of time to prepare, and can then be fired at nearby enemies. The player can also adjust their shield strength, lay mines, or operate an emergency warp drive. All ship statistics are displayed numerically on the side of the screen. The goal is to destroy the incoming Klingon vessels, and then navigate to and destroy the Klingon base.
title: Destiny

description:
Chompers is a 1 - 2 player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80.

You are the Chomper, and you want to eat up all the little dots for breakfast, but the mean ol' Munchkin won't let you. The player can choose to play in a small or large maze. The goal is to eat all the dots on a level without getting caught by the Munchkin. If the player picks up 1 of the 4 energy stations in each corner of the maze, the Munchkin temporarily becomes vulnerable to attack. The player has 3 lives, and if all are lost, it's game over.
title: Chompers

description:
Teaser! is a 1-player puzzle game for the TRS-80.

Played on a 3 x 3 grid, each box can either be black or white. When a player selects a box, that box and all adjacent boxes flip to a different color. The goal is to turn all blocks but the central block white. If all blocks are turned black, the player loses.
title: Teaser!

description:
Robot Baseball is a 1-player batting game for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to hit 100 pitches from a robot pitcher who rapidly throws out balls. Depending on how the ball is hit, it will land in 1 of 5 points baskets, and the player receives points equivalent to the number displayed within. A catcher moves across the screen, and if they intercept the ball, the player does not receive points. Occasionally a bonus basket appears, which grants extra point if hit.
title: Robot Baseball

description:
Rubic's Magic Cube is a Rubik's Cube simulation for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to solve a Rubik's Cube (or can shuffle a solved one) by turning the different sides of the puzzle. All moves are via text commands. The player can set custom colors for the sections.
title: Rubic's Magic Cube

description:
Subway is a 1-player text-based strategy game for the TRS-80.

You are the coordinator for a criminal transport team. The prisoner whom you were to transport today escaped, and is hiding in the city subway system. If he is not found by 9am, he is given an automatic reprieve under state law.

Your job is to coordinate your ten member team to locate and capture the prisoner before 9am. He is armed and dangerous. The prisoner can only be arrested at one of the stations and not on a busy subway train.

The player controls 10 agents, whom can be directed to different stations. The player receives reports on the prisoner's current location, and must try to intercept them with their agents. When an agent is in the same location as a prisoner, the player can attempt to capture them. Gameplay is in real time.

sample_screenshots.caption: My Agents are on the Movee

title: Subway

description:
Heavy Traffic is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small race car on a windy 2-lane road. The player chooses 7 levels of traffic, and can move left and right while avoiding oncoming traffic. The player can accelerate or decelerate, and receives a score based upon the total distance travelled in 90 time units.
title: Heavy Traffic

description:
Survival is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You have just become the hero. The object is to capture as many progressively more expensive treasures without being captured by one of the progressively more dangerous monsters. There is a safety zone around the edge of the game field which a monster cannot enter, and the goal is to swoop in and grab the treasure before the monster can reach you. Monsters can move on angles, while players cannot, and the player must also avoid the monster cave and pit.

Between each level, the player can opt to finish the game and keep their treasure, or proceed to a more difficult (and rewarding) challenge.
title: Survival

description:
Jungle Adventure, Part I: The Elephant's Graveyard is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

You have entered the Great African Explorer Contest. The first contestant to find the fabled Elephant's Graveyard and bring back some ivory as proof wins the contest, and receives a contract for further explorations.

The player becomes thirsty every 10 turns, and must repeatedly return to a water source. The player must contend with Pygmies, crocodiles, and other jungle dangers to find the ivory. All entries are via VERB NOUN entry, and there are multiple inventory-based puzzles to solve. There is a save/restore feature.
title: Jungle Adventure, Part I: The Elephant's Graveyard

description:
Jungle Adventure, Part II: King Solomon's Mines is a text adventure, and sequel to Jungle Adventure, Part I: The Elephant's Graveyard

After bringing back ivory from The Elephant's Graveyard, you are now ready to start out alone on your next quest. You have now been contracted to seek out the long lost treasures of King Solomon's Mines, and bring them back to the trading post.

The player becomes thirsty every 10 turns, and must repeatedly return to a water source. The player must contend with snakes, Pygmies, and other jungle dangers to find the treasures within the mines. All entries are via VERB NOUN entry, and there are multiple inventory-based puzzles to solve. There is a save/restore feature.
title: Jungle Adventure, Part II: King Solomon's Mines

description: Ball Turret Gunner is a game with a first person view where you need to gun down enemy vessels (that look suspiciously like Tie Fighters). You have a direction indicator that tells you where the enemy vessel is coming from, and you can rotate your turret a full 360 degrees. However, your laser takes a long time to recharge, so you must aim carefully and not waste your shots.
title: Ball Turret Gunner

description:
Space War is a 1-player arcade game for for the TRS-80.

The player controls a spaceship that moves from the right side of the screen. The player can fire directly forwards, and can move up and down. Alien ships rapidly approach from the left of the screen. The player receives points for each enemy vessel destroyed. Gameplay lasts for 60 seconds, or until the player is struck by an enemy vessel.
title: Space War

description:
Caterpillar is a 1-player Centipede clone for the TRS-80.

The player controls a character that can move horizontally and a short distance vertically, and fires to the top of the screen. Long caterpillars approach from the top moving in horizontal strips towards the bottom of the screen, and split into multiple smaller caterpillar components when shot. The player has 1 life, and it's game over when hit. New caterpillars appear on the screen before the old ones are destroyed.
title: Caterpillar

description:
Spelling Egg is a 1 - 10 player word guessing game for the TRS-80.

Each player chooses to see a list of 2 to 20 words to define game difficulty. One of these words will be used in a game similar to hangman. The player must try to guess the word, where each incorrect answer will cause an egg to drop, and each correct letter will fill in a blank on the screen. The player gains 100 points for each correct word minus 10 points for every incorrect letter guessed. Five incorrect guesses, and the turn is lost.
title: Spelling Egg

description:
Bounce is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player moves about the screen trying to avoid a bouncing ball. Every 10 seconds an additional bouncing ball is added to the screen, increasing the challenge. The player can move in the 4 cardinal directions. There are 3 levels of ball speed or difficulty. The game ends when the player is hit.
title: Bounce

description:
Crolon Diversion is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You have been chosen as an emergency replacement for one of starfleet's better pilots. Your mission is to create a diversion by doing lone battle against the deadly Crolon forces. Hopefully you can last long enough to draw many Crolon fighters away from the main point of attack.

The player controls a damaged craft which continuously moves up and down, and the player can only control its horizontal movements. The player can fire at enemy vessels to try to destroy them. The player takes 5% damage if they hit an enemy vessel, and if they reach 100% damage, they are destroyed. Crolon ships appear on the screen one at a time, and if 6 ships appear on the screen, it's game over. If a commander ship appears, the player has 20 seconds to destroy it, or it's game over. The game or fuel lasts for 999 time units, and after this time, the game is over. The player receives a promotion based upon their final score. There are a total of 5 levels of difficulty, based upon which sector the player chooses to defend.

sample_screenshots.caption: Four Regular Crolons and a Commander

title: Crolon Diversion

description:
Wall Street is a 2 - 6 player strategy game for the TRS-80.

J. Q. Smith, multi-billionaire and chairman of eight corporations and four holding companies, announced today that he will gradually retire from all of his corporate positions and and will sell off all of his stock over the next decade.

The stocks will be sold on the open market, and whomever the common stockholders choose to elect shall be the next chairman. The object of the game is to become the most powerful player. Chairmanships bring with them both power and prestige, as well as a tidy salary.

Each corporate chairmanship is worth a point and each holding company is worth 3 points. The first player who obtains 11 points at the end of any calendar year is declared the winner. The stock of any corporation or holding company that is owned by a holding company will be voted for the chairman of the holding company. The stock owned by a player shall be voted for the player. All chairman elections occur once annually at the stockholders' meeting.

Each turn, the player takes the opportunity to buy or sell stocks and shares in a holding company. The player can make income based upon the performance of their shares.
title: Wall Street

description:
Suns is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Played on a 3 x 3 grid, suns appear randomly and begin to bounce vertically on all 9 positions. Each square is a door, and only one door can be opened at a time. The goal is to capture as many suns as possible by opening a door just before the sun reaches it. Suns can also be captured by shooting a missile from one of the 9 doors, but only one missile can be fired at a time. If a missile is fired from a door without a sun, it will bounce until it is recaptured again by opening a door. There are 8 levels of difficulty, which determine the maximum suns that can be on the screen at a time from 1 - 8. There are also 5 speed levels to choose from. The player has 100 seconds to collect as many suns as possible.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Shoot One With a Missile

title: Suns

description:
Wanderer is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The goal is to turn all the live targets "O" by running into them and turning them into a "@". The player moves a character through the field, and if they hit any object, they rapidly bounce back in the opposite direction. There are 5 invisible objects that cannot be seen, and 5 mines that will cause the player to lose the game if hit. If there is a target that can't be reached, the player can fire a cannon that can remove an object. If the border, a mine, or a live target is accidentally shot, it's game over. There are two levels of difficulty.
title: Wanderer

description:
A Backpack Adventure is a 1-player adventure game for the TRS-80.

Here is your chance to get away from it all for awhile. You have the opportunity to visit the Snowy Mountain Wilderness Area, an area rich in natural beauty, abundant in wildlife, and far from any roads, buildings, or people. Your journey climaxes with a hike to the summit of Snowy Mountain. Your objective is to have a safe and enjoyable backpacking trip. Your trip will last several days, so you will need to decide what items you will want to take along.

Along the way, the player can fish, camp, sleep, eat, swim, build a camp fire, and more. The player must prepare for bears and adverse weather conditions. The player follows trails by typing the direction they wish to travel. The player must take precautions including safely putting out fires, wearing the appropriate clothes for weather, and bear-proofing their camp. At the end of the adventure, the player receives a score that rates the enjoyment and safety during the journey.
title: A Backpacking Adventure

description:
Checkers is a 1-player checkers gamer for the TRS-80.

The player competes against a computer opponent in a standard game of checkers. There are 4 levels of computer opponent available. Pieces are graphically displayed on the screen, and all gameplay is via text commands. The player can switch position with the computer at any time.
title: Checkers

description:
Lunar Explorer is a 1-player Lunar Lander clone for the TRS-80.

The goal is to successfully land a lunar probe on the surface of the moon. The player can apply horizontal and vertical thrust on their lander, while gravity continually accelerates the probe towards the planet surface. The goal is to land on a flat area at a speed of less than 15 meters/second with a horizontal speed of 0. The player starts on a zoomed-out screen, but as they approach closer to the surface the terrain and lander appear larger to facilitate landing. The player can determine their starting fuel in increments of 500, and whether to play in light or heavy gravity.
title: Lunar Explorer

description:
Story Builder is a phrasal template word game for the TRS-80.

The player enters 6 adjectives, 3 adverbs, 3 nouns, 2 verbs, 3 body parts, 6 foods, 3 animals, 2 liquids, 2 geographic locations, 2 planets, stars or heavenly bodies, 3 exclamatory words, and 3 places. The player can choose from 4 stories: Escape at the Zoo, The New Car, The Grocery, and Space Shot.
title: Story Maker

description:
Frog Song is a 1-player memory game for the TRS-80.

There are 4 animated frogs, each with a distinct sound when selected. The player tries to memorize a series of 20 notes in a sequence that starts at 1 note and lengthens by 1 with each round.
title: Frog Song

description:
Medieval Adventure is a 2-player text adventure for the TRS-80.

Two players take turns exploring a medieval castle in search of treasures. Each player gets to pick up and manipulate items, and then move to a new location during their turn. Each player has a different starting point in the castle, and the goal is to find the most treasure and bring in back to the starting point. To reach their objectives, the player must contend with witches, hornets, sorcerers, rats, and dragons. There is a total score of 210 that is shared between players.

All entries are via VERB NOUN entry. There are multiple inventory-based puzzles to solve. There is no save/restore feature available.
title: Medieval Adventure

description:
Space Gallery is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The Federation has chosen you to help rid the galaxy of enemy starships. You are to look for their crafts through your scanner. Ships rapidly travel horizontally across the scanner screen, and the player must move their crosshairs vertically to align with enemy spacecraft and shoot them. The player loses shield energy as they receive fire from enemy vessels, and it's game over at an energy score of 0.

There are two levels of difficulty. If the player reaches 5000 points, the Federation will grant them more shield power.
title: Space Gallery

description:
Gomoku is a 1-player board game for the TRS-80.

Played on a 9 x 9 board versus the computer, players take turns placing their piece on the board by selecting a square. The first person to get 5 pieces in a row is the winner.
title: Gomoku

description:
Xor is a 2-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

Gameplay is divided into 4 boards, one for each player, one for the computer, and one open board. Each board is a 2 x 2 square, and each turn a block filling 2 - 3 squares appears for that player. The piece can either be added onto their own board or given to an opponent. If the player fills all 4 squares they receive a point, but if there are overlapping blocks, they are erased, and the player doesn't receive a point. A player cannot give 2 pieces in a row. Turns are timed, and If neither player gives or takes, the computer receives the piece. The computer pieces do not get erased if they overlap, allowing the computer to more easily run up a score. The first player to reach 20 points is the victor. There are 3 skill levels.
title: XOR

description:
Alien is a 1-player Space Invaders game for the TRS-80.

You are alone on a planet that has just been claimed by your Federation. You have been left alone to defend it until colonists arrive. After a couple of days of quiet monitors, something appears on your comp-scan: An entire fleet of alien star destroyers - heading your way. Springing from your chair, you flip a few switches to activate the force field. The force field covers most of the planet, but not directly over the armory, creating a window for invading aliens to slip through.

The player controls a missile which moves horizontally along the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. Alien waves move as a group, and when they reach the edge of the screen, they move down one level and alternate direction. Within the armory are 4 missile launchers, and if one is destroyed, a new one takes its place. One replacement missile launcher is constructed at the end of an alien wave up to 4. Each alien wave arrives one level lower than the preceding fleet, and the player has time to repair their defensive barrier between waves. The game ends when an alien breaks through the armory's barrier line or all 4 missile launchers are destroyed. There are 3 levels of game speed.
title: Alien

description:
Hit and Miss is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Players take turns dropping bombs from a spaceship that moves horizontally across the top of the screen. Below lies a valley filled with numbers, and the player gets points based upon the numbers they hit. If the player misses numbers 3 times, it's game over.
title: Hit and Miss

description:
Empire is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

You have been appointed ruler of a small unimportant piece of European land during the medieval ages. Your country is beset by many problems: no industry, little trade, small army, underpopulation, angry neighbors, plague, and other day-to-day problems a capable leader must learn to face. You'll have a limited number of turns to build your empire into a great size. Five other city-states are also struggling to become emperor, and are directly competing with you. There are a limited number of turns per game based upon the short medieval life expectancy.

Each turn, the player is given a weather report which affects crop yields. The player has a chance to purchase or sell grain, as well as allot grain to the army and peasants. This affects birth/death rates, and army efficiency. Each turn, the player also gets to set customs duty, sales tax, and income tax, and can purchase market places, grain mills, foundries, shipyards, soldiers, or work on constructing their palace. These can be used to gain future resources.

Each turn the player can attack attacking barbarian and opponent forces to gain their land and seize their resources, and the player must maintain a standing army by feeding them and paying resources.

As your country increases in size, you will be rewarded with lofty titles including Knight, Prince, King, and finally Emperor.
title: Empire

description:
Speed is a 1-player versus computer card game for the TRS-80.

The goal is to be the first player to use all cards in their hand. Each player starts with 4 cards, and there are 2 playing piles. The player can play a card that is 1 position higher or lower than that displayed in the playing pile. Each player has a 16 card reserve pile, and the first player to use all cards is the winner. When there are no playable cards available, 2 new cards are placed in the playing piles. There are 7 levels of speed difficulty.
title: Speed

description:
Hidden Number Game is a 1-player math learning game for the TRS-80.

The numbers 0 to 9 are hidden in 10 separate boxes. The player selects two boxes, and the operation addition, subtraction, or multiplication, and are told the last digit of the resulting number. The goal is to determine which digit is in each square. There is an option to peek at the numbers.
title: Hidden Number Game

description:
Subs is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a battleship that moves horizontally, and can drop depth charges from either side of their vessel. These vessels sink slowly, and the player can have up to 5 depth charges on the screen at a time. Enemy subs sail under the water, and fire torpedoes towards the player. If the player is hit, they lose half their points. The player has 90 seconds to destroy as many subs as possible. If they reach 500 points, they gain an additional 20 seconds.
title: Subs

description:
Games/Group 1 is a compilation featuring four games.

  • Hammurabi - An implementation of the kingdom management game Hammurabi.
  • Concentration 1 - A computer version of the TV show of the same name.
  • Russian Roulette - A game of chance to be played against either the computer or another player.
  • UFO - A Spacewar variant.
title: Games/Group 1

description: Kleon is a graphical space battle game where the player faces a number of enemy star ships. The player must shoot them and not get hit.
title: Kleon

description: Checkers is an implementation of the board game of the same name in BASIC. The player can play against the computer.
title: Checkers

description: Hangman, 2-Player or Solitary is as its name describes a computer implementation of the pen and paper game Hangman. It can be played solitary against the computer, or against another player. A visual shows the progress of the hanged man.
title: Hangman, 2-Player or Solitary

description:
LTC-21 Flight Simulator is a text-based airplane simulation for the TRS-80.

The player controls an LTC-21 aircraft, with the goal of taking off from a runway, flying to another city, and successfully landing the plane. The player must manipulate the plane's doors, flaps, and rudder. The player can separately control the thrust of the plane's 3 engines, while carefully watching their fuel. The player controls their brakes, their wheel position, and has to be careful not to crash their plane.
title: LTC-21 Flight Simulator

description:
Star Fighter is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to destroy enemy star fighters over several rounds. The player tries to align a crosshair with the spaceship. After the spaceship is destroyed, or if it escapes off the screen, the player enters a radar mode, where they once again must align their star ship with a smaller crosshair. There are 9 levels of game difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to Shoot an Enemy Vessel

title: Star Fighter

description:
Monster Chase is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to avoid a monster while conserving their oxygen. The player can move in the 4 cardinal directions, and so can the monster. The player must reach an oxygen control unit within a maze, and bring it to the oxygen device. While doing this, they must avoid a monster which continuously chases them. The player can drill through walls to reach their goal. After the oxygen is turned on, the monster will pursue for some time before succumbing. The player has 500 time units, but time is only displayed during the last 100 units. There are 9 levels of difficulty, with harder levels being more open, making it easier for the monster to eat you.
title: Monster Chase

description:
Fox and Hounds is a 1-player adaption of the board game.

The computer tries to move a single fox to the opposite side of an 8 x 8 checker board, while the player tries to block and capture the fox with 4 hounds. Each piece can only move on black squares. The fox can move backwards and forwards, while the hounds can only move forwards.
title: Fox and Hounds

description:
Escape from the Robots is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player must outwit and outlast a number of robots that chase them on a field full of electric disintegrators. If the player or robot runs into a disintegrator, they are destroyed. If two robots run into each other, they are destroyed forming a junk heap. The player is armed with a transporter, that will move them randomly about the screen, but there is a risk it may malfunction, killing the player. The player moves in the cardinal directions, while the robots can also move on angles. There are two levels of difficulty, and victory is achieved by surviving all the robots. The player defines the number of robots and disintegrators.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lots of Electric Fields and Robots

title: Escape from the Robots

description:
Maze Escape is a 1-player maze game for the TRS-80.

The computer generates a large randomized maze, and the player tries to move a character through the maze to escape. Mazes are timed.
title: Maze Escape

description:
Tiar is a logic game for the TRS-80.

The player is presented with a game in a 3 x 3 grid, with 3 icons located within each box. The player can perform 5 separate operations, which in some way modify the boxes and the player's score. The goal is to figure out the rules of the game, as well as achieve a score of 400 points by understanding and then applying the game's rules.
title: Tiar

description:
Lgame is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player and the computer take turns placing L-shaped blocks within a 4 x 4 game field. There are 8 L-shapes to chose from. Each turn, the player can also move a dot square into a position to try to block their opponent. The goal is to prevent the opponent from playing a piece.
title: Lgame

description:
Shopping Spree is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

You are in the Super Supermarket on a short stop for food. When you get inside, they tell you that all the stockboys are out sick and nothing is where it should be. You have a shopping list, and a maximum price you can pay for all of it. The player will push their cart along the 7 aisles, and can take a a look at what's on the shelves. The player sees an item and the cost, and can choose to take it. The goal is to get items at the lowest possible price, and to complete the shopping list within budget. Prices range between $0.50 to $3.00. The player has 3.6 minutes to complete their shopping spree.
title: Shopping Spree

description:
Stock Exchange is a stock market simulation game for the TRS-80.

The player starts with $2000, and tries to maximize funds after 10 tears/turns. Each stock has their own volatility rating, purchase price, and dividend rate. Each year, the market has different conditions, and stocks have differing volatility.
title: Stock Exchange

description:
The Education of TickTackToe is a 1-player tic-tac-toe board game for the TRS-80.

The player always goes first, and is always X. The computer will learn from the player's strategy, and will become more difficult to beat with each subsequent round.
title: The Education of TickTackToe

description:
Marvelo the Mentalist is a 1-player game for the TRS-80.

The player chooses from 1 of 16 separate images. The computer then guesses which number the player chose in 4 turns by asking the player if their chosen image is or is not present on the screen.
title: Marvelo the Mentalist

description:
Dungeons & Dragons is a 1-player roleplaying game for the TRS-80.

Old legends speak of a large blue-white diamond hidden deep in the catacombs of Khazad 'Dum. Dozens of men have attempted to find this jewel, but none have ever returned. Your success will be based on your skill as a fighter and your ability to escape from its many traps.

The player takes on the role of a fighter, and their skill is based upon their dexterity and strength. Dexterity expresses ability to hit, while strength is a measure of hit points. Armor class is determined by equipment worn. The player chooses from 7 different levels of weapons and 8 levels of armor. At the beginning of a game, the player chooses the character's name, god, and randomly roles the 3 stats and gold. A weapon can be purchased before entering the dungeon. The player starts with torches to keep the dungeon lit, and eleven cakes which can restore hit points.

During combat, the player's dexterity determines if they can attack, and the player must choose which weapon to use. Weapons can break, leaving the player with only their fists which can also break, leaving a player unable to further fight. There are different available attacks, and the player can pray to their god if things looks drastic.

The dungeon is explored via text commands, and the player can move north, south, east, or west. Each room is described via text, and they may contain random encounters which the player can try to avoid. Fixed monsters including a demon, a troll, a stone giant, a vampire, and a gargoyle provide special treasure. Also in the dungeon is a dragon, which holds the prized jewel, which can only be defeated with a magic lamp. If the player runs out of torches, they perish in the darkness.
title: Dungeons & Dragons

description:
Syzygy is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a character with an elongating tail, who tries to trap the other player by forcing them to run into a tail or another obstacle. Each player gets 5 cannon shots to clear a path to try to get themselves out of trouble. The player defines the number of obstacles present on the screen, and the program tracks how many games each player has won.
title: Syzygy

description: Zone Hockey is a hockey game for two players. One player takes an offensive role and the other a defensive role. Only half a skating rink is displayed and it's divided into seven zones. The offensive player must try to arrive in the same zone as the offensive player to prevent them from scoring.
title: Zone Hockey

description: TRS-80 Lunar Lander is a Lunar Lander variant. The player is tasked with landing an exploration module on the moon using manual control. A match starts at a random distance to the surface, remaining fuel and velocity. The player must use the retro rockets to slow down the descent so that the lander doesn't crash into the surface with too much velocity. The player can aim for a successful or even perfect landing (2 feet per second or slower).
title: TRS-80 Lunar Lander

description: Hangman (Level II) is a word guessing game written in Level II BASIC. The game is played with two players. The goal is to guess a word in limited turns by guessing individual letters.
title: Hangman (Level II)

description:
Hi-Que is a 1-player peg solitaire game for the TRS-80.

The player jumps pegs on a board, with the goal being to have the final peg sitting in the center of the board. The game is over when there are no moves remaining.
title: Hi-Que

description:
Yahtz-80 is a 2-player text-based implementation of the popular dice game for the TRS-80.

Players take turns rolling five dice, and the player can reroll any or all of the dice twice more before selecting their scoring category. Scoring categories include 6 categories within the Upper Section, which include the sum of all ones to sixes. In the Lower Section, the categories include 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, full house, a 4 dice straight, a 5 dice straight, yahtzee (5 of a kind) and chance (which is the sum of all dice). A game is finished when all 11 scoring categories have been used.
title: Yahtz-80

description:
Nerves is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to move a character through a maze from right to left through a series of horizontally connected vertical hallways. Depending on difficulty, the game creates a specific number of holes through the passageways and blocks to interfere with the player's path. The player gains points for going through a hole or completing a level. The player loses points for changing direction, not moving, or getting blocked. There are 10 levels of difficulty.
title: Nerves

description: Rock Star is a text-based simulation for the TRS-80 based on the classic game Rock Star Ate My Hamster. The player is tasked with managing a rock band and either playing against the computer (with 4 difficulty levels) or against another player. In each turn, the player can rehearse, release a single, attempt a publicity stunt, or go on tour. You win by getting your album to the top of the charts.
title: Rock Star

description: Cash Register is an educational game teaching mathematics using a cash register. The player is presented with simple situations where a customer wants to pay for an item with a certain amount of cash and the player must input the change that has to be returned to the customer.
title: Cash Register

description: Space Trek I is a Star Trek variant. The player commands the starship Enterprise and must defend the galaxy against a Klingon expeditionary force. The player can move around sectors and jump between quadrants in search of the enemy vessels. There galaxy is divided into 4x4 quadrants, each sub-divided into 16 sectors. The on-board computer warns the player of approaching vessels and low shields.
title: Space Trek I

description: The Computerized Bowling Alley! is a computer simulation of a bowling game written in level I BASIC. The player can throw the ball at the pins and the game keeps score.
title: The Computerized Bowling Alley!

description:
Life is an implementation of Conway's Game of Life on a computer. The player can draw patterns and watch how they evolve based on the simple rules of Conway's Game of Life.

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
title: Life

description:
Mountain Pilot is a 1-player flight simulation for the TRS-80.

This is a flight simulation, where the player must travel through a mountain pass from Mountain Home to Goldtown, pick up a load of gold bullion, and return to Mountain Home. Played from a top down perspective, the player controls the plane's heading, throttle speed, and vertical descent/ascent. The player must carefully navigate through tall mountains, including an elevated 12,000 foot pass, while navigating changing wind conditions. The player has limited fuel to make their trip. During landings, the player flies from a top down perspective, and must align their plane with the runway, and reach the runway at appropriate speed and angle of descent.
title: Mountain Pilot

description:
O'Haret is a 1-player air traffic controller simulation for the TRS-80.

The player takes on the role of an air traffic controller at O'Hare airport. They must successfully land incoming planes by aligning them with the runway at the correct speed of 120 - 180 knots. Airplanes appear on the screen with a letter beside them. The player issues instructions by typing in an individual airplane, and giving directions of speed and heading. The player must avoid having planes crash into each other. There are 6 levels of difficulty.
title: O'Hare

description:
Precision Approach Radar is a 1-player simulation for the TRS-80.

The weather has suddenly become very bad. You are an air traffic controller, and are faced with a 100 foot ceiling and 1/4 mile visibility in thick fog. You must issue commands to the pilot to allow him to land the aircraft safely.

The player issues commands for the vessel's ascent/descent and heading. The plane is displayed in 2 displays, the top of which shows local mountains and displays the plane's vertical location, and the bottom display which shows the plane's presence over the Earth. There are 5 levels of difficulty, which demonstrate different planes and wind conditions. The game is lost if the player crashes into the ground or flies outside of radar range.
title: Precision Approach Radar

description:
The Flying Circus is a compilation of previously released flight games by Instant Software

  • Air Flight Simulation
  • Airmail Pilot
  • Jet Fighter Pilot
  • O'Hare
  • Precision Approach Radar
  • Mountain Pilot
  • Night Flight
title: The Flying Circus

description:
Kalah is a 1 - 2 player board game for the TRS-80.

The game board is divided into two columns, with 7 rows for each player. Each player starts with 3 beads in each of their first 6 rows. Players take turns selecting a row to play, and one bead is placed in each proceeding row until there are no beads remaining. If the final bead is placed in row 7, the player goes again. If the final bead is placed in an empty row, the player takes the beads from the corresponding player's row. Any bead placed in the 7th row is safe, and can't be moved. The game goes until one player has no beads remaining to play, at which time the player who still has beads in play collects those points.

There is a computer opponent available.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Place More Pieces in the Final Row

title: Kalah

description:
Stars is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a spaceship which they attempt to navigate from the bottom to the top of the screen. Each ship can move forwards or backwards. Stars cross horizontally across the screen, and the player tries to navigate between the moving stars. If the player hits a star, they are placed back at the bottom of the screen. The player scores a point every time they cross the screen, and the player with the most points after 90 seconds is the winner. The player can define the frequency, speed, and size of stars.
title: Stars

description:
Midway is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

An airplane and a battleship traverse in opposite directions horizontally on the screen, with the ship on the bottom. Each player has an option to speed up or slow down, and can fire at their enemy. The game records the number of hits each player has received.
title: Midway

description:
Baseball is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

There is a pitching and batting player. The pitcher can throw a fast ball, a slow ball, or a pitch that starts fast and ends slow, or vice versa. The batter must select the swing button as the pitch goes over the plate. If the batter times it correctly, they may score a hit, if not they get a strike. There are a total of 9 innings of game play.
title: Baseball

description:
Battering Ram is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Two players must simultaneously hit a series of buttons to make their characters speed up while holding a battering ram. If the players achieve enough speed after 750 time units, they can successfully bash down the gate to a castle.
title: Battering Ram

description:
Extra Terrestrial is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small spaceship in the bottom center of the screen that shoots upwards. An alien vessel crosses the screen, and the player must time their shots to hit the vessel. There are 3 rows, and depending what row the alien is on, the player receives 10, 20, or 30 points for a hit. They player gets a total of 25 shots, with the goal to maximize score.
title: Extra Terrestrial

description:
Hockey is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls two paddles simultaneously, one which acts as a goalie, and the other an offensive team. Each player tries to bounce a ball into the opposing team's goal. The first player to score 3 points is the victor.
title: Hockey

description:
Interceptor is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player moves a small character horizontally on the bottom of the screen, and tries to intercept dropping items. The player starts with 3 lives, and loses a life if they miss an item. Every 200 points, the player moves to a more challenging level and gains an additional life. The player gains current level x 10 points for every item captured.
title: Interceptor

description:
Life Guard is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a lifeguard who has to rescue people out in the ocean by swimming to them.
title: Life Guard

description:
Master-Guess is a 1-player number guessing game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to guess a 3 - 5 digit number. The number does not begin with 0, nor does it contain duplicates. The player is told how many numbers are correct, and how many are in the correct position. Game play continues until the player guesses the number.
title: Master-Guess

description:
Micro Men is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small crosshair, and tries to shoot 5 small randomly moving micro men. The player has a total of 50 shots to try to shoot the 5 characters.
title: Micro Men

description:
Panda is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a cross-hair, and tries to shoot a panda that moves slowly horizontally on the screen. The player has 25 shots, with the goal to hit the panda as many times as possible.
title: Panda

description:
Sequencer is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to sort a sequence of random numbers from 5 to 500 by flipping portions of the numbers. The player tries to complete their task in as few turns as possible.
title: Sequencer

description:
Siege is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a vehicle which leaves an elongating tail behind it as it moves. A player loses a tank if they hit the wall or another player's tail. The first player to lose 3 tanks loses the game.
title: Siege

description:
Sniper is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a cross-hair, and tries to shoot a person that moves randomly on the screen. The player has 25 shots, with the goal to hit the man as many times as possible.
title: Sniper

description:
Soccer is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls three paddles simultaneously, one which acts as a goalie, and 2 others as an offensive team. Each player tries to bounce a ball into the opposing team's goal. The first player to score 3 points is the victor.
title: Soccer

description:
Sonar is a 2-player version of the board game Battleship.

Each player sets up their board with 5 ships of differing length, hiding this information from their opponent. Each player then takes turns shooting at their opponents' field trying to find and then destroy the enemy vessels. The first player to sink all 5 opponent vessels is the winner.
title: Sonar

description:
Tennis is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a paddle, while a ball bounces between the two. A dotted line marks the net. A player scores a point by knocking the ball past their opponent. The first player to score 3 points is the victor.
title: Tennis

description:
Volley Ball is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a paddle that moves vertically, and tries to knock a bouncing ball past their opponent. The first player to score 3 points is the winner.
title: Volley Ball

description:
Water Rescue is a 1 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a helicopter, and must rescue swimmers in distress. The helicopter travels in the cardinal directions, and will crash if it goes into the water. The player has a total of 5 helicopters, and if all are lost, it's game over.
title: Water Rescue

description:
Zeppelin is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a zeppelin that moves in the 4 cardinal directions. The player must pick up stranded people on the right of the screen and drop them off on the left hand side of the screen. The player must avoid bullets that fly horizontally across the top of the screen. The player has 5 zeppelins, and if all are lost, it's game over. The player gains 10 points per person rescued.
title: Zeppelin

description:
Blockade is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a character that moves in the 4 cardinal directions. The goal is to hit a target and gain points. The player loses 5 points if they hit a wall, another character, or themselves. The first person to gain 100 points or take a lead by 100 points is the victor.
title: Blockade

description:
Psycho-Logic is a 1-player logic game for the TRS-80.

The computer displays a random 27 elements divided into 9 groups displayed as three 3 x 3 squares. Three groups are secretly given the variable names A, B, and C. The computer then chooses a simple math formula and generates the answers to the formula. The goal is to deduce which formula is being used and which groups the computer chose as the variables for A, B, and C. After each guess, a new random 27 elements are displayed, leading to a different answer to the same formula. After answering 6 questions correctly, the computer tells you how many guesses you required to guess the problem, and proceeds to a more difficult challenge.

There are 19 levels of increasing difficulty.
title: Psycho-Logic

description:
Germ Warfare is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

A population of germs fill a matrix, where the population of each location doubles every turn, but if it becomes too crowded, it dies. Thus, the germ population is constantly changing every generation. At the beginning of the game, the player deploys 28 antibodies to combat the germ population, and can apply 5 more each turn until the game ends on turn 10. The goal is to minimize the germ population at the end of 10 rounds.
title: Germ Warfare

description:
Starbase Zero is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

Boltar, this is your last chance to prove why we should prolong your pitiful existence. We will provide you with starbase zero, the newest class of Cylon base ship. You may choose 451 Cyclons to operate it. The humans have been attacking our fuel dumps in the Orpheus sector. All you must do, Boltar, is eliminate those humans and return with your base ship.

The player controls a small ship in the center of the screen represented by an X. The ship can fire in 360 degrees, and is armed with 4 shields that each protects a 90 degree angle. Enemy Viper fighters are represented by a V. The base ship is armed with lasers and 5 tachyon torpedoes, which can be launched at enemy vessels. The player is also armed with a tractor beam which can hold enemy vessels at a short distance. Commands are entered via text command using abbreviations.

Laser banks contain 500 units of energy and must be re-energized lest they become depleted and damage your base. They can also recharge specific shield banks, as well as change the orientation of their base. The player can also hyperspace jump to gain distance from enemy vessels. The goal is to destroy all incoming alien vessels before being destroyed.
title: Starbase Zero

description:
Grand Prix is a 1-player racing game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small racecar at the top of the screen that can move horizontally to the sides. The player gains points the longer they stay on the road, and it's game over if they hit a car or a wall. The player chooses from 6 levels of road width, and whether there is traffic.
title: Grand Prix

description:
Hobbit is a 1-player text-based strategy game for the TRS-80.

You are a hobbit thief trying to steal the Orb of Zot from the castle of the evil wizard. The player must infiltrate a 9 x 9 grid castle, that is filled with gems, demons, flares, amulets, and an oracle. Also positioned throughout the castle are warp points that move the player about. The goal is to find the orb, which is disguised as a warp, which the player must directly teleport on top of to acquire. To teleport, the player must use the runestaff, which is disguised as a demon.

The player moves throughout the castle by moving north, south, east, and west. The player has a map available of their locations, and can find lamps and flares to determine what is in nearby locations. When encountering demons, the player can either bribe them with gems, or can be made immune by the power of acquired amulets. Demons can also be killed with amulets. The player has limited time to find the Orb of Zot before the wizard arrives, and ends the game.
title: Hobbit

description: Magic Isle is an economic simulation game set on a fantasy island. The player must distribute manpower, plant crops and make decisions regarding pacts with neighbors and hiring heroes to help protect the realm from evil curses, plagues, monsters, storms, droughts and attacks from enemy pirates, barbarians and soldiers.
title: Magic Isle

description: Capitalists is a two-player business management game. Both players are in control of a competing company out to make a profit.
title: Capitalists

description: Space Voyage is a variant of Star Trek. The player takes control of a space ship and must hunt down enemies in the galaxies which is divided into sectors and quadrants. Sensors are used to find the enemies. Once engaged the player must destroy the enemy with their weapons and make sure they themselves are not destroyed.
title: Space Voyage

description:
Bounce is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to position a bouncing ball into 6 pockets within 60 time units. The ball can only be moved on 90 degree angles, and whenever the ball is redirected, it leaves behind a slash, which will redirect the ball if hit. When a pocket is filled, it disappears. The goal is to score 6 points in as little time as possible.
title: Bounce

description:
Fullback is a 2-player arcade football game for the TRS-80.

Gameplay is divided into offensive and defensive teams. The defensive player has 15 different defensive positions they can arrange, and the offensive player tries to weave their way between the approaching defensive line to try to score a touchdown. The player must gain 10 yards in total to score a touchdown. Each player gets a total of 4 downs. The defensive team can choose to punt.
title: Fullback

description:
Hunt and Peck is a 2-player tile-matching game for the TRS-80.

Played on a 5 x 6 board with 30 squares, players try to match 15 different randomly placed words. When finding a match, that player gets another turn.
title: Hunt and Peck

description:
Labyrinth is a 1-player maze game for the TRS-80.

The player must try to navigate a maze from the beginning to end. The player controls navigation by turning their character at 90 degree angles or reversing direction. The player will move continuously forwards until they hit a wall or turn. The player only sees their current hallway from a top-down perspective, but can also pull up a still map of their current location. The player can generate a random map or use a pre-generated map.

sample_screenshots.caption: At the Beginning of the Maze

title: Labyrinth

description:
Hustle is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character which can be moved in the 4 cardinal directions, while trying to pick up targets that appear on the screen. Whenever the player gathers a target, their character's tail increases in length. If the player hits a wall or their tail, it's game over. Players randomly receive 1 - 9 points for each target gathered.

sample_screenshots.caption: Longer Tail and a New Target

title: Hustle

description:
Scrambled Eggs is a 2-player word game for the TRS-80.

Each player has 60 seconds to correctly unscramble a five letter word. The player receives points based upon the remaining time. The highest score after 10 rounds is the winner.
title: Scrambled Eggs

description:
UFO is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a spaceship located in the bottom center of the screen, which must shoot alien vessels that come one at a time across the top of the screen from the left. This is complicated by wind, which curves the player's shot to the left or right. The player gets a total of 10 shots, and when an alien vessel is destroyed, the wind changes. The game is over when all 10 shots have been used.
title: UFO

description:
Alien Taxi is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls an alien taxi, which must travel through a side-scrolling underground cavern to pick up alien fares and bring them to a resort hotel. The space ship is controlled by applying vertical and horizontal thrust. Gravity will constantly pull the vessel downwards. The player receives points from picking up fares and additional points when dropping them off. The player has limited fuel, and refuels every time they revisit the resort hotel. The player must land at each of the 12 taxi stands, and must have a vertical speed of less than 3 to safely land. If the player strikes a wall, they lose a life. Four lives, and it's game over.
title: Alien Taxi

description:
Hypergate Centurion is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player is buried deep within an asteroid, and is charged with defending 15 quadrants of space arranged in a 5 x 3 grid. The player can investigate individual quadrants, as well as tactical and interrogation mode. The player has a fleet of five seekers which can be dispatched with 5 separate orders. As objects enter the player's jurisdiction, they can send their seekers to intercept the intruders. The goal is to defend the planets of the quadrant from the various menaces that approach.
title: Hypergate Centurion

description:
Bosk One is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small space fighter tasked with destroying 9 enemy bases. The player's ship can move in 8 directions, and fires simultaneously backwards and forwards. Waves of enemy ships approach from off screen to attack the player, and incoming vessels and bases can be spotted on the ship's radar. An asteroid field at the top of the playfield allows the player to hide from enemy combatants. Enemy bases can only be destroyed by a direct hit from the top or bottom, and they fire a seeking missile that chases the player if they venture too close. If all 9 bases are destroyed, the player advances to a harder challenge. The player has limited laser energy, and can overheat if they fire too vigorously. The player has 5 ships, and it's game over if all are lost.
title: Bosk One

description:
Worm is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a character with a continuously elongating tail, who must try to survive as long as possible within a maze. The player can bounce off of their tail and other objects, but it's game over if the player finds themselves trapped. Score is based upon survival time.
title: Worm

description:
Jungle is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You have crash landed in the jungle of Central Park, New York City. As you emerge from the plane, you are met by spear wielding New Yorkers intent to hold you captive as domestic help. The locals make periodic sweeps from the top of the screen towards the bottom, but if the player hides in the trees, they can avoid detection. The player must avoid other pitfalls, including: rope traps which hold the player in place for 5 seconds, a snake that chases the player backwards 2 steps, and a noise from the bushes which chases the player laterally 5 steps. There are also tunnels which can move the player about the screen.
title: Jungle

description:
Powers of Concentration is 1-player memory game for the TRS-80.

The player is given a sequence of numbers up to 20, that are displayed on the screen one at a time. Each round, the player must remember one additional number. There are 10 levels of difficulty.
title: Powers of Concentration

description:
Corporation is a 1-player business simulation for the TRS-80.

The player is in control of a small corporation, which manufactures a single unspecified item. The goal is to try to raise the corporation's value above $100/share. Each turn, the player sets the value of their sales item, as well as the marketing budget. The player can also issue stock to increase working capital to invest in their business. The player can also set their own corporate salary, how many items to manufacture, and to invest in the efficiency of their factory.
title: Corporation

description:
Nim is a 1-player puzzle game for the TRS-80.

Three piles containing 5 - 10 objects are randomly generated. The player and the computer take turns taking any number of objects from any pile. The player who takes the last item is the winner. There are 2 levels of computer difficulty. The player or computer can start.
title: Nim

description:
Speedway is an arcade racing game for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to race around a curved track, and can turn left or right. The vehicle has 2 speeds, and the game records overall lap times. If the player hits the curb, they slow down, and take a small time penalty.
title: Speedway

description: Breakaway is a graphical game that places the player in a fight against three TIE Fighters. The goal is to come out victorious.
title: Breakaway

description:
Four Color Map Problem is a 1-player puzzle for the TRS-80.

In mathematics, the four color map theorem, states that, given any separation of a plane into contiguous regions, producing a figure called a map, no more than four colors are required to color the regions of the map so that no two adjacent regions have the same color.

In this puzzle, the player attempts to fill in a map containing different sized and spaced squares with 4 separate colors, so that no two contiguous squares are the same color. There are three difficulties of maps available.
title: Four Color Map Problem

description:
Cat and Mouse is a 2-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

One player controls the cat, while the other controls the mouse. The cat tries to catch the mouse, while the mouse tries to move to the safety of its hole in the center of the screen. Due to the messy garage, the player can only move in certain directions, with other locations blocked. Due to local earthquakes, the location of obstacles is frequently changing.
title: Cat and Mouse

description:
Melvin J. Goombah's W.W. 1/2 is a 1-player game for the TRS-80.

The player has artillery set in the northwest corner of the map, and can fire between 90 degrees between the south and east. The player sets the elevation of their artillery barrel as well as the directions. After each shot, the player is told their current distance from the target in the vertical and horizontal direction. The player must determine the location of the enemy, and if they land with 100 yards, it is destroyed.
title: Melvin J. Goombah's W.W. 1/2

description: Baseball is a graphical baseball game. The game offers four pitches and four different batter options.
title: Baseball

description: Football is a graphical American football game. The player can choose between 9 offensive plays and 4 different defensive plays.
title: Football

description: TRS-80 Space War is a Star Trek variant, albeit in a simplified form. The player takes the role of the captain of a Federation ship and must hunt down three Klingon invaders. The Klingons are hidden in the 48 quadrants. The player can fire into quadrants in an attempt to destroy the Klingons. If the shot misses a trajectory analysis is given, providing information about where the ships could be. After each shots the Klingons will fire. There's a 25% chance they will hit the player and move to another quadrant. The player has shields and can deflect torpedoes.
title: TRS-80 Space War

description: Mastermind I is a computer implementation of the board game Mastermind. The game is written for Level I BASIC. It only allows play for one player against the computer. The computer has a code that the player must crack, after each guess at the code the computer tells the player the amount of correct digits and digits that occur in the code but are wrongly placed. The player must guess the code in 10 turns or less.
title: Mastermind I

description:
