Golf / Cross-Out is a compilation of two games, both provided in Level I and Level II BASIC. The golf game offers seven different clubs to choose from and 18 holes with different designs. The player must use the right club and angle to get the ball to the hole.

In Cross-Out the player must remove pegs from a board by having them jump over each other. The goal is to end up with a single peg in the middle hole on the board. The player's skill is rated at the end of each try.
title: Golf / Cross-Out

description:
RSL-1 is a package containing a graphic pattern drawing routine and an implementation of The Game of Life. In the game of life patterns evolve using the following rules:

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.

The programs use machine language rather than BASIC, making their drawing routines much faster than most other versions available at the time.
title: RSL-1

description: Bridge Game allows a single player to play the card game bridge with the computer.
title: Bridge Game

description:
This implementation of Conway's Game of Life has patterns evolve using the normal rules:

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
title: Game of Life

description: Slot Machine is a simulation of a slot machine. The player can insert virtual money in the hope to get a good payout.
title: Slot Machine

description:
Chase is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

You have been trapped in a madman's castle, tasked with testing the performance of his deadly robots. The player specifies the number of robots and electric fields that appear in the game area. The robots move inexorably towards the player, and can only be destroyed if two robots collide, or a robot collides with an electrical field. The game is turn based, and the player types in which of the 8 directions they wish to move each turn.
title: Chase

description:
Star Wars is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You play as Luke Skywalker as he tries to destroy the Death Star by delving into the trench to launch a torpedo into the plasma exhaust. The game is played from a perspective of behind the player's X-wing. The player has 65 seconds to avoid enemy tie fighters, launch a missile towards the exhaust, and escape the top of the trench. The player must avoid laser blasts within the trench.
title: Star Wars

description: Spelling Bee is a spelling game. The game will show you a word from a list and the player will have to answer right or wrong depending on whether it's spelled correctly. The player is scored based on the number of correct answers.
title: Spelling Bee

description: Tic-Tac-Toe allows the player to play the classic pen and paper game against the computer. The player and computer take turns putting their marks in a 3x3 grid. The first to get three in a row wins the game. The player can decide to go first or not.
title: Tic-Tac-Toe

description: Fighter Pilot gives the player the task of destroying a fleet of enemy space ships with a limited amount of rockets. The player must fire whenever an enemy ship aligns with the targeting reticle. The further the player progresses the more evasive maneuvers the space ships will take.
title: Fighter Pilot

description: TRS-80 Pinball is an action game in which a bouncing ball must be made to hit a target. The player controls a paddle at the bottom of the screen. The paddle can be moved left and right. The ball may not hit the bottom of the screen or it is lost. The player has 10 balls to hit the target as often as possible with.
title: TRS-80 Pinball

description: Zarbor is a variant on Lunar Lander and artillery games. The player controls a rocket that starts on the left side of the screen and must fly over a mountain to the right side of the screen. The rocket may not touch the edges of the screen, nor the ground. Each turn the player must input instructions in the form of thrust and five seconds of remaining oxygen is deducted. Aside from crashing the player can also die when running out of oxygen or landing too hard. When out of fuel no more instructions can be given.
title: Zarbor

description:
Othello is a 1 - 2 player implementation of the board game for the TRS-80.

The player and a computer opponent compete on an 8 x 8 board in a game of Othello. Playing pieces are graphically displayed on the screen, and the player and computer take turns playing filled or empty squares. Only legal moves are accepted, and there is only 1 level of computer difficulty. Pieces are played by typing the number of the square from 1 - 64.
title: Othello

description:
Game of Life is an implementation of Conway's Game of Life using a 45x45 grid. The player can draw patterns and watch how they evolve based on the simple rules of Conway's Game of Life.

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
title: Conway's Game of Life

description:
Roundup! is a fast action game for the TRS-80. It is essentially a clone of the classic Atari 2600 game Stampede by Activision.

You are riding a horse and can only move up or down as your horse runs to the right at a constant speed. Your job is to lasso cows for 10 points each, and steers for 50 points each. The steers sit there and wait for you to reach them while the cows run away from you at varying speeds. If you miss 3 animals, the game is over, although each 1000 points gets you an extra miss. If you hit a cow, it will run away, giving you more time to catch it, but hitting a steer or a cow skull causes your horse to rear up, which stuns you for several seconds.
title: Roundup!

description: Another implementation of 23 Matches. A strategic puzzle game for two with a clear winning strategy.There's a pile of 23 matches and each turn the player and computer may take one, two or three matches from the pile. The player to take the last match loses.
title: 23 Matches

description: Oriental Rings is an implementation of the Towers of Hanoi puzzle. Rings of different sizes must be moved from one post to another, but a larger ring can never be placed on top of a smaller ring. There are three posts to move the eight rings between.
title: Oriental Rings

description: Battleship! is an implementation of the board game of the same name. The player plays against the computer. Both place their ships on a grid and take turns attacking a grid position. If a ship occupies a position the player is informed the attack was a hit. Ships occupy multiple grid coordinates and have different sizes. To fully sink a ship all grid locations that ship occupies must be hit. The first player to sink all the other player's ships wins the game.
title: Battleship!

description: Keno is an implementation of Las Vegas style Keno. The game allows play with up to fifteen players and keeps track of winnings and which numbers have been played.
title: Keno

description: Turkey Buzzard is a hunting game. The player is accompanied by a hunting dog which chases the prey. Birds will fly away from their roosts and need to be shot. The player must avoid various dangers and comic pitfalls. The game prides itself at the amount of visuals and animations compared to other computer games of its time.
title: Turkey Buzzard

description: Interactive 23 Bytes is an online multiplayer game designed for the TRS-80. The game was included as a sample game in an article on how to build the "Mickey Modem" in a Kilobaud magazine article. The modem allowed for creating a direct connection between two TRS-80 tape drives by hooking them up to the telephone line. The game itself is an adaptation of 23 Matches. Two players take turns removing 1, 2 or 3 matches from a pile. Whoever is forced to take the last match loses the game.
title: Interactive 23 Bytes

description: Backgammon is a computer version of the classic board game, available in Level I and Level II BASIC. The game is played against the computer. Players take turn to roll the dice and use their two values to move chips around the board in attempt to bear off all chips from the board before the opponent does so.
title: Backgammon

description:
This compilation contains two games:

  • Aardvark - In this game the player is an aardvark and must try to find a hidden ant using coordinates.
  • Capture - In this futuristic game the player must capture an enemy spacecraft.
title: Aardvark / Capture

description: Star Trek is a variant of Star Trek. The player helms the Starship Enterprise and must hunt for Klingons in various sectors and quadrants with the help of scanners, phasers and photon torpedoes. What makes this version different from other contemporary releases is the verbal communication between crew members.
title: Star Trek

description:
This compilation contains two graphical casino games:

  • Roulette is a computer version of the gambling game in which the player must bet on a number or color on the spinning wheel and hope the ball will end up on it to get a multiple of the bet.
  • One Arm Bandit is a computer version of a one armed bandit slot machine. The player pulls the handle and the reels will determine the payout.
title: Roulette / One Arm Bandit

description: This compilation contains graphic demonstrations to show off the computer's capabilities. There's one non-game and a Pinball game.
title: Patterns / Pinball

description:
This compilation contains two games:

  • Spaceship is a Lunar Lander variant where the player must land on Venus.
  • Cannon is a shooting game in which the player must fire at aggressive enemies that approach.
title: Spaceship / Cannon

description:
This compilation contains two games:

  • Craps is a computer version of the dice game craps. The player throws dice with goal to roll the same value again. When throwing 7 or 11 the player loses their initial wager, throwing anything else prompts another throw.
  • Hyperbagels is a number guessing game, with rules similar to Mastermind.
title: Dice / Hyperbagels

description: Poker is a computer implementation of draw poker using standard casino rules. Players get five cards and place a bet, after the first betting round players can replace cards in an attempt to improve their hand. Whoever has the best five card poker hand when all bets are in wins the pot.
title: Poker

description: Rally is a car racing game. The player can pick from four different cars to race with and five different tracks.
title: Rally

description:
This compilation contains two strategy games:

  • Nim pits the player against the computer. Both need to pick objects from one row of objects. Whoever takes the last object wins the game.
  • Hexapawn is played on a chess boards, but with only pawns. The goal is to have a pawn reach the other side of the board.
title: Nim / Hexapawn

description: Tic-Tac-Toe is a computer implementation of the classic pen and paper game. The player plays against the computer. They take turns putting their mark in a 3x3 grid. Whoever manages to get three in a row wins.
title: Tic-Tac-Toe

description: Checkers is a computer implementation of the classic board game. Players take turn moving their pieces diagonally over the board. Opposing pieces can be captured by jumping over them.
title: Checkers

description: Horses is a horse race betting game. The player can bet on six different horses and see how well they do in the hope to make a profit.
title: Horses

description: Race is a car racing game. The player must drive their car against "incredible odds".
title: Race

description: Blackjack Simulator doesn't just play a game of blackjack on the computer, it also serves as a tool for players to develop their strategy for playing the game in a casino. The game keeps statistics about hands played and allows analysis of data.
title: Blackjack Simulator

description:
Library 100 is a collection of 100 programs on five cassettes. The programs come in five categories: Finance, Education, Graphics, home and Games. The listed games are:

  • Speedy
  • Odd One
  • Russian Roulette is a duel to the death with a single revolver.
  • Star Blazer
  • Search (not a game)
  • Spyship
  • Tiger Shark
  • Jumble 1 is a game of unscrambling words.
  • Jumble 2 is a game of unscrambling words.
  • Stingray is an action game that puts the player in command of a space ship that must destroy enemy ships.
  • Stars
  • Sketch (not a game)
  • Flipper (not a game)
  • Scissors
  • Horse
  • Doomsday is a graphical action game that place the player in control of a space cruiser.
  • Craps is a dice game.
  • Memory Quiz Letters let's you memorize letters and type them back in after they disappeared.
  • Memory Quiz Numbers does the same for numbers.
  • Wheel of Fortune is a betting game similar to roulette.
  • Decision (not a game)
  • Un-jumble
  • Fifteen is a magic square puzzle.
  • Towers is an implementation of the Towers of Hanoi puzzle.
  • Life is an implementation of Conway's Game of Life.
  • Star Trek is a Star Trek variant.
  • Race Track
  • Count
  • Roachrace
  • Gypsy
title: Library 100

description: Battle of the Bulge: St. Vith is a 1-player tactical strategy game for the TRS-80 based upon the World War II Battle of the Bulge.
title: Battle of the Bulge: St. Vith

description: Battle of the Bulge: Bastogne is a 1-player simulation of the World War II battle on the TRS-80.
title: Battle of the Bulge: Bastogne

description: Moon Lander is a real-time Lunar Lander variant. The player takes control of a lunar landing module and must control thrust and lateral corrections in order to successfully land the module on the moon, without crashing into it.
title: Moon Lander

description: Target is a shooting game for two players. Three aircraft fly overhead and are worth different points. Both players can fire at them at the same time in an attempt to score points.
title: Target

description: Dogfight is a game for two players. Both players take control of a spaceship and must try to hit each other. Obstacles can be used for cover, but bullets will bounce of walls.
title: Dogfight

description: Dogfight II is a single player version of Dogfight. The computer takes the role of one of the spaceships. The computer has perfect aim, but doesn't have the ability to bounce bullets on walls like the player does.
title: Dogfight II

description: Numbers is a Nim variant. The player can play against another player or the computer. Players take turn taking a limit number of objects from a pile. Whoever takes the last object loses the game.
title: Numbers

description:
Deathtrap is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character with a continuously elongating tail. The player can move in the cardinal directions, and must avoid striking their tail or various mines or walls that appear in the level. After a specified time period, an outer wall opens up, and the player can escape the level. The player starts with 3 lives, and gains a life every time they escape a level with 20,000 points.
title: Deathtrap

description:
The Deadly Dungeon is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

The player has entered a deadly dungeon, and must collect the seven treasures held within, and return them to the starting sign in an old temple. All commands are via VERB + NOUN text entry. There is no save and restore feature, and the maximum score is 500. The player solves numerous inventory-based puzzles to complete the adventure.

There is a simple combat system, where the player is awarded a combat strength and number of arrows at the beginning of each adventure. The player must do battle with the denizens of the dungeon, where they can choose to either fight with their sword or shoot arrows at their foe. Shooting arrows is safe to kill an enemy, but the arrows are finite. When engaging with a sword, the player rolls against their opponent and if they fail, they die immediately.
title: The Deadly Dungeon

description:
Gauntlet of Death is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

You now face the deadliest test known to man. The Gauntlet is filled with invisible traps, avoidable by those who know where not to tread, and those who are just lucky.

The player moves their character through a series of hallways and passages, attempting to pick up treasures. As they explore, they encounter hidden traps which can damage them. The player can pick up potions, which will either poison the player, heal them, or temporarily show the presence of traps. The goal is to obtain as much treasure as possible while exploring the gauntlet.
title: Gauntlet of Death

description:
Maze of Darkness is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The sequel to the Gauntlet of Death, the Maze of Darkness is the ultimate test of speed, agility, and daring, the final stage in the grueling quest for acceptance into the Assassin's Guild.

The player moves their character through a series of hallways and passages, attempting to pick up treasures. As they explore, they encounter hidden traps which can damage them. The player can pick up potions, which will either poison the player, heal them, or temporarily show the presence of traps. The goal is to obtain as much treasure as possible while exploring the gauntlet.
title: Maze of Darkness

description:
Space Colony is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small ship which moves horizontally on the bottom of the screen and fires vertically upwards. Numerous shields block player and enemy fire. The enemy ships move horizontally until they reach the edge of the screen, move down, and continue their assault. The player's goal is to destroy all enemy vessels before one reaches the bottom of the screen. The plyer loses a life if hit, and it's game over if all 5 lives are lost.
title: Space Colony

description:
ABM Command is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls the American ICBM defense system, as missiles fall towards the major cities of Boston, New York, Washington, and Miami. The ABM defense is centrally located between the 4 cities, and the player must move a crosshair to fire a missile and intercept the descending ICBM.

Each city can withstand 3 hits before being completely destroyed, and when all 4 cities are destroyed or the central command is hit, it's game over. The player gains points for destroying enemy spy satellites and ICBMs, but loses points for each ICBM which hits a target. A building is rebuilt every 25,000 points.
title: ABM Command

description:
Melt Down is a nuclear reactor simulation for the TRS-80.

You are the commander of a nuclear power plant. A random disaster will arise, and you have to perform the correct commands to prevent the reactor from melting down. If you fail, all life in a 200 mile radius will be eliminated.

Gameplay demonstrated 9 separate gauges: water level, core temperature, room temperature, water pressure, critical mass level, control rod level, turbine speed, radiation level, and emergency core cooling. Some disaster will occur, causing the gauges to become abnormal. The player must quickly input commands to fix the problem, and the game tracks the time required to solve it.

There are 5 levels of difficulty, which define the type of problem and the available time to solve it.
title: Melt Down

description:
Shooting Gallery is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a crosshair, and tries to shoot the various carnival items that flash across the screen. The player has a total of 20 shots, and tries to achieve maximum score.
title: Shooting Gallery

description:
Treasure Dungeon 2 is a 1-player strategy game with RPG elements.

The player moves through a maze that contains 75 sections and 13 monsters. The player can move into rooms in the 4 cardinal directions. Some rooms have doors, which the player can listen to to hear what is on the other side. These doors can take multiple attempts to open. Some doors are trapped, and damage the player. The player can also search walls, which sometimes reveal a hidden door.

During combat the player and the monster take turns exchanging blows. If a monster is destroyed, the player can collect weapons and treasures from the battle. The goal is to search the dungeon, gain strength and treasure, and ultimately defeat the minotaur.
title: Treasure Dungeon 2

description:
Battleship is a 1-player implementation of the board game.

Played on a 10 x 10 board, the player and computer place 6 ships of different sizes, hiding them from their opponent. Each player takes turns firing at a square, and are told if they were hit or not. The first person to sink the enemy fleet is the winner.
title: Battleship

description:
Westward: 1847 is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to travel to Oregon from Kansas via overland travel. At the beginning of each journey, they must purchase oxen, food, ammunition, clothing, miscellaneous supplies, and have money left over for the journey. Each turn, the player moves progressively closer to Oregon, covering about 100 miles per turn.

Each turn, the player can encounter other riders, which may be friendly or hostile. The player can get sick or injured during encounters, and require assistance from doctors at forts. The player can also purchase supplies at forts. When low on food, players can opt to hunt using their ammunition. There are 5 levels of difficulty, which determine the amount of time the player has to type a word during the hunting section. Other encounters include flooding, which causes a loss of supplies, or encounters with friendly natives.
title: Westward: 1847

description:
Isolate is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The computer and human opponent each start on opposite ends of an 8 x 6 grid. Each turn, the player and computer move, and each turn the player can take away one square away from the playing field. The computer can take away 1, 2, or 3 squares depending on difficulty. The goal is to trap the opponent, so they cannot move. The first player to trap their opponent is the winner.
title: Isolate

description:
Picture Puzzle is a 1-player puzzle game for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to rearrange a 2 x 8 picture puzzle to solve the final image. Commands are via menu structures, and puzzles are timed. There are 5 puzzles with increasing difficulty.
title: Picture Puzzle

description:
Everest is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player is in control of a 10 member team attempting to climb Mount Everest. The player hires Sherpas for $10/day, and must also purchase food and oxygen tanks with limited funds. Each team member can carry 20lb of equipment or food or 4 oxygen tanks. Loads can be carried up 1 camp each day. The goal is to get at least 2 climbers, their oxygen tanks, and 4lb of food each to camp 6. If the weather is good, climbers can reach the summit of Everest. The player's camp can be struck by avalanches, or run out of food or oxygen, and if climbers are killed, the party will mourn for 1 day. There is a total of 30 turns of gameplay to complete the ascent. If the climbers reach the summit, victory is achieved.
title: Everest

description:
Frog Race is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Attempt to lead a frog, whom can move in the 4 cardinal directions, across a busy highway and a river with floating logs. The player must avoid cars and jump across logs to position their frog within the 5 homes at the top of the screen. When the player positions 5 frogs, they move on to a more challenging level. The player starts with 3 frogs, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Frog Race

description:
Oil Baron is a 1 - 4 player strategy managerial game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls an oil company, and must manage the financial management of their company. Gameplay is via menu structures, and players compete to maximize profit. Each turn, the player must purchase and refine oil for profit. They can purchase cheaper domestic or more expensive foreign oil, which they release to their refineries for profit. More domestic oil is available if the player purchases oil wells, and more refining capacity is available by purchasing and developing more refinery capacity.

The player must ensure they purchase sufficient pollution control smog units, or risk receiving major fines from the EPA. Research can also be purchased to improve the efficiency of their refineries.

To further improve company profit, excess cash can be used to purchase and sell a variety of stock each turn. The player can also spend extra money on domestic and foreign lobbying, as well as purchase class A and B service stations.
title: Oil Baron

description:
Drag Race is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to accelerate a drag racer with 4 gears as quickly as possible. The speedometer and tachometer are displayed on the screen. The player must avoid revving their engine too high without changing gears, or they will blow out their engine. The player cannot change gears while accelerating. The goal is to reach maximum speed in as little time as possible.
title: Drag Race

description:
Christmas "Show and Tell" is a 2 -player memory and trivia game for the TRS-80.

The player is displayed a list of 9 Christmas related words labelled 1 - 9. The words are then erased, and the player is asked a question related to one of these words. The player must remember and correctly answer which of the spaces the word belonged. The player with the most correct answers after all 9 words have been placed is the winner.
title: Christmas "Show and Tell"

description:
Towers of Hanoi is a 1-player strategy game based upon the puzzle of the same name.

The player must move between 3 and 7 disks from the first peg on the screen to reconstruct the tower on the third peg. Only smaller disks can be placed upon larger ones, and disks are moved one at a time.

sample_screenshots.caption: I've Moved the Largest Disk to the 3rd Peg

title: Towers of Hanoi

description:
Moving Maze is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Attempt to move a square through a large, constantly moving maze. The player can move in the 4 cardinal directions. Each maze is divided into 3 sections, and if the player touches a wall, that section needs to be restarted. The goal is to complete the maze in as little time as possible.
title: Moving Maze

description:
Reflection is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

Played on an 8 x 8 grid, 3 - 5 balls are randomly hid on the playing field. The player shines a laser into the field, and depending upon the exit point of the laser, the player must determine the location of the 8 balls. The balls reflect light 90 degrees when struck.
title: Reflection

description:
Parachute: The Sport of Target Jumping is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player jumps from a plane that continuously scrolls across the top of the screen from the left. The goal is to land as close to a target on the bottom of the screen as possible. The player must pull their rip cord to release their parachute to safely land on the ground, or risk losing the game. The player scores points based upon how close they land to the target.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Forgot to Pull the Ripcord

title: Parachute: The Sport of Target Jumping

description: Dungeon Adventure has the player descend a dungeon in search of valuable treasure. Deeper levels bring more fearsome monsters, but also more valuable treasure. The player can use magic spells to help descend further into the dungeon.
title: Dungeon Adventure

description:
Play it Again, Sam is a 1-player memory game for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to memorize a graphical and auditory sequence consisting of the keys G, Y, H, and B. There are 4 levels of difficulty requiring memorizing 8, 16, 24, or 32 notes. Notes are added 1 at a time.
title: Play It Again, Sam

description:
Invasion from Outer Space is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small vessel on the bottom of the screen that moves horizontally, and can fire vertically upwards. Streams of alien vessels move horizontally until they reach the side of the screen, at which point they move down one row and move back the other way. The player has 3 shields to help protect them from alien fire, and the player loses a base when hit. The player has a total of 5 bases, and when all are lost, it's game over. The alien swarm starts 1 row lower for each level completed.
title: Invasion from Outer Space

description:
Wordo is a 1 - 2 player word game for the TRS-80.

The computer picks a 5-letter word from a list of 1000 words, and the player tries to guess it. The played guesses a word, and the computer tells the player how many letters are correct until the word is solved. The goal is to solve the puzzle in as few turns as possible.
title: Wordo

description:
Lineball is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player moves a cursor with a long tail, and tries to trap a bouncing ball. There are 9 levels of speed.
title: Lineball

description:
Line-Four is a 2-player board game for the TRS-80.

Played on an 8 x 6 board, players take turns dropping playing pieces into 8 separate columns. The goal is to place 4 in a row for victory.
title: Line-Four

description:
Saturn Patrol is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small vessel on the bottom of the screen that can move laterally, and fire vertically upwards. Alien vessels arrive from Saturn, and attempt to destroy the player. The player has a shield, that they can activate once per life, that prevents alien spaceships from approaching. Alien spaceships, if they approach too close, will sweep across the bottom of the screen and destroy the player. The player has 5 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Saturn Patrol

description:
PR Dogfight us a 1 - 5 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player must fly sortie missions to strike out at enemy installations. The player controls a small plane from a side-view, that can climb, dive, and fire at enemy forces. The player navigates to new locations on a tactical map, where they can encounter enemy airships, ground forces, or friendly airbases. The player must refuel at airbases between raids, and receives points for enemies destroyed. The player has a total of 7 missions to gather 1000 points to reach the rank of Ace.
title: PR Dogfight

description:
Sonic Torpedoes is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a fixed torpedo launcher, and must destroy 3 types of alien spaceships as they fly by. The player must say, "Fire" into their microphone in order to launch a sonic torpedo. The goal is to destroy as many alien vessels as possible given time and torpedo limits.
title: Sonic Torpedoes

description:
Solitaire is a peg solitaire game for the TRS-80.

Played on a cross-shaped board with 33 spaces, the goal is to jump pieces on the board, removing the jumped piece, so that only a single peg is left remaining at the end of the game. At the beginning of each game, the player selects a piece, with the goal of having it the last remaining piece positioned in the center of the board. Pieces are removed until there are no remaining plays, and the player receives a score based upon how many pegs are removed.
title: Solitaire

description:
ICBM is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

You are the radar controller at a surface-to-air missile installation guarding Strategic Area Command Headquarters. You have just picked up a Russian ICBM heading your way. You must launch a surface-to-air missile to intercept and destroy the incoming ICBM.

The player controls the bearing and angle of the defensive missile, with the goal to position the missile within 1.5 miles of the incoming ICBM to allow for its detonation. Each radar sweep, the player can input a new bearing and angle to try to position closer to the ICBM. If the ICBM makes it to its goal, it's game over.
title: ICBM

description:
Slot Machine is a 1-player animated slots game for the TRS-80.

The player can play quarter or dollar slots, and bid up to $5 at a time. Payoff is clearly displayed on the bottom of the screen. Game tracks winnings and number of times played.
title: Slot Machine

description:
Stud Poker is a 1 - 5 player card game for the TRS-80.

0 - 5 human opponents compete at a game of stud poker. Cards are graphically displayed on the screen. The player can call, raise, drop, check, or peek at their down card. The current pot is displayed on the right of the screen.
title: Stud Poker

description:
Draw Poker is a 1-player versus computer poker game for the TRS-80.

Each player draws 5 cards, and after 2 rounds of betting, can replace up to 3 more cards (or 4 if they leave an ace). After 2 more rounds of betting, the cards are revealed. Cards are graphically displayed on the screen. Each player starts with $1000, and the maximum bid is $100.
title: Draw Poker

description:
Tycoon is a 1 - 5 player business simulation for the TRS-80.

Each player takes on the role of a business tycoon, the leader of a large corporation. The player can purchase up to 5 factories, and within each control the amount of and pay for employees, item production costs, sales budget, and advertising budget. The goal is to pay off starting debt, and make profit to expand the company. Each player has different economic situations each year, and the first player to reach $10,000,000 is the winner.
title: Tycoon

description:
Star Trek: Encounter in the Near Tholian System

A treaty of peace between the Federation of Planets has lasted since Organian star date 3199.5. However, with the passing of Ayelborne, the Klingons have openly provoked hostilities with Federation shipping, and have illegally confiscated a vast amount of cargo. The specter of war again looms over the entire galaxy. The player takes on the role of Captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise, as they attempt to engage and destroy the Klingon battlecruisers in the Near Tholian sector of space. These battlecruisers have already led to the loss of two Federation vessels and outposts.

The player engages in combat with Klingon battlecruisers. Each turn, the distance and angle to the Klingon vessel and its shield level are displayed. The Enterprise's current energy level and shield power are also displayed. The player can choose to attack, using either their forward or read phasors, or fire a photon torpedo. Each of these actions deplete the vessel's energy reserves. The ship can veer off, close to attack, or stop in its current position to better position itself in combat, which affects damage rates. The player can also choose to enact repairs or charge shields.

The goal is to destroy the enemy Klingon vessel before the Enterprise itself is destroyed.
title: Star Trek: Encounter in the Near Tholian System

description:
Micro-80 Pinball Machine is a 1-player pinball game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a left and right paddle to bounce a ball. The player controls how many balls they get per game, and each level has 2 difficulty options. There are 4 pinball variations:

  • African Safari: The player tries to hit a hunter 8 times to aim their gun and shoot the elephant. If the player hits the elephant 8 times first, the elephant charges through the hunter.
  • Random Targets: The player tries to hit randomly placed targets on the level.
  • Normal Pinball: Try to hit targets to gain points, and keep the ball in play as long as possible.
  • Wipeout: Try to strike all the numbers present on the screen. As numbers are hit, they move closer to the paddles.
title: Micro-80 Pinball Machine

description:
Sailplane Derby is a 1 - 4 player flying game for the TRS-80.

The player takes control of a glider, and tries to complete a course where they must glide to two separate locations, and then return to their starting point. The player can choose the locations of their waypoints as well as weather conditions. Extra altitude can be reached by spending time within updrafts. Travelling faster will cause the plane to lose altitude more quickly. The player can adjust the direction and speed of their vessel. Cockpit display shows airspeed indicator, altitude, compass, variometer, turn indicator, and stopwatch.
title: Sailplane Derby

description:
Concentration II is a 2-player tile matching game show for the TRS-80.

Players take turns matching tiles on a 5 x 5 board which contains 1 wild card. Each tile has a prize, and as prizes are lifted from the screen, they reveal a 5-digit code hidden underneath. The first player to guess the revealed number receives all the accumulated prizes.
title: Concentration II

description:
Escape is a 1-player maze game for the TRS-80.

The player sees a large maze from a top down view, and must try to remember the way to the exit. The player then plays from a 1st person perspective, and attempts to escape from the maze.
title: Escape

description:
Monster Maze is a 1-player maze game for the TRS-80.

The computer generates a large maze, which the player briefly views prior to it disappearing. The player must then try to navigate through the invisible maze to the exit, while avoiding a monster which attempts to move towards the player. If the player bumps against a wall, the wall becomes visible for the remainder of the exploration.
title: Monster Maze

description:
Earth-Port II is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to land a spacecraft on a landing pad with 6 levels of difficulty. Gravity constantly pulls the vessel downwards, requiring fuel to keep it aloft. The player's spaceship has a limited amount of oxygen to make a successful landing, and must first position themselves into the landing zone. The screen then zooms upon the landing zone, and the player must position their spacecraft, so it is moving slowly and positions in the center of the landing pad.

sample_screenshots.caption: Closing in on the Landing Site

title: Earth-Port II

description:
Missile Evasion is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small spaceship, which must navigate a maze, while picking up plutonium pellets. A missile patrols the maze, and will circle the outside, but it if has a direct visual line to the player, will begin to move towards them. The player has a limited amount of fuel to pick up all the pellets. If the player is caught by the missile, they're disintegrated. If the player clears all the pellets, they move to a level with 1 more patrolling missile. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Missile Evasion

description:
Pressups is a 1-player versus computer board game for the TRS-80.

Played on a 7 x 7 board, there are neutral squares in the center and corners of the field, and squares that score points for the human or computer on the edges. The player starts on a neutral square, and each turn can move 1 square away in any of 8 possible directions. Squares are removed from the board after being moved on, and 1 point is rewarded when a computer or player square is removed. The game ends when a player collects 10 points, or no available moves are left.
title: Pressups

description:
Ship Destroyer is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small cannon in the center of the screen, and attempts to destroy Soviet vessels as they sail past. There are 4 types of vessels, from large slowly moving vessels to fast small moving vessels. Smaller vessels are worth more points if destroyed. The player is armed with 3 types of attacks: A small slow moving torpedo, a laser beam, and a proton beam which destroys all ships on the screen. The player has a limited number of uses of the laser and proton beams per game. The player receives bonus time and extra firing if they reach 5000 points.
title: Ship Destroyer

description:
Tanks-a-Lot is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a small tank that can rotate clockwise or counterclockwise, can move forwards, and fire. The two players navigate a maze, trying to defeat each other. The game tracks the number of tanks hit.
title: Tanks-a-Lot

description:
Score 4 is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Nineteen balls are dropped one at a time into a 4 x 4 vat containing the numbers 1 - 16. The ball slowly drops down to lower positions, while moving left and right. The player tries to press a key, when the ball is sitting on a number, removing that number from the board. If the player selects a key on an empty space, that ball is lost. The player scores points for removing 4 in a row, the 4 outside spaces, or the 4 inside spaces, to a maximum score of 19. There are 9 levels of ball speed, and balls can also be lost by hitting the bottom of the vat.
title: Score 4

description:
Assault IV is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

It is March 20, 1993. The world has been at war for two years. The conflict has been reduced to a European land war. Most Allied commanders believe that victory is close at hand, but intelligence has confirmed that the enemy is massing their strongest combat divisions in an area approximately 100 kilometers north of Dresden in preparation for a slashing drive across Germany. You take on the role of general of the 5th Army Group, under command of NORPAC, to crush the enemy buildup.

At the start of combat, the player is in control of 16 divisions, consisting of infantry, armored, and airborne. These can be placed in 4 corps, or in reserve. The player must rotate divisions between these 5 positions to push back the enemy charge. The enemy will randomly attack while repositioning troops, and sometimes your own division commanders will attack without orders. If the player's position is pushed back too far, it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Enemy Pushes Back Division II

title: Assault IV

description:
Dominoes is a 1-player board game for the TRS-80.

Contains three different versions of dominoes. Only the active ends of the tile segments are displayed:

  • Bergen: Each player draws 6 tiles, and lowest double plays first. The goal is to match both ends of the chain, scoring 2 points. Three points are scored playing a double on a double header. One point is awarded for going out. If the player can't play, they must draw 1 tile, and if they still can't play, they pass their turn. If the boneyard is used up, 2 consecutive passes ends play.
  • Block Game: The highest double starts, and there are no draws from the yard. Players play only the tiles dealt, and if they can't play, they must pass. Two consecutive passes ends play. Points are awarded based upon remaining points in hand. Games are played to 50 points.
  • Draw Game: The highest drawn tile goes first, and players can draw from the bone yard. If a player can not lay a tile, they must pick from the bone yard until it is empty, and can not pass until then. Two consecutive passes ends play. Points are awarded based upon remaining points in hand. Games are played to 100 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Highest Double Plays First in Block Game

title: Dominoes

description:
Robot Builder is a 2-player game for the TRS-80.

The player rolls dice, where each number corresponds to a body part, including: body, arms, wheels, neck, head, and antennae. A robot requires 6 wheels, 4 arms, and 1 of each remaining part. The body must be placed first. A head can't be placed without a neck, and an antennae can't be placed without a head. The first person to complete a robot is the winner.
title: Robot Builder

description:
Fredericksburg is a 2-player strategy war game for the TRS-80.

Each player takes on the role of a commanding general of the Battle of Fredericksburg during the American Civil War. The players can use historical troop placements, or custom troop locations. Gameplay consists of troop movement and artillery fire phases. Victory is achieved by inflicting 15% losses on the opponent.
title: Fredericksburg

description:
Bats is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player is placed in a field surrounded by electrified fences, with bats and more electrified fences dispersed throughout the field. The player can move in 8 directions, and the bats move invariably straight towards the player. The goal is to defeat the bats by having them run into electric fields, and if a bat comes in contact with the player, it's game over. The player has a hyperspace option, which randomly warps them on the playing field. The player can specify the number of electric fields and bats.
title: Bats

description:
Exterminate is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You have just inherited an abandoned cave from your long lost uncle Goobervincle. It seems like the cave has been infested by some rather large bugs. Since an exterminator is too expensive, you've decided to remove them yourself.

The player controls a small character who starts on the right side of a maze, while monsters stream from the left side of the maze. The player kills the bugs by stepping on them. If the bugs manage to escape the maze, then they will contact the government and have you arrested. The goal is to destroy as many bugs as possible before the game is over. There are 5 levels of difficulty from beginner to very hard. The player can choose the number of points or turns for victory, or can play an infinite game.
title: Exterminate

description:
Space Ball is a 1 or 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small paddle on the bottom of the screen which moves laterally. The player uses this to bounce a space ball toward creatures which move laterally across the top of the screen. If the player misses a bounce, they lose a space ball, and it's game over when all are lost. The player gains bonus balls and additional rows of creatures as existing lines are defeated. As the game progresses, creatures and balls move faster.
title: Space Ball

description:
Konane is a 1-player board game for the TRS-80.

Played in an 8 x 8 board with cross and square pieces evenly interspersed throughout. The goal is to be the last player to make a move. Cross always goes first, and can take a central piece or a corner to start. After that, square can take an adjacent piece. Every move after that requires a jump, where the player must jump an opponent piece into an empty square. The last player to make a move is a winner, and the goal is to isolate the opponent where they cannot jump. There are 4 levels of computer difficulty.
title: Konane

description:
Vici is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

The Cessa Valley is surrounded by mountains formidable enough to make it nearly impenetrable. The two small states the valley contains, Vici and Arce, are threatened by only each other. Your older brother was the ruler of Vici, but after he died childless, you were brought back to Vici as heir presumptive, and offered the throne.

As your two nations have been locked in perpetual warfare, victory and peace can only be achieved by eliminating the enemy nation.

Game play is divided into seasons. During the fall Harvest Court, the player must ensure enough supplies to feed their population through the year, and can sell extra crop of wheat, sheep, or wine for money. The player can set the tax rate on their population, as well as feed the members of their population who have lost land or livestock from war.

During winter seasons, the player can plan military expeditions, choosing their level of aggression against Arce, as well as expending funds to increase their military size. The goal being to capture increasing amounts of Arce's territory.

Each season has weather elements, which affect their crop outcomes as well as the chances of military success. The player must keep their own population content, while ensuring military success, or their population may go into revolt, and the player is deposed.

The player can compete at 10 levels of handicap.
title: Vici

description:
Victory at Sea is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small vessel which can move up and down, and can drop bombs on battleships that scroll below. The player must avoid enemy fire. The player starts with 9 ships, and loses 1 every time they are hit. If the player hits the tower of a ship, it is fully destroyed for 5 points. Other hits are worth 1 point.
title: Victory at Sea

description:
Micro Adventure is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small character who can move in the cardinal directions, and is continuously chased by a dragon. The player tries to avoid the dragon and other obstacles to gather treasure, and then move to the exit door without being caught. Whenever the player reaches a staircase, they move to a new level with a new dragon in chase. When thye get caught, it's game over.
title: Micro Adventure

description:
Ladders is a 2 - 4 player board game for the TRS-80.

Players attempt to claim the top position in a board containing ladders labelled 2 - 12. 2 - 4 players roll 2 dice, with the highest number rolling first. Each turn, a player rolls 4 dice. They can take any sum of 2 dice, claiming that position, as well as the sum of the remaining dice's position on the board. The player can claim up to 3 positions on a board in the round. Each dice roll, the player can claim 2 dice, to advance 1 or more of the 3 claimed rows. At any time, a player can choose to stop and save their position in place for future rounds, and transfer game play to the next player. If at any time, a player rolls 4 dice which do not correspond to any of the 3 positions claimed, all movement during that round is lost. If the player chooses to end their turn while they are positioned in the top rung of a ladder, that ladder is claimed for the player for the rest of the game and cannot be used. The first person to claim 3 ladders is the victor.

sample_screenshots.caption: Rolling to See Who Goes First

title: Ladders

description:
Quest is a 1-player graphical adventure game for the TRS-80.

The player and their companion must search the local countryside and a nearby cave for treasure. Each scene shows a small graphic which shows the items and exit directions for each area. The goal is to collect all treasures, destroy all monsters within the cave, and return safely to their home.

There is a save and restore feature. There are 3 levels of difficulty. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Quest

description:
Sleuth is a 1-player graphical adventure game for the TRS-80.

You and your partner have just been assigned to investigate a crime at the Bodewell estate. The player and their companion start at the local police bureau, and must travel to the estate to investigate. There they meet the various inhabitants, and must determine who committed the crime.

There is a save and restore feature. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Find a Key in the Jail

title: Sleuth

description:
Arcade is a 1-player game for the TRS-80.

Contains two small games:

  • Be-Bop: The player moves a paddle horizontally on the bottom of the screen, and attempts to bounce a ball into numbers at the top of the screen. There are 5 levels of difficulty.
  • Erase: The player tries to trace a line drawn by the computer. It's game over if the player goes off track. There are 5 levels of difficulty and twelve different paths.
title: Arcade

description:
Breakthru is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a paddle which moves vertically on the left side of the screen. The goal is to bounce a ball, so it breaks through the blocks on the right side of the screen. The player can choose to start with 1 - 8 balls, and the game speeds up with each successful bounce of the ball. A ball is lost whenever the player misses with their paddle.
title: Breakthru

description:
Mini-Invaders is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small ship at the bottom of the screen, which moves sideways and fires vertically upwards. A group of space vessels move horizontally along the screen, and fire randomly. If the player destroys all ships, they move to an identical level with more ships. The player starts with 3 ships, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Mini-Invaders

description:
Meteor Dodge is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player moves a spaceship in the 4 cardinal directions, and attempts to collect a specified number of fuel canisters. As the player tries to collect the canisters, more and more meteors appear on the screen. If the player strikes a meteor or flies off the screen, it's game over.
title: Meteor Dodge

description:
Starbase Gunner is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Congratulations! You have been promoted to Commander, and assigned your very own starbase. You're on your first mission to deep space, when suddenly your sirens herald the arrival of an attacking alien fleet.

The player controls a starbase stationary in the center of the screen, which can fire in 4 separate directions. Enemy vessels approach rapidly from all 4 directions, and the player must destroy them before they reach the ship and destroy it. Enemy objects can take 1 or 2 shots to destroy. The player is penalized for not hitting an object, and receives more points the further an item is before being destroyed. The player has 3 starbases, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Starbase Gunner

description:
Pegboard Solitaire is a 1-player board game for the TRS-80.

Jump pegs on a 15 piece triangle-shaped board. The goal is to have 1 piece remaining at the end of the game.
title: Pegboard Solitaire

description:
Connecting Dots is a 1 -2 player strategy game for the TRS-80.

Players takes turns placing a line on a 10 x 10 board by typing the coordinates, with each line being 1 square long. A player is awarded a point if they complete all sides of a square. There are 2 possible levels of computer opponent. The player with the most squares once the board is full is the winner. Games can be saved in progress.
title: Connecting Dots

description:
Invasion Strike is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small ship on the bottom of the screen, which moves horizontally and fires vertically. An alien spaceship moves in horizontal rows from left to right, moving down one row each time. The player attempts to shoot the alien ship as it moves by. If the alien vessel reaches its home, the player loses a vessel. Each time the player shoots an alien vessel, the alien's home moves closer to its starting point. If the alien reaches its home 3 times, it's game over.
title: Invasion Strike

description:
Pingpong and Hockey are 1 - 2 player arcade games for the TRS-80.

The player controls a paddle which moves vertically on either side of the screen, and bounces a ball. The player can add "English" or spin to a ball. There are two games, pingpong and hockey. In pingpong, players bounce a ball across the screen, and if a player misses the ball, the opposite player gains a point. In a 1-player pingpong game, the player practice against a solid wall. In hockey, each player moves a set of 2 players, and the player gains a point by scoring the ball into a goal at the back of the screen. Each game is divided into 3 periods. The player can control the speed of the ball, and choose from 3 paddle sizes.
title: Pingpong and Hockey

description:
Fireman is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You are a heroic fireman single-handedly attempting to save the victims of a raging fire in a high-rise building. The victims fall from the sky, and the player must position their net in 1 of 5 positions to catch them. Thin victims fall straight down, while large-headed victims can get blown off track as they descend. The player must avoid getting hit by falling debris. Every 20 saves, the player advances to a harder level, where they move 1 step higher towards the surface of the building up to level 12. If the player misses 3 victims, it's game over.
title: Fireman

description:
Space Fire is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Four alien vessels scroll across the top of the screen at different speeds and directions. The player controls a missile turret in the bottom center of the screen. When the missile is fired, it can be steered left and right, with the goal to hit as many alien creatures as possible. When an alien creature is hit, a new one takes its place. The player has a limited number of shots per game.
title: Space Fire

description:
Fliptag is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Two players race about a maze. One player is designated the chaser, with the goal of tagging the other player. The chaser gets a point if they tag their opponent. When a player is tagged, or at a random time interval, the role of chaser is reversed.
title: Fliptag

description:
Turret and Track is a 2-player strategy war game for the TRS-80.

Each player controls a team of 4 tanks and a single headquarters. Terrain options available are city and desert, and the goal is to destroy the enemy headquarters. Each tank has 6 movements points per round, which allows the player to input a combination of move, turn, delay, and fire. The headquarters can move 1 turn per round. The computer randomizes movement after all commands are placed. Each tank has a starting value for movement, range, shots, and armor, and as the tank takes damage, these factors decrease. When a tanks' armor falls below 1, it is destroyed. Rear shots cause more damage than broadside, which in turn cause more damage than frontal hits. Chance to hit is based upon distance to the enemy.
title: Turret and Track

description:
Squares a Deux is a 2-player competitive sliding block puzzle game for the TRS-80.

Two players compete to see who can finish a 4 x 4 sliding block puzzle first. Players can compete by number of moves or time to solve. Some puzzles will be impossible to solve, and if the first player correctly recognizes this before 50 moves, they are the winner.
title: Squares a Deux

description:
Savo Island is a 1-player strategy war game for the TRS-80.

The player controls American and British forces against the Japanese during the World War II Battle of Savo Island. The player controls a number of 17 Allied ships, and each turn has 10 seconds to individually set each ships' heading and speed. Each ship has 3 speeds, and can engage enemies from flank speed. The player tries to seek out and destroy the hidden Japanese vessels. During combat, the player specifies the direction and range of their fire, as well as the direction of their torpedoes.
title: Savo Island

description:
Force of Arms is a 2 - 6 player strategy game for the TRS-80.

Nearly identical to the board game Risk, each player strives to take over the entire globe through combat. The globe is divided into 42 different sections, and the player gains and places reinforcements each turn. Players can only attack from nearby territories, and are awarded bonuses for controlling a continent. Combat is randomized by dice rolls The player can set a custom scenario, or the computer can set up a random scenario.
title: Force of Arms

description:
Io-Miner is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The year is 2086, and the Terran Defense Authority has declared a state of emergency for the Sol System. The peace treaty between the Terra and the Empire of Proxima Centauri has been broken, and the evil Proximans are preparing for a major attack on the Sol System. An advance party has already crossed the stellar void between the two systems, landed on Jupiter's moon Io, and captured a plutonium mine there. With the Io mine twelve re-fueling base in the hands of the Proximans, the comparatively miniscule Terran defense forces have little hope of preventing Earth and her sister planets from becoming another Proximan slave system.

The Proximans have temporarily evacuated the mine, leaving behind only defensive robots. The player must guide a Mine Maintenance Robot specially outfitted for this mission with fusion grenades, and destroy the communication module on the lowest level.

The goal on each level is to reach the exit to the next stage. The droid has limited energy, and firing a grenade or moving uses up this energy. Energy can be picked up throughout levels, and if the droid is depleted, it explodes. Random doors open and close, which can damage the player, as well the player must avoid mining lasers. Matter teleporters on each level can transport players to a different location. If the player touches an enemy robot, they are destroyed. The player starts with 4 vehicles, and it's game over if all are destroyed.
title: Io-Miner

description:
The Memory Game is a 1 - 8 player memory training game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to remember the position of numbers and letters on a board ranging from 3 x 3 to 6 x 6. When the position of a tile is selected, the underlying character is revealed. Each position hides a different number or letter, and the goal is to proceed through the tiles in numerical and alphabetical order. The player is rewarded a score based upon the time and number of guesses required to complete the puzzle.
title: The Memory Game

description:
King II is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

King II is a resource management game of the Sumer Game variant. The player is king and each turn must determine the amount of land to buy and food to plant for their subjects. The player must purchase national guards to stop riots among their population, and must use extra money to quell inflation and expand their city. Silos can be used to store extra food for lean years. The goal is to keep a stable or growing population of subjects.
title: King II

description:
Nine games for Preschoolers is a series of simple games for the TRS-80.

Contains the following mostly unnamed programs:

  • Letterfun: Type a series of letters, and watch them animated on the screen.
  • ABC: Type the alphabet in order, while an animated face shows if the answer is correct or not.
  • The player most correctly identify letters, and then watch an animated spaceship shoot aliens.
  • The player types letters, which are then stretched across the screen.
  • Names: Type 6 words, and then see them displayed in a random order
  • A free typing program
  • Troll's Gold: Where the player tries to outmaneuver a troll on a 6 x 6 grid to reach a treasure, where the doors between areas keep changing.
  • A single digit addition testing game
  • Calculator: The computer solves basic arithmetic for the player
title: Nine Games for Preschoolers

description:
Flying the K-hawk is a 1-player flight simulator for the TRS-80.

The player flies a light airplane from a first person perspective. The player controls the speed, pitch, roll, and rudder of their aircraft. The game displays the player's speed, altitude, power, bearing, heading, and rate of climb.
title: Flying the K-Hawk

description:
Maze is a 1-player puzzle game for the TRS-80.

The player specifies the height and width of a maze, which is automatically generated by the computer. The player then navigates the maze from a 1st person perspective trying to escape.
title: Maze

description:
Seabase Survival is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

You have been placed in control of managing the resources of an underwater sea base. The sea base is powered by the local geothermal vents, which steadily lose output each turn. The player must allot resources to farming, desalination, hydrodome, and new technology. Left over water must be used for growing crops and power generation.

The player must ensure the sea base does not run out of drinkable water or food, also resources must be spent on the hydrodome to maintain adequate oxygen. The goal is to have enough excess resources to develop new technology.

sample_screenshots.caption: Diverting Water to Food and Potable Water Production

title: Seabase Survival

description:
Fire Rescue is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a fire rescue team, and tries to save people jumping from a burning building. As people jump from a burning building, the player must place a net underneath them, and bounce them into the waiting ambulance. The net can be in 3 different positions, and people can not be allowed to hit the ground. On higher levels, multiple jumpers are present simultaneously.
title: Fire Rescue

description:
Sub-Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

You are the captain of an American destroyer during World War II. Your mission is to destroy as many enemy submarines as possible before time runs out. The player can move horizontally at the top of the screen, and drop depth charges from the front or back of the ship, with up to 2 depth charges on the screen at a time. The player has 999 time units to destroy as many submarines as possible, but if they get hit by an incoming torpedo, it's game over.
title: Sub-Attack

description:
Warehouse is a 1-player turn-based strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player is a thief trying to move about a warehouse while avoiding the guards. Throughout the warehouse are a number of boxes, and 3 crates which can't be destroyed. The player tries to push crates into guards, without getting caught by a guard, or getting hit by a crate pushed by a guard. The player has 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Warehouse

description:
Codebreaker is a 1 - 2 player logic game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to decipher a 4 digit code consisting of the numbers 1 - 6 before their human or computer opponent can. Each turn, the player is shown how many digits are correct, and how many are in the correct position. Competition occurs over 10 rounds of play.
title: Codebreaker

description:
Shake-5 is a 1 - 4 player implementation of the popular dice game for the TRS-80.

Players take turns rolling five dice, and each turn can choose which dice to keep. The player can reroll the remaining dice for 2 more rounds, keeping the five dice they prefer before choosing their scoring category. Scoring categories include 6 categories within the Upper Section, which include the sum of all ones to sixes. In the Lower Section, the categories include 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, full house, a 4 dice straight, a 5 dice straight, shake-5 (5 of a kind) and chance (which is the sum of all dice). A game is finished when all 11 scoring categories have been used. A computer opponent is available for competition.
title: Shake-5

description:
Gandy Dancer is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player attempts to navigate 5 hobos, one at a time, from one side of a railroad yard to the other and then back again carrying delicious Mulligan Stew. The player must dodge between railroad cars on the way up the screen, and then jump between flatcar, open boxcar, and platform on the way down. The player tries to navigate each hobo into one of the 5 slots at the bottom of the screen that they started from. The player gets a total of 5 minutes each game, and has 5 hobos. It's game over when time runs out or all hobos are lost. There are 4 levels of difficulty, which control rail car speed.
title: Gandy Dancer

description:
Danger in Orbit is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a small spaceship that can rotate 360 degrees, accelerate, and fire directly forwards. The player tries to shoot asteroids and alien ships. Asteroids break into 2 smaller pieces when hit, which in turn break into 2 even smaller pieces. The player has limited fuel to accelerate or jump to hyperspace, which randomly moves a player on the screen. The player receives a new ship for every 10,000 points. The player starts with 3000 fuel units and 3 ships, and it's game over when all ships are lost.
title: Danger in Orbit

description:
Attack of the TRS-80 is a 1-player text adventure for the TRS-80.

The colonists of Moonbase II have been forced to flee for their lives. A deranged Model I microcomputer has infiltrated the colony's central computer, and has taken over the base and all of its electronic inhabitants. Your mission: Find the Model I and destroy it, while avoiding the deadly robots which now patrol the station.

The player moves about different rooms of the space station view text commands N, S, E, and W. The player can pick up and drop items. At the begining of the game, the player can buy armor, weapons, and equipment with suspension of disbelief points. The player has limited alertness and disbelief, which can be lost in combat or by actions. Alertness can be restored by drinking alcohol. There is a combat system with randomly wandering enemy robots, where the player can use items and attack with weapons. If the player takes 6 hits in combat, or if alertness or disbelief are lost, it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Start Out Losing my Lasers
I Pick Up a Golf Club

title: Attack of the TRS-80

description:
Quest for the Key of Nightshade is a 1-player roleplaying game for the TRS-80.

The player moves his party of warriors on a 30 x 30 grid which contains castles, cities, towns, tombs, bridges, mountains, and marshes. As the player explores, they enter combat with a variety of enemies. Battle results are determined by the party's strength. During world exploration, the player loses fatigue, food, and water, and must frequently rest and repurchase supplies. The player can purchase arms, armor, and recruit more men at settlements. The goal is to locate the 5 Keys of Nightshade found throughout the land, clues to which can be found in towns. After amassing a large army and all 5 keys, the player can rescue the Good King from Castle Nightshade.
title: Quest for the Key of Nightshade

description:
Project Deep Dive is a 1-player arcade game.

The player tries to descend a great underwater chasm to reach the alien base at the bottom. As the player descends, they can move left and right, and fire in 5 separate directions pointing downwards. The player can briefly operate a force field to protect them from enemies. The player has limited energy, that is used by shields and weapons, but slowly regenerates when not put to use. Enemies include mines, torpedoes, torpedo launchers, side movers, quick bombs, and mini mines. The goal is to reach the docking port at the bottom of the tunnel to destroy it. The ship is destroyed if it is hit.
title: Project Deep Dive

description:
Boxer is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls a boxer who moves vertically on the screen, and can punch with his left or right arm. The player scores points for punching randomly appearing punching bags. The goal is to punch as many as possible in a limited time frame.
title: Boxer

description:
Master Mind is a 1-player number guessing game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to guess a 4-digit code in as few turns as possible. Each guess, the player is told how many numbers are correct, and how many are in the correct position.
title: Master Mind

description:
Star Colony is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

After the great Interstellar War, Earth lost all of its off-world colonies. You are the captain of a newly built intergalactic vessel, tasked with exploration and recolonization. The player's goal is to colonize and explore as many star systems as possible in the time time allotted. The player starts with a full stock of supplies and 5000 prospective colonists. As the player's fuel runs low, they can restock by mining radiation rich planets, but this takes away from exploration time. The player can also revisit previously established colonies to see how they are thriving, and restock supplies. The game ends when the player runs out of time, runs out of fuel, or successfully returns to Earth.

The player can map, scan, jump, or check ship status each turn. While scanning, the player can look for nearby solar systems. The player can then jump to nearby star systems. When jumping, the player has a limited distance, and if they try to jump too far, they can become lost or destroyed. Scanning allows the player to determine the status of the currently visited system.
title: Star Colony

description:
Micro-Yahtzee is a 2 player text-based implementation of the popular dice game for the TRS-80.

Players take turns rolling five dice, and each turn can choose which dice to keep. The player can reroll the remaining dice for 2 more rounds, keeping the five dice they prefer before choosing their scoring category. Scoring categories include 6 categories within the Upper Section, which include the sum of all ones to sixes. In the Lower Section, the categories include 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, full house, a 4 dice straight, a 5 dice straight, yahtzee (5 of a kind) and chance (which is the sum of all dice). A game is finished when all 11 scoring categories have been used.
title: Micro-Yahtzee

description:
Frankenstein is a 1-player word construction game for the TRS-80.

The player tries 3 separate word games:

  • Frankenstein: The player tries to guess a word by guessing letters. Six incorrect guesses, and Frankenstein's monster comes to life.
  • Guess-A-Word: Try to guess a 5-letter word. For each guess, the player is told how many letters are correct, and in the correct position.
  • Jumbles: Try to Unscramble words
title: Frankenstein

description:
Tank is a 1-player arcade game.

The player must move their tank, represented by the letter 'H', to the location of 5 enemy vehicles represented by an 'X' in a minimal time period. They must avoid bumping into the terrain while doing this. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Tank

description:
X-Wing Fighter II is a 1-player arcade game based upon the trench run from Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope.

Gameplay is divided into two unique sections. The player has a total 100 laser blasts and 4 torpedoes available. In the first section, the player must reach the trench of the Death Star. To do this, the player must use their lasers to destroy a number of enemy vessels based upon difficulty level. Gameplay is from a 1st person perspective, where the player must line up a crosshair with moving enemy vessels to destroy them. Enemies fire missiles towards the player, which they must dodge. One hit, and it's game over. The distance to the Death Star, as well as horizontal and vertical direction is displayed. As the player approaches the trench, they must direct their vessel towards 0,0, or they'll miss the trench.

During trench descent, the player goes into auto-pilot, but must rapidly stabilize their craft when prompted, or they are destroyed.

During the trench run, the player now combats 2 enemy vessels from the front, but must also dodge attacking vessels from the rear. A rear radar is displayed, and if an enemy craft aligns directly with the player, they are destroyed. Autopilot prevents destruction by running into the trench edge.

Finally, as the player closes within 350 meters of the end of the trench, a special targeting sequence to launch a torpedo at the Death Star exhaust port commences.
title: X-Wing Fighter II

description:
Blackjack Master is a tutorial and teaching game for the TRS-80.

Designed to improve a player's skill at blackjack, it includes tools that allow a player to test their own strategy against the computer with simulated hands, as well as a teaching tool where the player is told what the ideal next move would be. A full blackjack game versus the computer, with bets of up to $500 per hand is included.
title: Blackjack Master

description:
Action Pack I is a series of action games for the TRS-80.

Contains the following 4 games:

  • Air-Sea Battle: A 2-player game, where one player controls a bomber, and the other an aircraft carrier. The ship and plane become progressively weaker as they are hit, and after too many hits they are destroyed.
  • Bomber Run: A 2-player game, where one player controls a bomber plane trying to hit ground targets, while the other player controls artillery trying to shot the plane down.
  • Shooting Gallery: A 1 - 4 player game, where the player moves a gun left and right, and tries to hit twelve items that move across the screen. The player gets a score based upon the number of ducks, dogs, and balloons hit.
  • Space Ace: 1st person space fighting game where they shoot alien vessels. The player uses energy when they fire lasers or move. There are 4 levels of difficulty.
title: Action Pack I

description:
Neutroid is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

A small neutroid bounces about a grid, and it can be redirected at any of the grid points. The goal is to crash the neutroid into the protroids that circle about the outside of the grid. If the neutroid crashes with the high energy outer wall, it is destroyed. The player advanced to the next round when all protroids are consumed. The neutroid speeds up as the round advances. Vertical and horizontal high energy regions briefly appear on the outer walls, and these supply a bonus if hit. On higher levels, bouncing antitroids can destroy a neutroid. It's game over if all neutroids are lost, and the player gains an additional neutroid every 5000 points.
title: Neutroid

description:
Escape Zone is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Escape from alien territory. The player controls a small ship that moves laterally on the bottom of the screen and fires straight ahead. The player flied through a series of caverns through 6 distinct zones trying to escape alien attack. Firing the laser requires energy, and the player must pick up energy pods (without shooting them) to restore their fire power. The player starts with 10 shield units, and if these are lost the ship is destroyed. Extra shields can be acquired during game play.

sample_screenshots.caption: Large Alien Vessels Appear in Zone 4

title: Escape Zone

description:
The Gladiator is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player is trapped in the arena, armed with a laser gun and shield. The player can move in all directions, and can fire in the cardinal directions. The shield can be briefly activated to protect from enemy fire, but has a limited life. Four droid competitors enter the arena, and try to destroy the player. Surrounding the arena are 4 trackers, which fire randomly into the arena. At the beginning of each match, a field protects the player and trackers, but this is destroyed by tracker fire. If all trackers and droids are defeated, the player progresses to the next level.
title: The Gladiator

description:
Stellar Wars is a Star Wars-themed game where the player takes the role of a pilot who needs to first shoot down 5-7 enemy fighters, and then perform a bombing run against the Death Star. To destroy a fighter, the player needs to estimate its location on a grid (with no gridlines) and type in the fighter's X,Y coordinates. A miss will show the location of the shot relative to the location of the fighter.
