The player has 3 chances to hit and destroy the fighter and move on to the next fighter, or the fighter shoots back and the player is destroyed (and loses the game).

After destroying 5-7 fighters, the player moves on to the Death Star bombing segment. This takes place in real time, with the player's plane shown moving across the screen, and the exhaust port being targeted displayed as well. The player has 4 chances to drop a bomb directly into the exhaust port and win the game. Otherwise, the player loses the game.
title: Stellar Wars

description: Population Simulation is a text-based resource management simulation similar to the classic Hamurabi, but with two players. In addition to deciding how much to invest in production and R&D, the player can decide to send out an exploration expedition, or even raise an army and attack the other player. Each player has a different level of technology, and one of the goals is to advance your technology over time.
title: Population Simulation

description:
Space Trek IV is a compilation of two games:

  • Population Simulation
  • Stellar Wars
title: Space Trek IV

description: Star Pilot is an action game that appears to be set in the Star Wars universe. The player is a gunner responsible for shooting down enemy fighters in a first person view. Enemy fighters will fly around in the field of view and eventually come into the player's cross hairs. If the player fires at the right time, they will shoot down the enemy. The player has a certain number of enemies to kill in each round, and a limited number of bullets, so shots need to be conserved.
title: Star Pilot

description:
Space Taxi is a game where the player needs to pilot a "space taxi" on some remote planet. The player must take off from a landing pad, fly up and maneuver over a mountain, and land on a landing pad on the other side. The planet is surrounded by a radiation dome, and flying above this dome leads to instant death via radiation poisoning.

The "taxi" starts with 70 units of oxygen and 80 units of fuel. The action is turn-based. In each turn, the player decides how much fuel to use for horizontal thrust, and how much for vertical thrust. The ship then flies according to the thrust applied, with gravity also exerting a force. Each turn uses up 5 seconds of oxygen. If the player runs out of oxygen or crashes into the ground or the mountain, they also die.
title: Space Taxi

description: Random Tic-Tac-Toe is a standard game of Tic-Tac-Toe against the computer, but with a twist. The squares in the grid are sequentially numbered, and after the player and the computer each have a turn, all Xs and Os in the grid will move to the next sequentially numbered spot in the grid (with tokens in square 9 moving to square 1). The object is to get 3 in a row, but the player needs to keep in mind not only where they are placing their token now, but where that token will eventually end up.
title: Random Tic-Tac-Toe

description:
Games Pack I (also titled Level I Games Pack on the spine of the packaging) is a collection of five games plus a drawing utility, for TRS-80 Level 1 BASIC. The games are:

  • Checkers
  • Hamurabi
  • Random Tic-Tac-Toe
  • Space Taxi
  • Star-Pilot
title: Games Pack I

description: Centimeters and Milliliters is an educational game where the player is either shown a bar on the screen, and asked to estimate how long the bar is in centimeters, or is shown a glass partially filled with water, and is asked to estimate how much water is in the glass (to the nearest 10 milliliters). In either case, if the player guesses incorrectly, they are given additional info to help them make a more accurate guess.
title: Centimeters and Milliliters

description:
This is a game where a window is drawn on the right side of the screen, and a brick is launched at the window from the left side of the screen. Half-way across the screen, the brick becomes invisible. The player needs to try to figure out when the brick will hit the window, and hit the BREAK key just before that occurs. Hitting the BREAK key actually exits the program, but when the player runs the program again, it remembers the previous state and will tell the player how close the brick was to the window. The closer the brick was, the more points the player receives.

If the player hits BREAK too late, after the brick already breaks the window, the player receives zero points for that throw.
title: The Game of Break

description:
The object of Sand Castle is to build a mountain 18 layers high. The player is given a lot of sand, a much smaller amount of gravel, and an even smaller amount of brick. In each turn, the player builds one layer of the mountain by choosing which material to use for that layer, and how wide to make the layer. When building a layer with sand, the layer needs to be at least 6 meters narrower than the layer beneath it. When building a layer with gravel, the layer needs to be at least 4 meters narrower than the layer beneath it. When building a layer with bricks, the layer needs to be at least 2 meters narrower than the layer beneath it.

The player wins the game if they can build all 18 layers. They lose the game either by running out of materials, or by not following one of the conditions outlined above (e.g., building a layer of sand which is less than 6 meters narrower than the layer beneath it), which will cause the mountain to collapse.
title: Sand Castle

description:
CLOAD Magazine was one of the first electronic format magazines, and was for the TRS-80. It originally came on cassette tapes, hence the name CLOAD (which is the command to load BASIC programs on cassette into the TRS-80's memory), but was later also distributed on floppy disks. Each "issue" came with several programs on the media, most of which were typically games.

The March 1978 inaugural issue contained the following games for TRS-80 Level 1 BASIC:

  • Centimeters and Milliliters
  • The Game of Break
  • Sand Castle
  • The Game of L-O-G-I-C, a variant on the classic game of Mastermind
title: CLOAD Magazine March 1978 (Issue #1)

description: B-52 Strategic Bomber is an arcade game where the player pilots a plane on a bombing run. At the start of the flight, the player decides how much fuel to carry vs. how many bombs. The bomber will automatically fly from left to right, and the player controls the bomber's altitude and decides when to launch bombs. While bombing the various targets, the player must avoid anti-aircraft guns. Eventually, the player can attempt to land the bomber in order to refuel. If the plane crashes, is shot down, or runs out of fuel, the game is over.
title: B-52 Strategic Bomber

description:
Stock Market Game is a 1 - 4 player stock trading game for the TRS-80.

Players compete to try to make $1,000,000 from buying and selling shares on Wall Street.
title: Stock Market Game

description:
One Pocket Pool is a relatively simple math/physics based game. A pool (billiards) table is drawn on the screen, with a single pocket in the right bottom corner of the table. The cue ball is placed randomly somewhere on the table, and you are told the horizontal position of the ball, on a scale of 1-100, but you are not told the vertical position of the ball (although you can see it on the screen).

The player needs to decide where along the top horizontal wall of the table to bounce the cue ball off, in an attempt to cause the cue ball to ricochet and land in the pocket. The player gives a horizontal coordinate of 1-100, and then the game shows the actual trajectory of the ball and whether it went into the pocket.

The game keeps track of how often the player succeeds and fails to get the ball in the pocket.
title: One Pocket Pool

description: Horse Race is a game where up to 2 players can select from one of 4 horses to bet on, and can choose how much they want to bet. After the bets are in, the race is displayed in real time from a side view. It appears to be random in terms of which horse wins, and the players cannot affect the race results. At the conclusion of the race, the players are told how much they won or lost.
title: Horse Race

description:
CLOAD Magazine was one of the first electronic format magazines, and was for the TRS-80. It originally came on cassette tapes, hence the name CLOAD (which is the command to load BASIC programs on cassette into the TRS-80's memory), but was later also distributed on floppy disks. Each "issue" came with several programs on the media, most of which were typically games.

The April 1978 issue contained the following games for TRS-80 Level 1 BASIC:

  • One Pocket Pool
  • Horse Race
title: CLOAD Magazine April 1978 (Issue #2)

description: Bruiser is a boxing game for the TRS-80, played over 10 rounds. The player plays against a computer opponent known as 'Bruiser'. The action takes place in real-time and is shown from a side view. The player can move toward or away from the opponent, but can also move sideways right or left, which in practice is up or down on the screen, respectively. The player or the opponent gain points by hitting the other in the face. In practice, because of the way the animation works, the player must be slightly above the opponent (i.e. to the right of the opponent) to score a hit, and vice versa. The opponent will knock out the player if the opponent scores a few hits in succession without the player reacting. However, the opponent cannot be knocked out and the player can only win by decision. To do so, the player must both score a great deal of points and also score considerably more points than the opponent.
title: Bruiser

description: Russian Roulette is an implementation of the classic "game" of Russian Roulette. After some initial animations of a gun being loaded and aimed, the player sees the gun pointed at them in a first person view. Every time the player hits a key, the gun is fired. If a bullet is in the chamber, the player is shot dead and the game ends. If the player successfully fires the gun five times without dying, the player wins.
title: Russian Roulette

description:
Ecology Simulations: 2 is a compilation of four simulation games:

  • Diet: predicts the player's weight loss or gain based on their diet.
  • Malaria: challenges the player to save as many people as possible from a malaria epidemic.
  • Pollute: demonstrates how a body of water gets polluted depending on conditions that the player defines.
  • Rats: challenges the player to wipe out an infestation of rats either in an apartment building or in a city.

All of these simulations were based on simulations developed as part of the Huntington Project and the Huntington II Project in the late 1960s and early 1970s.
title: Ecology Simulations-2

description: Alien Attack Force is a Space Invaders clone for the TRS-80. There are 9 levels of difficulty. The player gets multiple "bases" (one at a time) with which they can move along the bottom of the screen and shoot the invaders. The player also has several barriers that serve as a temporary defense from the alien bullets (although the player can shoot through them as well). However, the aliens descend very quickly and when one of them touches the ground, the game is over, no matter how many "bases" the player has left.
title: Alien Attack Force

description: Battleground is a war simulation for two players taking place in World War 2 (specifically, Berlin in 1944). One player takes the role of the American commander moving toward Berlin, and the other player takes the role of the German commander planning a defense. Players take turns selecting their troops and associated items (such as bunkers) and then placing them on the battlefield. Once that process is complete, combat is turn-based. There are two types of combat commands - movement and firing.
title: Battleground

description: Actual Reality is a science fiction action/strategy game based on the novel of the same name by the game developer, Cat Mantra. The player is in command of the IDF Astron space ship, and must explore the multi-verse to seek out new habitable planets and new life forms, but also engage in combat missions to defeat the evil IDE. Combat is in real time. In general, the player selects an action to perform from a menu of choices; there is little if any direct control.
title: Actual Reality

description:
Actual Reality 2: Battlestar Raven is the sequel to the original Actual Reality. The premise is that in the previous game, the player, the commander of the IDF Astron, completely wiped out the enemy IDE fleet, with the exception of the enemy battleship, the Battlestar Raven. The Battlestar Raven is now out to get the player and take revenge. The player needs to survive these attacks and then retaliate.

There is also a two-player option where one player can command the IDF Astron and the other player can command the Battlestar Raven.
title: Actual Reality II: Battlestar Raven

description:
WarGames is a series of mini-games based on the 1983 film of the same name but not carrying an official license. Like in the film, the player logs into a supercomputer and is presented with a list of options. A couple of these are similar to the film, such as the ability to play a game of Tic Tac Toe, or the ability to select the option "Global Thermonuclear War", although the latter is presented as a simulation and not as the computer actually starting a nuclear war.

In addition to the above, the following other mini-games are present, most of which have some kind of Star Trek theme: Ask Spock*: essentially a "Magic 8 Ball" to whom the player can ask yes/no questions

  • The Battle of the Mutara Nebula: a reenactment of the battle against Khan from the end of Star Trek II
  • Klingon Roulette: a Russian Roulette simulation
  • Kobayashi Maru Scenario: a reenactment of the famous no-win scenario from the film Star Trek II
  • Podracer: a gambling simulation where the player bets on Star Wars-style pod races
  • Retro Football Manager: a soccer management simulations
  • Time Bomb: a game where the player needs to defuse a bomb (on station Deep Space Nine) by guessing which wires to cut

In addition, available for play are the previous games from >Dreamland Software are available for play, including Actual Reality, Actual Reality II, and RockStar.
title: WarGames

description: This compilation release includes both Actual Reality and Actual Reality II: Battlestar Raven.
title: Actual Reality / Actual Reality II: Battlestar Raven

description: Blockade is a light cycle game requiring 2 players. The game allows for several speed settings, keeps score, and outputs sound via a strategically placed AM radio (if available). Players move around the screen and leave a solid trail. The first player to collide with an edge of the screen or a trail loses the round.
title: Blockade

description: Ultra-Trek is yet another Star Trek variant for the TRS-80. One interesting innovation in this version is that crew members can get killed in battle, and if more than a certain number are lost, the game is lost because the Enterprise can no longer function. Another interesting innovation is the requirement to hunt down and destroy an enemy base in addition to just a certain number of Klingons and Romulans.
title: Ultra-Trek

description:
Pong / Perfect Pong are two different games on opposite sides of a TRS-80 cassette tape.

  • Pong is a relatively standard game of Pong but with a 1 player option in addition to the standard 2 player option. With 1 player, the computer does not act as the opponent. Instead, there are non-moving barricades that the player must maneuver the ball around in order to score a point.
  • Perfect Pong, unlike Pong, is only for one player, and also unlike Pong, has the player's paddle at the bottom of the screen moving horizontally (whereas standard Pong has paddles on the left and right of the screen moving vertically). Similar to the version of Pong on the other side of the cassette, there is no AI opponent but rather various barricades. The player can select from several different barricade options before starting the game.
title: Pong / Perfect Pong

description:
Board Games-1 is a compilation of several games for TRS-80:

  • Backgammon - A version of the classic game, programmed by Scott Adams
  • Qubic - a 4-D Tic Tac Toe implementation
  • Flip Disc - an Othello/Reversi implementation
  • Wumpus I and Wumpus II - two versions of Hunt the Wumpus
  • Mugwump - the classic type-in BASIC game as seen in Creative Computing Magazine, People's Computer Company, 101 Basic Games, etc.
title: Board Games-1

description:
The Minotaur's Malevolent Maze is a 1-player timed maze game for the TRS-80.

The player tries to navigate from the top left of a maze to the bottom right corner. Every time unit, an additional piece of the maze is added, and the goal is to reach the finish point before all routes are blocked. On harder levels more blocks are present at the start.
title: The Minotaur's Malevolent Maze

description:
Alien Armada is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80.

Your Earth base is being attacked by an alien armada. The player controls a rocket launcher that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires directly forwards. Enemy vessels swoop down towards the player and fire downwards. When the player destroys all the ships on the screen a new wave appears. There are 3 levels of difficulty. The player starts with 3 vessels, and gains a new ship every 5000 points.
title: Alien Armada

description:
King Arthur is a 1-player strategy war game for the TRS-80.

In 520 A.D. the Romans had abandoned Britain for a century. Barbaric Anglo-Saxon invaders sailing from the continent in longships had colonized the east coast and were gradually pushing westwards. At last a new leader united the quarreling British tribes, and led them against the invaders. His name was Arthur.

The list of British cities and the number of men available is displayed along with a map of England and Wales. Each turn the player can send a spy to several cities to determine how many troops are there. The player then rallies troops to an allied city for the campaigning season. The player has 2 turns, and can move their troops to cities near the rallied city to battle enemy troops and capture cities. The Anglo-Saxon forces can do the same each turn. The goal is to defeat the Anglo-Saxons, and drive them back into the sea.
title: King Arthur

description: Gem Hunter is a relatively simple arcade game based on the Atari 2600 title Man Goes Down. The player character is attempting to fall down a seemingly endless vertical shaft in a controlled fashion, while collecting as many gems as possible. The screen continually scrolls vertically. The player character cannot jump, but can walk off a platform and control their descent, and attempt to land on a platform below. If the player character goes offscreen, they die. The platform structures and gem positions in Gem Hunter are randomized with every game providing an element of luck and variety making each game a bit different.
title: Gem Hunter

description:
'Round the Horn puts the player in the role of a clipper's captain. The goal is to race from New York, around South America to San Francisco. Set during the gold rush era of US history the player reenacts the record breaking voyages of the historical ships The Flying Cloud, The Surprise and The Challenge. Picking one of the ships the player must race the other two to San Francisco.

The game shows the map of the Americas and the position of the three ships. Each turn the player must pick a direction to sail in, getting information about the wind (including a visual of the staysail). When close to the coast the player can also spot land which must obviously be avoided. The ship can also run aground on hidden reefs. Aside from the player-chosen direction, the ship's heading is also influenced by the currents in the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans and winds blowing the ship off course.
title: 'Round the Horn

description: Sink 'Um is an action game in which the player fires torpedoes at enemy ships. The challenge is to maneuver the ship and time the torpedoes precisely so they make a hit.
title: Sink 'Um

description: Simple Simon is a "Simon Says" style game. Prompts are given that the player must repeat, but after each success the prompt becomes longer and thus harder to repeat.
title: Simple Simon

description:
Warfare I is a compilation of war-related games:

  • Dive Bomber
  • Pillbox
  • Sink 'Um
  • Tank
title: Warfare I

description:
The Count / Voodoo Caslte is a compilation of two text adventures by Scott Adams:

  • The Count
  • Voodoo Castle
title: The Count / Voodoo Castle

description: Kamikaze is an action game in which the player has to defend a navy ship against attacking suicide planes. The goals is to survive the incoming waves of aircraft. The game features three difficulty levels.
title: Kamikaze

description: Cubes is a puzzle game based on the physical puzzle game Instant Insanity. The player is given four cubes with sides in different colors. The goal is to stack them on top of each other in such a way that when looking from the four sides of the stacks there are also four different colors visible.
title: Cubes

description:
Robot / Breakaway is a compilation of two games by Lance Micklus:

  • Robot
  • Breakaway
title: Robot / Breakaway

description: Wheel of Fortune is a gambling game in which players bet money on a wheel. A barker provides witty remarks.
title: Wheel of Fortune

description: Kentucky Derby is a horse race betting game. The player bets on the horse of their choice and watches them race in the hope to get a payout.
title: Kentucky Derby

description: Kiddy Slot is a one armed bandit slot machine designed for children. The player starts with 10 tokens and must try to come out ahead.
title: Kiddy Slot

description: Talking Banko is pretty much the same game as Banko. The only difference is that it uses the TRS-80 Voice Synthesizer to speak out some of the numbers. The rules of the game remain the same. The player has to get a score as close to 11 without going over, receiving random points after each hit between 1 and 11, but with larger odds for lower values. The computer opponent will mimic the player's strategy to create a fair game.
title: Talking Banko

description: Cryptogram is a puzzle game in which the player must discover a hidden phrase or word for which all letters have been substituted with another one.
title: Cryptogram

description: Tug O' War is a rope pulling game for two players. Each player uses three buttons and watches the screen for prompts to press their button. The player who pressed the correct button fastest wins the tug and get the middle of the rope closer to their side. Pressing the wrong button causes an instant lose of the tug.
title: Tug O' War

description: Gammon Challenger allows for playing Backgammon on the computer. The player and computer take turns rolling the dice and moving their pieces along the board. The AI has three skill levels and an additional mode in which the player can specify the dice rolls to see what the computer does.
title: Gammon Challenger

description:
Star Warp+, later renamed to Space Warp+ is a space combat game in which the player moves cross-hairs across the screen to fire at enemies. The goal is to score as many points as possible within the time limit.

The B-side of the tape includes a graphical Lunar Lander game in which the player must land a module on the moon without running out of fuel and inadvertently crash into the surface.
title: Star Warp+

description: Star Trek is a real-time variant of the familiar concept. The player Captains a space ship and must rid space of Klingon invaders. The player uses scanners to hunt them down and then engages in combat. There are four levels of play.
title: Star Trek

description: Block'Em is a light cycle game in which players move along the screen and leave behind a trail. The first player to hit a trail or the edges of the play area loses the round. The game features four game options and nine different speeds to play at.
title: Block'Em

description:
Ecology Simulations-1 is a compilation of multiple simulations adapted from the Huntington II project.

  • Pop: this simulation isn't really a game, but shows three models of population growth.

  • Sterl: the player has to control a fly pest population by introducing sterile mates or pesticides into their environment.

  • Tag: the player has to get a correct estimation of the number of fish in a pond by using a tagging-and-recovery system.

  • Buffalo: the player must manage a herd of buffalo to enable hunting without them going extinct.
title: Ecology Simulations-1

description:
Mission Impossible Adventure / Voodoo Castle is a compilation of two text adventure games by Scott Adams:

  • Mission Impossible
  • Voodoo Castle
title: Mission Impossible Adventure / Voodoo Castle

description:
Pursuit Games is a compilation featuring four games and a kaleidoscope toy to generate moving patterns on the screen. The games are:

  • Stock Car Race is a racing game on a circuit with stock cars. The arrow keys are used to steer, accelerate and decelerate through the curvy track.
  • Maze is timed maze escape game through a randomized maze. The player is rated based on time spent and moves made.
  • Indy Racer is another racing game, this time with Indy cars. The player must also switch gears at the right moment.
  • Depth Charge is an action game in which the player must destroy enemy submarines by deploying depth charges from they destroyer. the charges sink slowly so the player must deploy them at the right time to hit the moving submarines.
title: Pursuit Games

description:
Social and Economic Simulations is a collection of simulations based on the Hunting II Computer Project.

  • Limits - This simulation is not a game but shows the limits of growth while simulating five factors: population, pollution, food supply, industrial output and resource usage.
  • Market - This simulation allows two players to compete in bicycle sales by changing quarterly marketing strategies.
  • USPop - Is a tool in which the user can study US population demographics and projected forecasts.
title: Social and Economic Simulations

description:
Games Pack-1 is a compilation of the following games on a single floppy disk:

  • Backgammon
  • Qubic
  • Flip Disc
  • Wumpus 1
  • Wumpus 2
  • Mugwump
  • Ultra Trek
  • Romulan
  • Star Wars
  • Star Lanes
  • Stock Car Race
  • Maze
  • Indy Racer
  • Depth Charge
  • Kaleidoscope (not a game)
  • Tunnel Vision
  • Evasion
  • Jig-Saw
  • The Masters
  • Motor Racing
title: Games Pack-1

description:
Games-2 is a compilation of three games, a biorhythm program and a music composition program. The games are:

  • Remember Where is a Concentration game. Players take turns trying to find matching symbols in a grid of tiles.
  • Yahtzee is a computer of the traditional dice game for two players.
  • Quick Maze is an action game in which a robot must be navigated through a maze. The robot is not allowed to crash into any walls. The game features eight speed variations.
title: Games-2

description: Marooned in Space is a game where you are lost somewhere in the solar planet. You can scan the nearest planet to learn about its properties. Based on the information the player can guess which planet it is. If the player guesses correctly the space ship's computer can plot a new trajectory towards Earth.
title: Marooned in Space

description: Gomoku is an adaptation of the traditional board game of the same name. The player plays against the AI. Each turn players place a piece on the 9x9 board in an attempt to reach five in a row. Rows may be attained horizontally, vertically and diagonally.
title: Gomoku

description: Win21 isn't a typical blackjack simulation, instead it's constructed as an educational tool for getting better at the game. Aside from playing the game the program also allows to play single hands and gives hints and instructions. Included with the game is the book Beat the Dealer which contains many strategies in improving the player's game.
title: Win21

description: Air Traffic Control puts the player in control of an air traffic control tower. The player sees a radar display of the direct surroundings of an airfield and must instruct up to five aircraft on how to proceed and handling emergency situations.
title: Air Traffic Control

description: Yacht Race is a board game with a boat racing theme. The goal of the game is to sail around a course plotted out by three buoys that must be passed by. The player must plot its own course navigating around islands and peninsulas.
title: Yacht Race

description: Mind Boggle is a Mastermind variant with words. The player has to guess the word by guessing sequences of letters and learning if the letters guessed are in the correct position, or appear somewhere else in the word but not in its current position. The goal is to guess the word in limited tries.
title: Mind Boggle

description: Slot Machine II is a digital slot machine featuring animated graphics and sound. The machine will give different virtual payouts based on the icons on the reels.
title: Slot Machine II

description:
TRS-80 Disk Library "A" is a compilation of the following programs:

  • Galactic Blockade Runner
  • Magic Isle
  • Othello III
  • Demo
  • Bingo Calling program (an aid for playing bingo)
  • Sci-Fi Sampler
  • Russian Roulette
  • A visual graphic of the starship Enterprise
  • A visual graphic of Snoopy
title: TRS-80 Disk Library "A"

description:
TRS-80 Disk Library "B" is a compilation featuring the following programs:

  • A biorythm tool
  • A micro text editor
  • a printing tool
  • Slot Machine
  • R/T Lunar Lander
  • A personal finance tool
title: TRS-80 Disk Library "B"

description:
TRS-80 Disk Library "C" is a compilation of games by Leo Christopherson:

  • Android Nim
  • Snake Eggs
  • Lifetwo
  • Cubes
title: TRS-80 Disk Library "C"

description:
This compilation features three games by the same author:

  • Cave Exploring - In this game the player explores a large cave, trying to find treasure. Dangerous creatures must be defeated to get to the treasure.
  • Yacht - A digital implementation of the dice game Yahtzee
  • Concentration - A version of the memory game in which two identical tiles must be revealed.
title: Cave Exploring / Yacht / Concentration

description:
This compilation contains three games:

  • Car Race - This racing game presents two players with a top down view of a racetrack with the goal of reaching the finish first.
  • Anti-Aircraft - A shooting game in which the player controls an anti-air gun and fires at an enemy airplane.
  • Rat Trap - A tactical puzzle game in which a rat must be captured in a grid by careful placement of two cats.
title: Car Race / Anti-Aircraft / Rat Trap

description:
This compilation features three military themed games:

  • Destroy All Subs - The player is tasked with destroying three subs which must be hunted down using sonar reports and destroyed with depth charges. The player must avoid hitting a mine or torpedo.
  • Bombers - A timing game in which the player drops bombs on moving submarines.
  • Gunboats - A two-player game played against another player or the AI where both players try to destroy each other's boat.
title: Destroy All Subs / Bombers / Gunboats

description:
Space Trek III is a compilation of two space-themed games

  • Stellar Wars
  • Planetary Lander is a Lunar Lander variant in which the player must land a landing module on various planets in the solar system. The player uses thrust to ensure the lander doesn't crash into the surface.
title: Space Trek III

description:
Demo I is a collection of eight programs meant to demonstrate the capabilities of the TRS-80.

  • Music Composer - A utility to compose music to play via an AM radio.
  • Baseball - A sports simulation in which the player plays a match against the computer.
  • Horse Race - A horse race betting game.
  • ESP - A utility to test your extrasensory perception.
  • Hi-Lo - A number guessing game.
  • Tic-Tac-Toe - The classic game of three in a row.
  • Petals around the Rose - A puzzle game in which dice are rolled and the player must guess the number that the rolled dice represents, using the hidden rule.
  • Slot Machine - A slot machine simulation.
title: Demo I

description:
This compilation features four games:

  • Hex Pawn - A version of Hexapawn. A game of chess played with three pawns each on a 3x3 grid. The goal is to reach the other side of the board.
  • Shuttle Craft Docking - The player is tasked to successfully land a shuttle on a starship through varying gravity fields.
  • Space Chase - The player mus seek out the enemy in a star field with the goal to destroy them.
  • Battleship - A computer version of the classic board game, where the player must try to destroy the enemy fleet that's hidden in a grid.
title: Hex Pawn / Shuttle Craft Docking / Space Chase / Battleship

description:
Cards is a compilation of three card games:

  • Draw Poker - A poker variant in which players can draw new cards by discarding the cards in their hand they don't want.
  • Stud Poker - A poker variant in which cards are received in rounds with betting in between.
  • No-Trump Bridge - A four player (partners of two) card game in which players try to take tricks.
title: Cards

description:
Fun Package I is a compilation of four games:

  • Rocket Pilot - The player must try to land a rocket ship.
  • Paper, Rock, Scissors - A digital version of the classic game, played against the computer.
  • Hex I - A puzzle game with increasing difficulty.
  • Missile Attack - The player must defend a city from jets by firing missiles.
title: Fun Package I

description:
Demo II is a compilation of the programs mostly designed to be used as a demo display inside a store:

  • Tic-Tac-Toe - A computer version of the classic pen and paper three-in-a-row game with three difficulty levels.
  • Time Trials - A racing game on a curvy track where players must reach the finish in time.
  • Maze - One or two players must find the hidden exit of the maze.
  • Hangman - Played in turns against the computer, the player or computer must guess the hidden word, letter by letter.
  • Wheel of Fortune - Spin the wheel to see what you win. A crooked setting allows the player to win any time.
  • Hurricanes - Not a game, but a tool to track hurricanes and their path.
  • Bugsy - A dice rolling game in which the computer and player compete to construct a bug.
  • Horse Race - A horse race betting game.
title: Demo II

description:
Demo III is a compilation of various programs and games designed for in-store demo purposes. Besides a biorhythm tool, a phone number conversion tool, graphics program, drawing board and clock it contains the following games:

  • Race 1 - A racing game in which players compete against the clock on a circuit.
  • Target UFO - A shooting game where points are scored based on how quickly UFOs are shot down.
  • Life - An implementation of Conway's Game of Life.
  • Race 2 - Another circuit racing game with five different tracks to race on.
  • Horse Race - A horse race betting game for up to nine players.
title: Demo III

description: Animated Hangman is a word guessing game. The player guesses letters in an attempt to find the hidden word. For every letter guessed that doesn't occur in the actual word part of a hanged man is drawn. If the drawing is complete the player loses.
title: Animated Hangman

description:
Animated Game of Life with Sound is a version of Conway's Game of Life as it appeared in Life Two, but with added sounds and without the competitive mode. The rules of the game are as always:

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
title: Animated Game of Life with Sound

description: Galaxy Target is a science fiction combat game in which the player must shoot down an alien ship without running out of power. An unknown bonus game is included on the B-side of the cassette.
title: Galaxy Target

description: Starr Trekk is a Star Trek variant. In this unlicensed game the player commands the Enterprise and the original crew (with the option of customization). The player must find and destroy all enemies using scanners, and the weaponry of the space ship; all without getting destroyed themselves.
title: Starr Trekk

description: Cylon Raider is an unofficial space combat game using themes from Battlestar Galactica. The player must try to hit a single Cylon ship. The ship will twist and turn to try to avoid getting hit.
title: Cylon Raider

description: Poker Dice is a game similar to Yahtzee. The player rolls dice and must form a good hand with them. Valid hands are similar to those in the card game Poker (five of a kind, four of a kind, full house, straight, three of a kind, two pair, one pair, or bust). Players can re-roll a number of dice for up to three rolls.
title: Poker Dice

description: Slot is a one armed bandit slot machine simulation. The player presses a button and waits for the three reels to stop spinning. Different combinations earn the player a different payout, but each new spin costs the player money.
title: Slot

description:
An implementation of Conway's Game of Life. Patterns evolve using the normal rules:

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.

A 43x43 grid is used.
title: Game of Life

description: Erode is a game in which the player controls a ball and must bounce it against a wall. The ball's direction can be changed at any time with two buttons changing the direction by 45 degrees in either way. The game is over when the entire wall is gone or the time limit is over. There are four difficulty levels to choose from.
title: Erode

description: Bluffit is a bluffing game played with a deck of eleven playing cards. Both the player and computer are dealt five cards, with the 11th card held hidden. The goal of the game is to either guess the hidden card correctly, or have the opponent guess the card incorrectly. During a turn the player can either guess the hidden card (ending the game) or play by calling out a card. When a card is called out the other player must show it or say respond with "no". The bluffing comes in the form of asking for cards the player owns themselves.
title: Bluffit

description: Lifeboat is a resource management game with a rather gruesome premise. The player and nine other people are in a lifeboat after their ship has been wrecked. There is only limited water available in the lifeboat, and certainly not enough for all passengers to reach land. Three passengers start out ill (and require more water) and there are chances the lifeboat may be found before reaching shore or bad weather causing the travel to take longer. The player is the captain and has a revolver. Each day the player can choose to kill another passenger in an attempt to conserve more water. Killing too many people too early risks a mutiny.
title: Lifeboat

description: Psyche / Lifeboat is a compilation of the game Lifeboat and a tool to determine the user's personality type.
title: Psyche / Lifeboat

description: Scramble is a word guessing game for two players. Players can pick words from an existing list or enter their own. The letters in the words are scrambled and then have to be guessed correctly. The faster a player finds the correct word the more points can be won.
title: Scramble

description: Guess-A-Number is a very simple game in which the player must guess a number between 1 and 50. After each guess the player is informed if the guess is too high or too low. The goal is to guess the number in the least amount of guesses.
title: Guess-A-Number

description: Robots places the player in an arena with multiple killer robots and electric fences. Each turn the player can move one tile in any of eight directions and all robots will move directly towards the player. The game is over if a robot manages to touch the player or the player hits the edges of the arena or a fence. The robots also die when they hit each other, or fences. The goal is to make all robots collide with each other before they can reach you.
title: Robots

description: Compute Four is a computer version of the board game Connect Four. The player and computer take turns choosing one of eight columns to add a marker to. A marker drops down to occupy the lowest free position in that column. The goal is to get four markers in a row.
title: Compute Four

description: Chicken is a racing game in which you drive straight towards a solid wall, the question is how long the player will wait with hitting the breaks. The player who ends up closest to the wall without crashing wins the match.
title: Chicken

description: Moving Maze is a game in which the player must navigate a maze from one side to the other. The maze however is constantly changing, with gateways opening and closing. This can cause the player to be locked in temporarily or in the worst case go game over because of a gate closing in on them.
title: Moving Maze

description: Trek78 is a Star Trek variant. The player captains the starship Enterprise and is on a mission to destroy Klingon Battlecruisers. The player uses short and long range scanners to find where in Federation space the enemy ships hide out and than use various weapons to destroy them. The Enterprise can be refueled and replenished at various starbases. Aside from Klingons the player can also encounter Romulans whose ships have cloaking technology and can appear out of nowhere.
title: Trek78

description:
Simutek Package Two is a compilation of multiple games:

  • Checkers 2.1
  • Poker Face
  • Psychic - a non-game entertainment program imitating a psychic.
  • Tangle Mania
  • Word Scramble
title: Simutek Package Two

description:
Simutek Package Three is a compilation of multiple programs, including some games:

  • Poetry - a random poetry generator.
  • Electric Artist - a drawing program.
  • Galactic Battle
  • Word Mania - a word guessing game played against the computer.
  • Air Command
title: Simutek Package Three

description:
Simutek Package Four is a compilation of five games:

  • Life - A Conway's Game of Life simulation. The player places live cells on a grid and watches them create new live cells and die following the Game of Life rules.
  • Real Time Lander
  • Greed II - A dice game played against the computer. The player must use their knowledge of odds to beat the computer.
  • The Pharaoh
  • Robot Hunter
title: Simutek Package Four

description:
Simutek Package Five is a compilation of five entertainment programs:

  • Super Horserace! - A betting game at the racetracks. The game uses a graphic display of the races.
  • Maze Mouse - A non-game entertainment program. The computer generates a random maze and a mouse tries to find the exit. On the second run the mouse will always go the fastest route to the exit, utilizing its knowledge of the maze.
  • Amoeba Killer - The player is in a submarine, shrunken to the size of a bacteria and must destroy deadly amoebae that are infecting a human body.
  • Logic - A Mastermind variant with two difficulty levels. The player must use logical deduction to find the hidden code.
  • Submariner - An action game in which the player fires torpedoes at enemy targets.
title: Simutek Package Five

description: Doom Castle is an fantasy action game in which the player ventures into the titular Doom Castle in search of treasure, weapons and monsters. After a successful run the player must also still escape the castle alive.
title: Doom Castle

description: Whereami ? is a two player arcade game where points appear on the screen and both players race towards the points to collect them. Beyond the addition of score pickups the game plays similar to Light Cycle games where players leave a trail and mustn't hit a wall or trail or go game over.
title: Whereami ?

description: The Stock Exchange is a stock exchange simulation. The player can invest money on various stocks in the hope their value improves and they can sell them for a profit. A news ticker can inform the player on impending changes to stock prices. Stocks can also be bundled.
title: The Stock Exchange

description: Dr. Chips is a chat bot similar to Eliza. The player types text which the computer interprets and responds to, allowing the player what appears to be genuine conversation with the doctor.
title: Dr. Chips

description: Trek 80 is a Star Trek variant. The game's primary mechanics are similar to other variants, but the mission has changed. The player has to rescue a supply fleet and there are dozens of Klingon ships that must be destroyed. The player controls the star ship Enterprise and must use their scanners to find the enemy and their phasers and torpedoes to destroy them. The play area consists of 64 sectors of 64 quadrants each. The Enterprise can be resupplied at star bases. The enemy Klingons move around, resupply and use two types of weapons. In addition tugs can also attack the player but can only use phasers.
title: Trek 80

description:
Daredevil is a compilation of 6 games for the TRS-80.

Contains Aero Target, Auto Race, Bob Sled, Indy-80, Race, and a text-based slalom game Ski Racer.
title: Daredevil

description:
Life / Life2 / Renum is a collection of three programs written in Assembly.

  • Life is a version of Conway's Game of Life on a 64x16 grid.
  • Life2 is another version of Conway's Game of Life, this time using a 128x48 grid.
  • Renum is a tool to renumber program lines.
title: Life / Life2 / Renum

description:
Life is an implementation of Conway's Game of Life for the TRS-80 using a 64x48 grid, written in Z-80 Machine language. The player can draw patterns and watch how they evolve based on the simple rules of Conway's Game of Life:

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
title: Life

description: Jotto is a Mastermind variant in which the player must guess a five letter word. After each guess the player learns the number of "jots", which are the amount of letters that also appear in the word that needs to be guessed.
title: Jotto

description: Superbagels is a logic deduction game similar to Mastermind. The player must guess a numeric code. After each guess the number of correct numbers and correct numbers in the correct position is made known. Using information from all previous guesses the player must try to solve the code in as few turns as possible.
title: Superbagels

description: Digits is an adaptation of the Coleco handheld game of the same name. The player must guess the four number code devised by the computer and gets clues after each guess consisting of the amount of numbers in the right location and the amount of numbers that are in the code but in another location.
title: Digits

description: Comp IV is a computer conversion of the Milton Bradley dedicated handheld game of the same name. The computer thinks of a code and the player must guess it. After each guess the player is told the amount of correct numbers and numbers in the correct position of the code.
title: Comp IV

description: Hangman is a word guessing game. The computer selects a word and the player must guess letters until the word is formed. Incorrect letters will result in part of a hanged man being drawn. Only a limited number of incorrect guesses can be made before the game is over. There are two difficulty levels determining the amount of guesses.
title: Hangman

description: Rocket Lander is a text-based Lunar Lander variant in which the player must land a rocket on the surface. The rocket is going in a freefall and the player can activate the thrusters to slow its descent. On each prompt the player can give a fuel burn rate and a duration for it to burn at that rate. Fuel is in limited supply and also has a weight. The goal is not to crash into the surface by breaking too late, too little or running out of fuel and going back into a free fall.
title: Rocket Lander

description:
Life is a simulation of Conway's Game of Life written in machine language. The player can draw his or her own patterns and watch how they evolve based on the simple rules of Conway's Game of Life.

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
title: Life

description: Tiddleywinks is a simple artillery-like game in which the player must launch a tiddlywink into the cup. The player has three tries and must try to guess the right values to create a parabola arc that makes it go into the cup.
title: Tiddleywinks

description: Laser Battle is a simple action game for two players. Both players control a laser turret on one side of the screen. Their goal is to hit the opponent as many times as possible to score the most points. The laser turrets move along the edge of the screen and players can reverse their direction at any time and must manually time their shots. Each player can only have one laser bolt in the air at any time. Reversing the laser turret will also guide the bolt up and down allowing players to guide the laser bolt into a zigzag pattern with repeated reversals.
title: Laser Battle

description: 80-Out is a Breakout variant for the TRS-80. The player controls a paddle and must keep a ball in play. Bricks hit by the ball break and award points to the player.
title: 80-Out

description: Disk Puzzle is a puzzle game with floppy disks. The player is tasked with moving a number of floppies from one spindle to another following specific rules.
title: Disk Puzzle

description: Bomb Squad tasks the player with defusing seven bombs. The player has limited time to do so.
title: Bomb Squad

description:
Funtape 1.1 is a compilation of the following games:

  • Gold Rush
  • Tic-Tac-Toe
  • 4D Chase
  • Math-Whiz
  • Decapawn
  • Hexagram
title: Funtape 1.1

description: 16K Star Trek is a Star Trek variant written in machine language. The player hunts down enemies in space, piloting the USS Enterprise. Using long range sensors to detect where they and other galactic objects are located near the player. The player can redistribute power to all the systems of the ship. Aside from the usual arsenal the player can use anti-matter pods. The game ends when all enemies are destroyed.
title: 16K Star Trek

description: Spacewar is a machine language implementation of the classic game for the TRS-80. Two spaceships fight it out on the screen with thrusters that allow them to move sideways and forwards. The sun provides a strong gravitational field. Both can fire torpedoes at the enemy in an attempt to destroy them. The game features various settings to tinker with such as the game speed, torpedo speed, and initial orbit.
title: Spacewar

description: Hangman / Hangfile is a Hangman game and accompanying data file. The player can add a large library of words. The game plays as usual with the player trying to guess a word one letter at a time. A part of a hanged man is drawn each time the player guesses a letter that is not present in the word.
title: Hangman / Hangfile

description: Secret Words is a word guessing game. There are three difficulty levels. The hardest difficulty gives the least clues. Words consist of two to five letters.
title: Secret Words

description:
Micro-Backgammon 1.5 is a computer version of the classic board game. It's written in Z80 machine language. The player plays against the computer (or the computer can play itself). The game features three difficulty levels. The state of the board is displayed on the screen, and the latest moves are also displayed in text format. It's also possible to manually set the dice rolls to be able to replay a tournament match.

The game follows the rules of the board game. Players take turns throwing the dice and moving their pieces along the board with the goal of reaching the other side.
title: Micro-Backgammon 1.5

description:
Real Time Games Package is a compilation of two games:

  • 3-D Real Time Lunar Lander - A real-time Lunar Lander variant. The player has to land their spacecraft on nine different planets.
  • Real Time Star Trek - A real-time Star Trek variant. The player hunts down Klingons in different sectors and quadrants. The player can use phasers and photon torpedoes to destroy the enemies.
title: Real Time Games Package

description: Heavyweight Boxing is a boxing game. The game features forty different contemporary and all-time great boxers, allowing the player to play out fantasy scenarios.
title: Heavyweight Boxing

description: Stock Market is a stock market simulation. The players can invest in different stocks in the hope to make money. Players can buy on margin, sell short and has to pay federal taxes.
title: Stock Market

description: The Wizard of Wall Street is a stock market simulation game. The player tries to make a profit buying and selling stocks on the US stock market. The game simulates supply and demand and events like takeovers.
title: The Wizard of Wall Street

description: Warsim is a wargame for two players. Each player controls a navy vessel of an opposing force. The game world contains six ports, five shallows, and five minefields. Different events drive the game and the state of the different features of the game world. Players can easily change the data statements to alter the game's world to their desire and to keep the game replayable.
title: Warsim

description: Horse Racing is a betting game in which the player tries to increase their starting money by betting on horses that race at the tracks.
title: Horse Racing

description: Yattzzee is a strangely spelled version of Yahtzee, the classic dice game. Players take turns rolling five dice and trying to make specific combinations. A desired number of dice can be re-rolled twice before a combination needs to be scored. If no combination is made, the player has to remove a combination of their score sheet. Whoever scores the most points wins the game.
title: Yattzzee

description: Monopoly is a computer conversion of the classic board game. Players take turns to roll the dice and move along the board. The location they end up will determine their options. Differing from the option to buy property, or having to pay rent, or draw a chance card. The players start with an initial sum of money that they can invest in property, with the goal to bankrupt all the other players and to form a monopoly on the board.
title: Monopoly

description: Breakout is a machine-code computer version of the arcade game of the same name. The player controls a paddle at the bottom of the screen and has to keep a ball in play by bouncing it against the bricks at the top which scores the player points and makes the bricks disappear.
title: Breakout

description: Maze/1 is a game that generates a random maze that the player than has to solve. Different complexity levels can be chosen by the player.
title: Maze/1

description: YG/1 is a computer implementation of the dice game Yahtzee. Up to seven players play against the computer, taking turns to roll the dice and trying to get a good match. A player can re-roll a number of dice twice per turn before noting down their score.
title: YG/1

description: CP/1 is a crossword game. The game generates crossword puzzles randomly and the player must try to solve them. The player can create their own word dictionary.
title: CP/1

description: Checkers is a computer implementation of the classic board game. The player plays against the computer and the board is shown on the screen. Players take turns moving their pieces diagonally on the board. They can capture opposing pieces if they can jump over them.
title: Checkers

description: MNP/1 is a computer implementation of the board game Monopoly. Players go around the board to buy property when available or pay rent when already owned by other players. The winner is the player who manages to bankrupt all the other players.
title: MNP/1

description: SWG/1 is a computer version of the board game Scrabble. Players take turns making words with letter tiles they have in their possession. More rare letters score more points and certain locations on the board have letter or word multipliers. Players can play against the computer.
title: SWG/1

description: TTT/1 allows the player to player Tic-Tac-Toe against the computer. The player and computer take turns placing their mark into a three by three grid in an attempt to get three in a row.
title: TTT/1

description: Poker is a computer version of the card game, allowing players to play against the computer. Players bet money on the hand of cards they have in the hope theirs is the best or that they can out-bluff the opponent. Whoever has the best poker hand at the end of a round wins the pot.
title: Poker

description: LND/1 is a business simulation game. The player is in control of a real estate company and must grow the company by buying and selling properties, while managing the tenants.
title: LND/1

description: LL/1 is a Lunar Lander variant. The player must try to land their spacecraft on an extraterrestrial surface by managing their velocity with their retro boosters and keeping an eye out on the remaining fuel.
title: LL/1

description: BNG/1 is a simulation of the luck-based game Bingo. The player receives a card with numbers and can strike them off once they are randomly called. A full card earns a prize.
title: BNG/1

description:
Meltdown is a nuclear power plant simulation for the TRS-80.

You are the chief engineer at the plant, and your goal is to keep the plant running at full power. You must respond to malfunctions in the plant which are indicated by the presence of yellow or red alarms depending on the seriousness of the problem. Malfunctions can be determined by observing the plant status panel display, and the proper repair action must be taken. More difficult problems can require several repair actions before the problem is detected and corrected.

If the plant efficiency drops too low you are fired. There are several command options, including starting pumps 1 or 2, raising or lowering control rods, and turning on or off the generator, controlling the pressure relief valve, or dispatching repair crew. Nuclear power plant status is graphically displayed on the screen.
title: Meltdown

description: GR/1 is a computer adaptation of the card game Gin Rummy. Players hold and draw cards and create sets and runs. The first player to get rid of all their cards wins the round.
title: GR/1

description: BJ/1 is a computer version of the card game Blackjack. The player plays against the bank and must draw cards with the goal of getting a value of twenty one, or as close to it, without going over.
title: BJ/1

description: Space Fighter is an action game in which the player must line up five enemy ships in their sights to destroy them. The game has three difficulty levels plus the option to limit the amount of missiles. The player can count on their patience as there is no time limit in the game.
title: Space Fighter

description: Submarine Chase has the player find and destroy a submarine. The submarine is hidden in 30x100 grid. The player can drop depth charges to try and destroy it. After each explosion the general direction and distance are made known. The player can then target another grid position, taking into account that the submarine also moves each turn. There are three difficulty levels, related to the speed the submarine can move.
title: Submarine Chase

description: System Blackjack is a digital version of the classic casino card game. The player plays the bank and the game records results over multiple hands so that the player can test different strategies. The goal of each round is to try to get a hand value of twenty-one or as close to it without going over. The game features more advanced logic such as doubling down and soft hands (counting the ace as either one or eleven).
title: System Blackjack

description: Descent is a real-time Lunar Lander variant. The game offers five different landing scenarios and uses an accurate portrayal of Newtonian physics. The console of the lander is shown on-screen with information about the descent. The player must control the descent velocity to prevent crashing into the surface.
title: Descent

description: Haystack 500 is a racing game in a rural environment. The player must avoid mud and haystacks on the track to reach the finish in the shortest time possible.
title: Haystack 500

description: Micro Football is an American Football game for two players. The field is displayed on the screen with moving characters and a clock. Players must choose a play for defense or offense and the combination of plays enters determines the results.
title: Micro Football

description: Micro Golf is a golfing game with eighteen different holes. Each turn the player picks which club they want to use and how hard they want to hit the ball. Some luck is involved to prevent the ball going into water or hazards.
title: Micro Golf

description: Keno is a computer version of the number gambling game. This version uses official Las Vegas Rules and odds.
title: Keno

description: Stock is a stock market simulation game. The player must figure out market trends and risk factors in an attempt to make money buying and selling stock.
title: Stock

description: The Game of Numb is a variant on Nim. Players take turns grabbing items from two piles. This version supports up to three players plus the computer, where most variants just support a single player.
title: The Game of Numb

description: Starry Eyes Two is a parody take on the many Star Trek variants released throughout the 1970s. The player fights the usual Klingons, but also less conventional foes like protestants and "Lion People". The player has access to the usual photon torpedoes and phasers but can also rely on stale bagels as a weapon.
title: Starry Eyes Two

description: The Light Pen is a physical pen attachment that can be hooked up to the TRS-80 or Commodore PET as an in put device. The user can then interface with the computer (in compatible software) directly on the screen using the pen. The TRS-80 version comes with a demo game program of Tic-Tac-Toe. The game plays the same as the pen and paper classic, with players taking a turn putting their mark in a 3x3 grid with the goal of getting 3 marks in a row.
title: 3G Light Pen (Included game)

description:
Adult Games is a compilation of two games intended for a mature audience:

  • Strip Dice is a dice game for two to six adults. The players roll dice and slowly start losing their clothes.
  • Strip Concentration is a clothes stripping variant of the classic memory game for two adults.
title: Adult Games

description: Tennis-80 is a Pong variant. The game features five variants an a practice mode. Players move their paddle to bounce back and forth the tennis ball across the screen. Points are won when the other player fails to return the ball.
title: Tennis-80

description: Superbug is a game of chance involving two bugs that move along the screen. The player competes against the computer in getting their bug over the finish line first. Movement happens through simple dice rolls.
title: Superbug

description: Football is a graphical American football game. The player can choose between seven offensive plays and six different defensive plays. The game simulation various situations such as field goals, two types of punts, time-outs, fumbles, interceptions, quarterback-sacks, and safeties.
title: Football

description: Graphic Golf is a graphic golfing game. The player plays at the fictional Small Woods Country club. There are eighteen different holes with a par of 72 strikes. The holes are shown in a top-down view and for each strike the player chooses the club and the strike angle.
title: Graphic Golf

description:
People's Software: Tape 1 Level I is a compilation of 24 programs taken from the public domain and adapted for the TRS-80. It includes a variety of non-game software such as tools for mortgage, Dow-Jones forecasting, cash flow, loan amortization and math drills among others.

The games included are:

  • Queen
  • Star Trek I
  • Number Guessing
  • Wheel of Fortune
  • World War II Bomber
  • Rock, Scissors, Paper
  • Seek
  • Star Trek III
  • Red Baron
  • Mini-Trek
  • Strategy
  • Pilot
  • Battleship
title: People's Software: Tape 1 Level I

description:
People's Software: Tape 1 Level II is a compilation of 34 programs. It includes all programs from People's Software: Tape 1 Level I but with an additional 10 programs and adjustments to the other programs that weren't possible in Level I BASIC.

The new games include:

  • Tic-Tac-Toe
  • Grand Prix Auto Race
  • Stat Capital Quiz
  • Hangman Spelling Game
title: People's Software: Tape 1 Level II

description:
People's Software: Tape 4 Level I is a compilation of programs taken from the public domain and adapted for the TRS-80. It includes a variety of non-game software such as tools for cash registers, math problems, business perecentages, and a Christmas graphic.

The games include:

  • Action on the Enterprise
  • Chase
  • Commander-in-Chief
  • Deep Dark Secrets
  • Air Raid
title: People's Software: Tape 4 Level I

description:
People's Software: Tape 5 Level II is a compilation of programs taken from the public domain and adapted for the TRS-80. It includes a variety of non-game software such as tools lineprinters, check balancing, databases, RAM memory test, mortgage payments, factoring and diet planning.

The games include:

  • Mind Bender
  • Spelling Bee
  • Star Trek III
  • Star Wars
  • Klingon Capture
  • Knights
title: People's Software: Tape 5 Level II

description:
Package #1 is a package of two games:

  • Spore Attack is a game in which the player is tasked to collect rock samples on Mars. However spores might attack to thwart the player.
  • Gas Guzzler is a variant on The Sumer Game, but instead of managing a kingdom the player manages a gas station.
title: Package #1

description:
Package #2 is a package of three games:

  • Quickdraw is a game for two players in which both play an outlaw and must try to shoot first.
  • Human Cannonball allows the player to fire men out of a cannon at a given start velocity.
  • Slot Machine is a simulation of a gambling machine.
title: Package #2

description:
Package #3 is a package of two games:

  • Space Mission 9 is a space exploration game in which uncharted space is explored by the player. The player can encounter planets, thermal barriers and enemy spacecraft.
  • Landmine requires the player to get their men across a minefield. Most mines are clearly visible but some are invisible.
title: Package #3

description:
Microcosm I is a compilation of thirty programs, including nine games. The games include:

  • News Photographer
  • South Pole
  • Driver
  • Atlantis
title: Microcosm I

description:
Games Pack 2 is two previously released games for the TRS-80.

  • Defense Command
  • Stellar Escort
title: Games Pack Two

description:
Games Pack Three is a compilation of two previously released games for the TRS-80.

  • Cosmic Fighter
  • Meteor Mission 2
title: Games Pack Three

description:
Bank Robbery is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player must escape the police as they move through a maze which reveals the secret combination to a safe. If the player hits the wrong number of the combination they must restart the adventure.
title: Bank Robbery

description:
Rat Maze Mania is an arcade game for the TRS-80.

The object of the game is to guide the rat from the lower left corner of the maze through to the upper right corner without being caught by the dog. The player retrieves a piece of cheese, and attempts to return it back to the bottom left corner. The player's score is calculated from a 5000 point timer, and the player loses a life if they're caught by the dog or time runs out. The player starts with 3 rats, and a new rat is awarded for every 10,000 points. The game becomes faster each maze.
title: Rat Maze Mania

description:
Medieval Magic is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

Wandering down an overgrown path in the gathering darkness, the player continues on, driven by their adventurous spirit. Finally, they come across an ancient abandoned medieval castle deep in the forest. Entering through the arched doorway, the iron gate falls shut behind. The player must brave the dangers of the castle, encountering levitating ropes, trap doors, and evil skeletons. The goal is to recover the treasures and escape from the castle alive.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Medieval Magic

description: A couple of strolling friends are intercepted by an unknown person outside a television studio. After a short exchange of words, the person ushers the pair into the studio, since as it turns out they have just been picked to participate in a live music quiz show. Name That Song is a music quiz game that emulates the format and presentation of a live TV show. Two human players pit their music knowledge against each other, while the computer impersonates the host. The game consists of three rounds with slightly different rules, where the computer plays random songs which players attempt to identify by listening to and to name the title, if they actually know it. Each correct answer adds to the individual contestant's score and at the end of the third round the grand winner is announced. Each player has a buzzer assigned to a specific key on the keyboard and the interface accepts text input for player's answers. A limited amount of flashy, animated graphics is used, but of course the game relies almost entirely on the musical notes the hardware puts out. The game has a number of tunes stored on disk and also includes a separate editor that lets users compose and save their own to incorporate in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...whose name is again shown on a flashy, animated screen.
The second part was won by the guy on the right, aptly named "Rival Player"
First things first, you are prompted to set the audio output level on your computer.

title: Name That Song

description:
Iago is a 1-player versus computer version of Othello for the TRS-80.

Played on an 8x8 board, the computer and player take turns placing pieces. Each turn, the player captures all opponent pieces positioned between two of their own pieces. Available positions are displayed, and the player types in their coordinates. Seven levels of computer difficulty are available.
title: Iago

description:
Ice World War is a text adventure for the TRS-80.

The player has been tasked with shuttling the awaiting alien ambassador from an icy world to the peace ceremonies in orbit around the planet. As the player attempts to land, their ship is shot down and they are badly injured. The player explores the icy land and cities, and must find and rescue the ambassador, and discover a way to return to orbit once again. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Ice World War

description:
Warriors and Warlocks: Scenario - Castle Myrhavell is a role-playing game for the TRS-80.

Guarding the entrance to a mountain pass are the remains of a citadel known to the nearby villages as Castle Myrhavell. The townspeople no longer travel there, but passing adventurers will find a few shops that sell equipment, and the Monastery will provide the healing arts for the wounded or enchanted. The player's goal is to create characters strong enough to explore the deepest parts of the Castle.

Play begins at the Warriors' Inn. It is here that the player recruits characters. Character attributes include intelligence, wisdom, intuition, ego, piety, courage, strength, agility, dexterity, luck, and vitality. Character classes include fighter, warrior, bowman, archer, cleric, priest, mage, sorcerer, wizard, necromancer, thief, or warlock. The player can purchase supplies and equipment from the Armory at the Warriors' Inn, and can heal wounds and regain spells here.

The castle is explored from a 3D perspective, and the player can move left, right, or forwards. The player can camp, where they can wait to be rescued by other parties or trade equipment or equip a character. During encounters the player can cast mage, cleric, or necromancer spells.
title: Warriors and Warlocks: Scenario - Castle Myrhavell

description:
Monsters Lair is a 1-player roleplaying game for the TRS-80.

The player creates a starting character from statistics of strength, constitution, intelligence, dexterity, wisdom, charisma, hit points, character level, unadjusted armor class, and magical AC bonuses. The player leaves their starting area, and can explore numerous rooms in a large dungeon level. In each room is a randomly generated opponent. The player automatically exchanges blows when close to the enemy. The player can continue to battle until the enemy is defeated, or run away. The player can return to the starting point at any time to regain vitality or retire their character for a final score.
title: Monsters Lair

description:
Sparrow Commander is an arcade game for the TRS-80, and sequel to Kitchen Sink.

As brave commander of the Sparrows, the player must ensure bird survival. The player must guide the Sparrows safely to their nesting ground amidst the barrage of shells, safes, and sinks the Cloud people rain down upon them. The player must also avoid the Boat People that fire at the Sparrows from below.
title: Sparrow Commander

description:
Kitchen Sink is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80.

The player controls the Cloud People as they try to protect their castle from the Sparrows with whatever they can muster, including the kitchen sink.
title: Kitchen Sink

description:
Hyperlight Patrol is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80.

As the commander of a single starcruiser, the player has been sent to a remote border region to investigate the reported presence of an Empire invasion fleet. The player's mission is to investigate the area and report and ideally attempt to destroy all enemy forces there.

The player's ship has limited energy reserve, shield strength, phaser power, and torpedo power. The ship is armed with forward and aft phasers and torpedoes, and ship damage is displayed on the status screen. Power can be diverted to different ship systems. The player can explore a total of 16 areas to evaluate for enemy vessels.
title: Hyperlight Patrol

description:
Wonderland Adventure is a text adventure for children for the TRS-80, and the second part of the Magical Trilogy.

Fairytales and nursery rhymes are used in this adventure, as well as some well known cartoon characters like Mickey Mouse and Tom and Jerry.
title: Wonderland Adventure

description:
Dreamworld is a text adventure for the TRS-80, and the third part of the Magical Trilogy.

The player moves between the dream and waking world while trying to collect 12 treasures and exploring a total of 35 locations.

Contains story elements from Oliver Twist, The Wizard of Oz, A Christmas Carol, Peter Pan, Jack and Jill, Ding Dong Bell, Old King Cole, Little Jack Horner, and Santa Claus.
title: Dreamworld
